Reviews.Title: “Functional”
Reviews.Author: GreenTurtle138
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Great location for exploring the city without having to stay right in the centre. Near to all the art galleries and museums. Rooms were nice but a bit basic and functional, not a lot too them really. Amenities were OK, it would have been nice to have had an ipod dock. View out of the windo was horrible, just the flat roof of an adjoining building and some back alleys. Only one aspect of the hotel would have given a nice view of the city so try to get a room at the front of the building. Staff were friendly and helpful though they didn't even point us in the direction of our room let alone give us any help with our bags. Breakfast was overpriced. We walked into the sqare opposite the hotel for breakfast in the morning where the cafes and restaurants were excellent value. This is probably great as a hotel if you're on business and good for people who are a bit older and want to visit the city but not stay in the commotion of the centre and the red light distrct.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Best place to stay in Amsterdam.”
Reviews.Author: paloki
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a wonderful stay in Amsterdam. This hotel had a major role in making it so great. Near the central station and major public transportation. Service was excellent. The staff was very helpful in helping us plan our stay in the country. All our special requests were quickly responded to. For example, my wife wanted additional pillows. My wife was very happy with the bed and sleep quality.

Reviews.Title: “lovely rooms, expensive breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: nicki87
Reviews.Content: the rooms were lovely, but there was really expenisive breakfast so that's why I had a ham roll instead.

Reviews.Title: “LocationX3; ServiceX3”
Reviews.Author: LesDye
Reviews.Content: The perfect location, near Van Gogh, Vondelpark, the Southern Canal Belt and easy access uptown (Old or New side) via street cars. When you're adapting to new time zones and clearing jet lag, sometimes a nap is in order. The housekeeping staff made our bed, replaced towels, cleaned as needed not only in the mornings, but in the late afternoons, too. Nothing better than a room with a thermostat that keeps the room temp as you like it; and a window that opens for fresh air when you want it. The linens, towels and comforter were 1st quality. The Exec Lounge had diverse options for breakfast, everything was wonderful, from the herring to the pastries to the coffee. And in the evenings, appetizers were superb, the cocktails and wine self serve. Fabulous. The service was unsurpassed in every respect. What a treat to stay at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel with expensive breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Scandinavian01
Reviews.Content: Marriott Amsterdam is a charming hotel with old fashion interiors that may need an upgrade in the next couple of years. The staff is very friendly. You immediately get a nice feeling in this hotel. But this hotel was perhaps top standard 10 years ago and may need an upgrade and refurbishing to stay in the top league. It is still very good though with nice and clean rooms with refurbished bathrooms. The bar is very nice with friendly staff as well. What may surprise someone used to visit other top standard european hotels is that internet access comes at a pretty high charge. This service is more often than not free at hotels like this in Europe nowadays. Another surprise is the high prices when you pay you breakfast if it is not included in the room charge. A standard breakfast with warm items like bacon etc is almost twice as expensive compared to for instance Radisson... But the hotel is in a very good location for Amsterdam sightseeing close to Rijksmuseum an the Van Gogh museum. You also have restaurants and shopping nearby. All in all if you forget about the extra expenses at this hotel you get a good experience at a nice hotel with good atmosphere and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: BacardiCheltenham
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Amsterdam for 3 nights over the Easter weekend. On arrival, we checked in and were told that although we had booked a family room (2 king beds), they didn't have them available. Therefore, we had a queen bed with a foldaway bed. It meant that 3 of us would have to share the queen. To compensate, we were offered full breakfast for the 4 of us for the duration of our stay (3 nights) so we were happy to take the room. When having breakfast on the first morning, we realised we had saved a fortune as it wasn't cheap! The room (847) was clean and comfortable. I liked that there was a safe which you didn't have to pay for and we had tea and coffee making facilities. There was also an iron and ironing board as well as a hair dryer. When searching for a hotel in Amsterdam, I came across several 2* hotels which weren't that much cheaper than what we paid so I think we got excellent value for money. We ate in the Midtown Restaurant one night and the food was superb. It's a shame the service let the restaurant down. On arrival at the restaurant, service was very good but as they got busier, we were forgotten. For what we paid, I would expect better service. The hotel is in a great area, close to shops, restaurants and trams. We walked everywhere and you can't really get lost! We went on a one hour canal boat ride which cost 29 euros for 2 adults and 2 children. We didn't join it in the Leidesplein area, it was closer to L'hotel de Europe. We ate out in an Italian restaurant (Antonio's) and wouldn't recommend it. To say the food was bland would be an understatement! Amsterdam seems to be full of Italian restaurants. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel ... great location”
Reviews.Author: SangPei
Reviews.Content: Nice Marriott in a great location. The executive lounge is very good for break. The hotel is also pet friendly! We'd go again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Location fantastic, staff very welcoming.”
Reviews.Author: JamacianEE
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the Marriott, and allocated our room immediately. Service was brilliant from the moment we arrived. Room with 2 double beds was very clean and spacious. Ideal location in middle of Amsterdam square so shops and places to eat/drink were all within walking distance. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but expensive for what it offers”
Reviews.Author: ana_and_pedro
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms, nice staff, ok location. Problem are the extras. 20 eur a day for wifi, 50 eur a day for parking, etc. rooms are not large but the beds are excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: sam d
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights in this hotel and used it as our base for touring Amsterdam. Room was clean and well laid out and the bed very comfortable. Trams within walking distance and virtually take you anywhere in Amsterdam, the Canal Bus also opposite which is worth a go, although this does cost 22 euros each for the full day as you cannot buy just a trip on one route. The trams costs 2.70 euro each and if you go back within the hour your return journey is free. The aran irish pub near the hotel is a great place to chill out and is full of characters. We ate a couple of times in the Rancho Argentinian steak house.... very very nice and located directly across from the marriott and about 2 doors up from the burger king. Only thing I can critise the hotel for is the fact after a long day travelling, flight delays and arriving at the hotel late, it would have been nice to have tea/coffee facilities in the room, which is a bit of a surprise. All the breakast at 26 euros each is very steep.... we didnt bother and went to the starbucks which is in walking distance. It also can be quite noisy as our room was road side next to the busy main street... not ideal if a light sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “Great Breakcation”
Reviews.Author: hellsbells42
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed 3 nights here and really happy we decided to pay a little more and opt for the Marriott rather than be closer to the center of the action and the hustle & bustle. Perfect location for us, walked all over the city and back to our peaceful hotel at night. Pro's *Great size comfortable superking beds *Clean & quiet *Mini bar & Fridge to store your own water *Didnt see housekeeping - We were out by 10am Usually returned by 3-4pm and they'd already been *Allowed us to check in at 11am which was a real bonus after a very early flight Friendly staff Cons * Aircon on the lowest setting wasnt cool enough for me - Luckily the windows opened as it was a warm & sunny weekend & room got quite stuffy *Breakfast was included in our rate, was great but I wouldnt pay the steep price otherwise - there are lots of breakfast places within a short walk *Wifi charges - About time these large hotels kitted out all rooms with free wifi All in all a great trip and I would definitely return to this hotel if i visit Amsterdam again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Western hotel in Amstrdam”
Reviews.Author: tamac9601
Reviews.Content: The Marriott in Amsterdam is very comfortable, clean and offers typical amenities for Western travelers, including traditional hot breakfast items. The staff is courteous and professional. Centrally located, the hotel offers great access to restaurants, abundant shopping and tourist attractions, including canal tour operators within a 5 minute walk. Highly recommended if you value comfort, convenience and few surprises.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Brian P
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights at the Marriott. Great stay overall. Great service. We arrived at 7am from an international flight and they allowed us to check-in without a hassle. They also provided us with an upgrade due to my status as a Platinum Marriott Rewards Member. Rooms are clean, comfortable, and modern. The only shortcoming was the shower which was tiny - very difficult for someone 6'0 tall to use. The location is unbeatable - perfect in every way. The executive lounge is great too, saved us hundreds of dollars. Would definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “nice location”
Reviews.Author: agata83
Reviews.Content: 3 of us stayed in January for a little birthday weekend.amazing location,we could just walk everywhere ,great and smooth check in .we got the room on the 7th floor so the view was quite nice as well.room was big enough,quiet and comfy.we were only having breakfasts at the hotel - the best part of the whole stay !herrings,wafers,amazing choises of the hot items .

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable with some lovely extra touches for a special stay”
Reviews.Author: minijudithfromleigh
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here using our Marriott Points as a treat for our 14th wedding anniversary. We arrived at Amsterdam central and took the number 5 tram - although you can also take the number 1 and 2...a quick and easy journey if you have an amsterdam travel card but not so easy if you don't. We arrived early, 10am, but our room was ready and they had upgraded us to an executive room on the 10th floor. The receptionist was very helpful and also recommended trips to make our stay special - I believe you can buy tickets to all the local attractions from the hotel concierge. Our room was very nice, clean and comfortable - the bathroom had a bath and shower and the usual complimentary toiletries. We left our bags, and went straight out to explore. There are plenty of things to see and do - but you will need to take plenty of money as everything is expensive. We enjoyed a 75 minute canal cruise which took in most of the sights and gave us plenty of ideas as to where to see on foot. After an exhausting day, we got back to the hotel and within minutes a knock at the door - a bottle of sparkles and strawberries as a anniversary gift - what a lovely surprise and how very thoughtful. Thank you very much! We found the bed to be very large and comfortable, and the room was very quiet - it was a great stay. We didnt have breakfast, so I cannot comment on this. The next morning, check out was efficient and again the staff were friendly and courteous. I would mention that I found the bike lanes and tram lines harrowing - if my children had been with us I would have had a nervous breakdown!! You really have to watch where you are walking at all times. The bike lanes which are not clearly marked will have hundreds of bike riders riding quickly most of the time, and in amongst them moped and small electric cars are also allowed - if you don't look, you stand a high chance of being knocked over....same goes for the trams. On our second day we decided to have a wander around the red light district - to see what all the fuss is about.....I didn't feel safe, lots of men in groups everywhere...women in windows with not alot on, and the high perfume of wacky backy in the air. We saw people walking through the sex shops and down these seedy streets with their children - totally unsuitable for any child in my opinion. As for eating and drinking, there are restaurants and bars all over - the further away from the crowds the better value for money you will get. If you want a top end restaurant I would book as the whole city was packed on the saturday night. Overall we had a great weekend - the Marriott was a lovely base for our stay and it is central to all attractions. Highly recommend and thank them again for making it a great weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Travelingilly
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a couple of years ago. Friendly staff and helpful. Nice bar street level looking out toward Leidseplein across the canal. Vondel Park is their central park and was one block away. Leidseplein is a hub of activity from restaurants to bars to canal boat rides. Trams and buses run right by the hotel. All major sights are within a leisurely walk. Stayed here 6 nights and was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and standard amenities”
Reviews.Author: Ben P
Reviews.Content: This isn't exactly a Dam Square or Central Station location, but it's still fantastic. A little towards the "outskirts," but still within walking distance of Vondelpark, breweries, coffeeshops, the Leidsplein (sp?), and many choice restaurants. Also, as far as amenities, they're full of them. I like this hotel when I want something just a tad quieter than a hotel near Central Station/Dam Square.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: tweetySP
Reviews.Content: Reception was warm, very professional and able to provide useful information. Rooms were spacious, clean, with sober decoration and equipped with all the facilities and amenities you would expect in a room of that quality and price. I just missed a bigger wardrobe, but this seems to be a trend of this kind of hotels currently. Bathroom was clean and with a good suply of towels and amenities. Good shower, good warm water supply. Internet connexion worked well, as expected, either wifi or ethernet, so nothing to say about that. Silence and peace at night to sleep, even staying at the second floor. Service was OK, too. Breakfast had some good choices, but more expensive than I would expect, so not sure it is worth the money you pay for it.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent Location!”
Reviews.Author: Renata09
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Marriott Amsterdam for a weekend getaway and I got a champagne package which was included breakfast and one bottle of champagne and strawberries per day . It was a good and lovely deal. The hotel location is excellent , its walking distance of Vondelpark, Van Gog Museum , Concertgebouwn, Heineken Experience, House of Bols and Coktails etc. Rooms are confortable and clean, Marriot Standart, good service and restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Family Trip”
Reviews.Author: Glenn H
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took our two daughters (ages 13 and 11) to Amsterdam and had a wonderful extended weekend. The hotel is in a perfect location for exploring the city, we were able to walk to everything that we wanted to see. The concierge was extremely helpful in recommending restaurants and we were able to prepurchase tickets to all of the museums. We had access to the executive lounge and were impressed with both the breakfast and the evening hors d'ouvres and drinks. We will definately stay here on our return trips.

Reviews.Title: “Fails My Standard”
Reviews.Author: Radarman123
Reviews.Content: OK I am a very picky traveler. I travel for business and therefore business is key. When I can't get a taxi or the hotel has a poor internet connection -- hotel is a failure. I just stayed - there right in the middle of their switch to Wifi. Even the Ethernet cable had issues -- they do not have enough IP addresses for the number of guests in the hotel. Got knocked off repeatedly and VPN did not work. The rooms are slightly on the small side - this is typical Amsterdam. Beds are great -- very Marriott. Hotel service is friendly. Food is OK. Lounge is big. Now if they just would fix the avilability of Taxis and the Internet - hotel would work for me but right now it does not!

Reviews.Title: “excellent!!!”
Reviews.Author: Aggeliki I
Reviews.Content: very good hotel .. the staff spoke very good english and was very helpfull!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lee H
Reviews.Content: Good standard hotel in an excellent position. Marriott you always know what to expect and are seldom dissappointed,

Reviews.Title: “Large and comfortable rooms, a bit standard”
Reviews.Author: mourspe
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect conference hotel, but I would not choose it as a place to spend my vacation. The rooms are large and comfortable. The heating/cooling system is not optimal, though. Pretty noisy ventilation and a draft if AC is on. Internet is far too expensive if not covered by the conference charge. Excellent breakfast and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “American costly style”
Reviews.Author: voyageur072
Reviews.Content: Pure american standard style hotel: large and comfortable rooms, obsequious but not so friendly service. You are in Amsterdam but this could have been everywhere in the word. I don't like the building design but the inside design is fine (but not breath taking). The location is convenient as close to museums and well deserved by public transportation, but not in core center town. Overall it's ok except the prices. The room itself is expensive but let say the price is fair. But at that price you could expect some free services. And nothing is for free. Internet : 20â‚¬ a day, breakfeast : 26â‚¬! etc...

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: SaarB
Reviews.Content: The location is superb, just across many restaurants and some tram stations. Service , breakfast and the room are at the highest level.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: EworksMA
Reviews.Content: I've been lucky enough to stay at this Marriott when on business in Amsterdam. I've been waiting for a chance to bring my family and show them the hotel and city. As was the case in all of my previous visits, our stay was great and the city interesting/easy to get around in. First a little about the hotel: Staff - first class, professional, and extremely helpful. Everyone speaks English (in fact everyone in the city does) We had interconnecting rooms - 723/725. Large, spacious, clean, and a great view of the city. The only drawback was that there is no wireless internet but this was being installed during our stay and will be available next month. The executive lounge - very nice. Complete breakfast buffet and snacks/drinks after 5:00. A great perk if you can get access. The location - perfect. Across the street from one of the most active parts of the city and near the museums. Everything is walking distance (street car stop is nearby if you get tired). We had hamburgers at the cafe downstairs and they were excellent. On another night, we had dinner at the steakhouse and it's the same caliber as a Ruth's Chris/Morton's. Some travel tips: For us, 2 days in the city was enough to see the major sites. Rijksmuseum Anne Frank House Red Light District Canal tour Rembrandt House The city is easy to get around in and you can walk to almost anything. I did stop at the "3 Bottles", a several hundred year old bar near Dam Square that was featured on Anthony Bourdain's "Layover" show about Amsterdam. Order a "Walk in the Woods" and take the first sip with your hands behind your back (see the show). I've been to a lot of Marriotts and this is one of my favorites. I'll definitely come again. ****

Reviews.Title: “Standard American Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SFExpat
Reviews.Content: Granted - this hotel is much improved since the last time I stayed there in 2006 after renovation. The location is excellent. However the room is nothing special, the service is just OK. The breakfast was so-so and not impressed with the service. Prices are high for breakfast and internet. So this is why I give it an average rating - just not so impressed from a price/quality standpoint.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot”
Reviews.Author: paulfair
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 night stay with my wife and 10 year-old son. Booked an executive room, which in my opinion was worth the extra money. Complimentary hos dâ€™oeuvres, deserts and drinks (alcoholic and non-alcoholic) during the evening, breakfast in the lounge, wired & wireless (lobby area) internet access, as well as tea/coffee and soft drinks during the day. Service at the hotel was very good and as many people have already commented, the location is great. Museums, bars and restaurants are easily accessible by foot or using the nearby trams. Transport to the hotel was straightforward. We decided to take the Connexion 197 Schiphol Sternet bus from the airport to Leidesplein. The bus stops just across the bridge from the Marriott, opposite the CafÃ© Americain. It was a hassle-free way to get to the hotel. It took just 30 minutes (no changes) and cost 4 Euro each, payable on board. Would I stay at this hotel again? For sure.

Reviews.Title: “Always a pleasure to return here”
Reviews.Author: See-Tai-Fan
Reviews.Content: This is our third time here, we love it. The location is great, at the nice side of the town away from the railway station (which is a very downmarket area). The view is great looking back along the main street, there are trams at the front door. The rooms are clean and comfortable and the staff are friendly and helpful. The lobby has been renovated. The downstairs restaurant is a little limited (unless you like red meat) but there are many restaurants within easy walking distance so you have plenty of choice. There is plenty to see and do nearby. Overall it is a very enjoyable experience to be here and we will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BJLIreland
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights and really enjoyed it, staff were excellent and the facilities and location were super. Our room overlooked the square and it was lovely to watch the world go by!! The executive lounge was excellent and the food was super. We ate in Midtown Grill and service and food was super. Van Gogh Museum and Anna Frank are a must so well organised and yes go early to both. Shopping was a pleasure with many lovely shops, we didnt get to do a Canal Cruise as the canals were frozen. Yes we will return to this city and the Marriott hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Typical Marriott”
Reviews.Author: nongagkram
Reviews.Content: So when say typical Marriott that is not a bad thing. Stayed here on last night of two week Europe trip and had a great night sleep. AS much as I like the European Hotels is always good to be back in a familiar chain. Rooms were quiet, air conditioned (even in winter I use for the â€œwhite noiseâ€�), and clean. I did not eat at hotel but the extra cold Heineken on tap was great. Location is just across street from main market square and near flower market and all attractions. Have hotel arrange taxi to airport. If you only have a night or two this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “location is worth the price”
Reviews.Author: NesRobson
Reviews.Content: location is the best point for this hotel, near the trams, canals, shopping, food, all you need, even if it's a short stay. staff are friendly, services are prompt and excellent. stayed at a 2 double bedded room, room size is a tad small but again, will do for a short stay. crisp sheets, well kept room and bathroom is good sized. overall, good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location to explore Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Illinoisresident
Reviews.Content: The Marriott downtown Hotel in Amsterdam is well located, at center of the city. Walking distance to the Canal bout tours, shops, Hardrock Cafe, restaurants and park. We stayed there as family and only need to take the taxi from airport to hotel, the rest of time, we walked around. Travel trip: if traveling on short time & no time to go to the famous Windmill locales, there is a nearby windmill site you can see near Amsterdam city along our way back to he airport.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel. Even the location is good.”
Reviews.Author: Thekman1964
Reviews.Content: Just scored this hotel on Priceline for 75 Euro per night for 2 nights. Good hotel with friendly staff. Unlike a lot of 5 start hotels, the reception decor is roughly the same standard as the decor in the rooms. The only small problem was noisy A/C in my room. I found the noise quite soothing, my partner found it annoying. Go figure. If in doubt, avoid Room 600.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...”
Reviews.Author: Allen W
Reviews.Content: to watch it snow and the canals freeze. In Amsterdam in January for a trade show at the RAI. -10C with wind chills of -20C all week, but the hotel and staff were up to it. Great bar and reception area, decent buffet or ala cart breakfast. Rooms weren't that big but very clean, modern and functional with a safe, ironing board/iron, honor bar, LCD TV and large desk. No WiFi, just Ethernet internet access. Another important "no": NO ALARM CLOCKS in the room. Doormen were terrific getting us taxis that took credit cards. Taxi service is very good and reasonable for a business trip (11 euros to the RAI, 35 to the airport). As noted, the hotel is walking distance to a number of places, including, but not previously mentioned, the Heineken Brewery Experience (religious pilgrimage), Little Buddha Chinese restaurant and the Jazz Cafe Alto. The only caution - there is a major bike path right outside the front door. With 700,000 bicycles for 800,000 citizens, the odds of getting run over by a herd of bicycles before you cross the street are astronomically high (if you don't look both ways).

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: cathhhyyyyyyy
Reviews.Content: Within walking distance for a number of the museums/sights of Amsterdam - Van Gogh museum, Flower market, Canal tours, Anne Frank's house - ideal for seeing all that Amsterdam has to offer. Rooms were spacious and well equipped. Let down in terms of value for money - charging for wi-fi, no breakfast and really slow service at the bar.

Reviews.Title: “Good value. Good location.”
Reviews.Author: DAWiles
Reviews.Content: Great location in town. Nice facility. Very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Sleep over at Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: MITawfik
Reviews.Content: It was a part of 24 Hr i did spend at Amesterdam, Nice room with a view, Hardrock cade cross street and harbor for canal tour and a lot of attractive site are at walking distance from hotel unfortunatly i haven't enough time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: juliaburns
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel - spent christmas there last year. It was in a great location, the room was modern and comfortable although a little on the small side. We paid extra for a balcony room and the balcony was more like a ledge - no tables of chairs out there..but the view of the christmas markets was amazing. Breakfast was lovely and the chef made amazing eggs benadict. 5 minute walk to the ice skating rink at the van gough.. lots of bars and restaurants within a 5 minute walk too. Loved it. Would recommend (it was a little bit pricey though!!)

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: ornitom
Reviews.Content: The hotel was really nice (the common rooms) . Reception and concierge were very very kind and helpful : nobody accepted a â‚¬ 500 note and they changed easily in small ones. The rooms are too small for a family and not perfect clean and tidy. The house keeping manager was very kind and apologized for the situation : she sent a basket of fruit and some beverages to us. The location is wonderful and you can easily reach the museum area and dowtown walking or taking trams and buses (we had the City card Iamsterdam so that we could jump the queue for museums). The gym in the hotel was very nice and clean and breakfast was very rich and fresh.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Traveler190511
Reviews.Content: Stayed by using my Marriott points and was upgraded to a executive room overseeing the canals. Nice room but toilet and sink didn't work properly. As said many times before here, no wireless in the rooms which is quite bad. Avoid using the phones as the rates are ridiculous. Valet parking fee is â‚¬ 49 which is very expensive, if you don't mind walking, better use a public parking nearby. It was pouring with rain but we couldn't get an umbrella from the hotel, very disappointing! The Rijksmuseum and Van Gogh are nearby. The concierge sells tickets at cost price and that helps you to jump the long queues, good service! The breakfast in the exec lounge was ok, nothing special. Didn't try the restaurant as there as so many good places to eat nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Jz_006
Reviews.Content: The hotel has an excellent location. Behind the hotel, there is a park and a swan lake. It is beautiful and scenic. Buy some food from the supermarket (15 mins walk away) and you can conveniently picnic there! Cross the road and you are at the entrance of the hustle bustle walking street. Within 10 mins radius, you can find the van gogh, "I AMSTERDAM" sign, heineken brewery... ... The hotel also provides tour packages to the wind mill tour, cheese factory & madurodam (miniature city). The staff are very helpful and friendly when I ask them to recommend me some good resturant to go to. The rooms are small but very comfortable. Overall, I enjoyed my stay in Amsterdam, marriot hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Ray72mond
Reviews.Content: Being a Marriott one would expect the best of everything & this hotel is just that. Mind you , Breakfast was very poor value for money. 100 meters accross the canal there are endless eateries with great breakfasts from 6 Euros for coffee, bacon & eggs.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel with easy access to museums”
Reviews.Author: yb1uk
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights - 3 days at the hotel. The staff are professional, knowledgeable and smart, the hotel restruant is very good, the steak we had was excellent. we stayed in an executive room which meant we had access to the lounge, again good facillity but we forgot it was school holidays and there were a number of children running around and squarking! The museums are within easy walking distance but remember to buy tickets on line before you go the ques are big and standing around in the cold won't be much fun. Also the shopping is good nearby. Trams take you into the centre quickly and we found this to be the best form of transport. So if you are going to Amsterdam you could find the Marriott is just the place for you, also it is reasonably priced altthough parking is expensive at 49 euros per night. We enjoyed the city and the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Leidseplein Area Hotel”
Reviews.Author: parvati7
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a few days between Christmas and New Year and got both rooms (4th floor) with points. They faced an apartment building and had a limited view (out of the right side) of the Leidseplein area. I thought the rooms were fantastic. The mattresses, covers, and sheets looked brand new and very clean. My bed was comfortable, with soft pillows and I liked the tiny reading light that was attached to the headboard. Some hotel rooms appear dusty and these didn't. The only gripe I had was that a small set of glass shelves in the bathroom were dusty. Otherwise, the room appeared spotless. The closet (10 wooden hangers, by the way), contained a safe and an ironing board/iron. There was also ample drawers in a bureau in front of the bed. Yes, the service bar is a rip-off but it had a nice selection of snacks and drinks (at least 3 bottles of water available). I can't comment on the television or its capabilities, I never turned it on. The price for the wireless available in the lobby was outrageous and there is no wifi, only ethernet in the rooms, as many others on here have noted. I had no need of it but my traveling companions weren't happy about it. Evidently, there is a hotel nearby that has wireless and which makes their service available for purchase by credit card but its reliability was sketchy (2 bars) and service could drop off suddenly. The bathroom was modern and well-stocked with towels and toiletries. The shower was another matter altogether - sort of a hassle with its adjustable height. Also, you need to pull the knob above the faucet to turn on the nozzle and I managed to pull it right off of its resting place. Plenty of hot water. The grill downstairs is expensive but the food is very good. There was a good assortment of fruit, o.j., grapefruit juice, milk, coffee, tea. Scrambled eggs, oven roasted tomatoes, potatoes, baked beans (?!?), and then, on another table, pastries, bread and pancakes. Maple syrup must be an anomaly there, it had fairly become concrete in its jug. A very comfortable and bright restaurant, though. Dinner was phenomenal. The location is wonderful - within walking distance to many cafes, some stores, and the 9 streets shopping area. Also, the water taxi kiosk and its dock/pickup point is in walking distance (say, 2 minutes) from the Marriott's front door and you can buy tickets there. A few tips - Amsterdam is known for its rain. Bring an umbrella. Also, housekeeping will not try to enter your room if you leave the "do not disturb" sign hanging outside on your door. If you like massages, there is a place not too far away (maybe 10-15 min. walk) called Koan/Float, or some such. Try calling when you arrive, though, they were booked solid. Also, I was informed by the concierge that the hotel can arrange for a massage therapist (they have a 2nd floor area which is used for this purpose), with about 2 hours notice. There is a small gift shop downstairs with a limited amount of toiletries - tooth paste, etc. Everyone at the front desk, the restaurant, housekeeping and the gift shop were very nice. We stayed in the city during a time when many of the restaurants were closed. Because of this the restaurants that were open were jam packed. The concierge was the best. He called 4-5 different places one day in order to get us in somewhere. Also, you can get some museum tickets at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: ihgelap
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights via Marriott rewards. Room was nice and clean, average size. It's quite convenient, about a block away from the museum, canal cruise dock, restaurants, and tram stop (about half hour away from the train station) Through the Marriott reward membership, we got access to the club room, which provides excellent finger foods, deserts, and drinks nightly.

Reviews.Title: “A lot of money and not much in return”
Reviews.Author: fergy2
Reviews.Content: I understand that hotels in Amsterdam are at a premium, especially one in a good location like the Marriott Amsterdam. However, I would have expected more for the money. The room was average, not bad, not great, rooms on the smallish side. Bed way too soft for my taste. Seemed old and well-used; not up to standard. Cleanliness was average. Breakfast not included, and we weren't going to pay the exorbitant rate to try it. Overall, an average stay at an overpriced hotel. What made me rate this hotel "poor" rather than just average was having to pay for internet access, EVEN IN THE LOBBY. In this day and age, a hotel that charges their guests to use the internet is one that should be ashamed of themselves, especially a hotel that calls itself a business hotel. It doesn't cost the hotel much to provide this service, and it's just a sign of cheapness and bad service. Very poorly done, Marriott - and that was the last time I stay at one of your hotels. My Marriott Rewards card went into the trash after that stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: 4crest
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect! Take the train from the airport and get off at Leidseplein Square. Just look around and you'll see the hotel not too far away. It's less than a 5 minute walk. The location is walking distance to the museums, boat tour, places to eat, and shops. Tourist spots are easy to find because there are signs everywhere. The hotel is clean, bed comfortable, and staff so helpful. It's surprisingly quiet at night but the night life in the area is alive with people. Moreover, the food at the restaurant is delish for breakfast and dinner, though a little on the pricey side. Then again, just walk a little and there's lots of places to eat in the area. I love this place!

Reviews.Title: “Good location - no charm”
Reviews.Author: ccgworldtraveler
Reviews.Content: As you might expect from many international hotel chains, this property is like most other Marriotts - charmless and lacking uniqueness. I generally prefer more fashionable boutique type hotels so that is my bias. That said, although the lobby areas have all been recently renovated, there are still some areas that need improvement. The rooms are still very typically "Marriott" - more utilitarian than fashionable. The beds were awful - mattresses must have been so old and overused that when you got in them, the mattress sank in the middle and two of us rolled into the deep well in the middle. Not good for sleep. The towels, as usual, are thin, cheap and scratchy. There is no wifi in the rooms. You have to use the land line and then get a code you can use for wifi in the lobby - this is the 21st century people! Get with the technology program. AND, on top of that, it was slow and they charged 20 euros for 24 hours! Not worth it. Bathroom was on the small side, but toiletries were decent. Room had ample drawers for folded clothes. Closet was small and didn't have enough hangers. Room came with an iron/ironing board and a small safe to lock valuables. Room also had a minibar and free coffee/tea - however, I used the free morning cappuccino machine in the lobby - but you better run and get up early, for whatever cheap reason, they lock it up at like 8:30 in the morning. The doorman was very helpful one morning in pointing us to non touristy breakfast places. The evening concierge one night gave a great recommendation for a local, family owned Italian restaurant that was non touristy (it was amazing). The daytime concierge - not so great - recommended the predictable touristy locations even after I specifically said I didn't want that. For a city that has rainy weather often, one would expect the hotel has ample supply of umbrellas on hand, even if they need to charge a deposit to ensure they get them returned. Guess what - they didn't. Very very irritating when it's raining heavily and you want to go out and about. Check in and check out seemed fine. Hotel also arranged a car service to the airport for us but they want to charge 5 euros extra if you out it on your credit card - this should be an illegal practice. Overall, I would ot stay here again unless using points to stay for free. I certainly would ot pay to stay there. There are many other chic boutique hotels in town to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: frgad3c
Reviews.Content: We have spent a week in that hotel with the whole familly prior our relocation to the NL. The location to visit amsterdam is very convenient, the food - especially breakfast - is good as well as the service. The restaurant is expensive and noisy but the food is good quality. We have had a familly room with 2 double beds - maybe a little small for that price. The room was clean but the small balcony has not been cleaned.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid avoid”
Reviews.Author: faithfu7
Reviews.Content: Have to say that the location is good,we walk everywhere, bus 197 stop just across the hotel. The rooms are cozy , clean and consider big. However I am appalled by the service level of the team, beside the friendly porter, the rest of them ESP the front desk staff and the concierge are not warm or personal. I actually feel that I mustn't ask too much questions because I am taking up their time. I booked The Connexxion Schiphol Hotel Shuttle and they gave me the wrong info saying that they are always late usually 30 mins late, I think they wanted me to use their cab services maybe they earn some commission? On the actual day my cab came earlier and they had the cheeks to tell me the cab won't wait. Thankk God we insist to come down still and we did not ask them to call cab because my cab driver did not leave at all. The service of the hotel shuttle is great! Book them at the airport it is much cheaper. I am also disappointed that the hotel does not even have free wifi in the lobby and we are talking about a big brand hotel here, I can understand that one has to pay for wifi in the rooms but in the lobby?? Also I think the hotel room should have a flask... Overrall if given a choice again I will not choose this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Disgusted at the treatment, filthy rooms!!!”
Reviews.Author: Eve A
Reviews.Content: a group of 10 of us booked into the Marriot for a birthday weekend, the receptionist was polite but obviously overwhelmed by the amount of coloured ladies at her desk, once checked in we went to the rooms to relax, when we finally got into the sheets we found a blue toothbrush that did not belong to any of us under the duvet on one bed and on another a pen, these items did not belong to anyone within the group so it left us believing that the sheets had not been cleaned. the next morning a small group of us went out to view the sights that amsterdam had to offer, on return to the hotel one of our group members who had stayed behind said that a note was put under our door to say that we had requested not to have the room cleaned, which was untrue, so we had a full bin, untidy beds dirty towels and no restock of shower gel or body lotion, we then had to call to request this and at this point these issues were rectified. except for the sheets the next day i stayed in the room and met this houskeeping woman at the door and made it very clear to her that she was able to clean the room and left the card on the bed to have the sheets changed, she said she will return to do it once i had left, when we returned to the room i checked to see if the sheets had been changed on to my amazement the same sheets were still there. (there was a mall stain that i was watching to see if it had moved or disappeared), the hotel is filthy the management unhelpful and discriminative, i'm not one to complain and to be honest there was so much more that happened to add to this review but really dont want to waste anymore time on these people. oh to add in the rooms there is no kettle, no wifi unless paid for and the tv dosen't offer any thing either ive stayed in 2-3 star hotels that have these basic facilities available at much better rates and also in great locations so to be honest this place is not the best by far, id avoid staying here again its just not worth the aggro, i also think that they were upset that we didnt spend on the mini bar, but for a shot of vodka for 6euros is not value for money why would you spend it there. better to go out and source your food and drink, the food at the restaurant is poor. i mean the whole place is a shambles and not worth the money they ask you to pay for it..Avoid Avoid Avoid Avoid Avoid Avoid Avoid !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “My first time in Mariot”
Reviews.Author: robikkrobikk
Reviews.Content: I was thinking that Mariot is very high standart hotel byt in fackt no i was disapointed about staf. Room is no to big but comfortable perfect for one night. Kichen in this hotel is good i cant say any thing about that wrong. For Buisnes trip perfec quaiet good atmosphere to work and to relax

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: mct2
Reviews.Content: Good location. We walked everywhere from here. Trams also an option across the street from the hotel. Took bus #197 from airport, dropped us off right across the street from the hotel...takes about 40 mins to/from airport. 4 euros each way. Bus driver can provide change. Rooms where updated and clean. Bathroom was spacious. Good water pressure. Flat screen TV was a bit small, but I'm just being extremely picky here. We were in Amsterdam...watching TV would've been a waste of time anyways. In room safe was provided. We got the two double beds. Mattresses were softer than most hotels I've been to. Wasn't a problem for me, but this is always a matter of personal preference. Cons: Check-in was quick, but check-out was not. There was a line and not enough staff to handle check-ins and outs. Also, at the concierge desk, we asked to change some large notes into smaller ones and got some resistance which is uncharacteristic of a 5 star hotel. I realize they're not a bank, but they're a 5 star hotel in the middle of a tourist area...this should be a given for their guests. In the end, I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I thought better about Marriott...”
Reviews.Author: Dmitryvulkan
Reviews.Content: I was in Amsterdam for a couple of nights celebrating my birthday. During the check-in I got the look from the receptionist after she asked if I had a birthday today meaning if I were crazy to come on my bday to Marriott in Amsterdam. Obviously, no upgrade nor other usual acknowledgement from the hotel management. I was not expecting much but... it would have been nice... Additionally if you stay in this hotel expect that housekeeping will wake you up at 8am with loud knocking. Also do not expect much from a restaurant - no good food during the breakfast or just at the bar. The location is somewhat good but you need to walk a lot. This hotel would not be my first choice in Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “My first choice to stay in Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: Robyn_in_DallaGA
Reviews.Content: Love the location on the Leidseplein. Convenient walking area and easy access to the tram. Service, bar, lounges, and rooms are consistent and good.

Reviews.Title: “Bravo Marriot”
Reviews.Author: Globetrotting7
Reviews.Content: Well appointed and recently renovated the Marriot offers great service and the best night's sleep I have experienced in ages. Well located the property is a stone's throw from Vondelpark and the bustling nightlife of Leidseplein and is the perfect place for a weekend getaway or to setup base camp for some serious city exploration. In case you have some energy left at the end of the day the property features a solid gym with an array of new cardio machines and free weights. Also houses a relaxing bar and lounge offering a respite from the hustle and bustle of the city or the perfect launching point for a night on the town. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: smdath
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel! It was centrally located and made seeing everything and anything possible in the few days we had to spend there. The rooms were small but very comfortable and cozy. The Executive Lounge is outstanding! It was pricey when we visited - but was so worth it. Loved it and can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: lapeltje
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. The service is always top, the staff are always friendly, and the rooms are really spacious and quiet for a city centre hotel. I had room service breakfast which arrived on time and was really delicious, and not overpriced. The only issue I have with the Marriott is that they only provide internet by ethernet cable.. which is a pain as I usually travel with a smartphone and tablet. This needs to be upgraded, as I doubt any machines will have an ethernet port in a couple of years! (see Macbook air etc!)

Reviews.Title: “Average and over priced”
Reviews.Author: RLDublin
Reviews.Content: This is a standard out of the box Marriot, recently renovated, but nothing special. The location is good with most things within an easy walk and trams to Centraal Station outside the door. My only quibble is that they charge for everything - no free internet, the business centre requires payment to access and the hotel can be extremely expensive. Having said that Amsterdam is an expensive city, and you need to shop around. I've stayed on several occasions and the rooms vary quite a lot

Reviews.Title: “Great location, even better service!”
Reviews.Author: CircleofFriends
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights Nov. 18-20, 2011. I did LOTS of research before choosing this hotel and it paid off. We liked the Marriot for several reasons. First, location, location, location! Right across street and. bridge from main drag. Perfect! Second, the service was fabulous from the check-in person to the bell men to the concierge and guys behind desk. They were so helpful about directions, recommendations and any issues we had. For example, boarding passes wouldn't print so staff man took me into his office to his desk and did it for me. We had at least two mangers who were in the lobby just asking guests how everything was and helping guests. We were so impressed by the friendliness and helpfulness of all people we met in Amsterdam! Lastly, the beds were heavenly and we slept so well!! II would recommend this hotel to all. It is expensive but you get what you pay for and in this case it was worth it! We were there on vacation with our kids!

Reviews.Title: “A Typical Marriott but Great Location”
Reviews.Author: IraW_11
Reviews.Content: Amsterdam is crowded! This Marriott sits in the heart of the City but just far enough away from the crowds that allows you to breath. Easy walking to all major sights and shopping. A good selection if you want something reliable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and well located”
Reviews.Author: Andrea M
Reviews.Content: Perfectly located, just a bridge away from the city center and the main mueseums. The rooms are nice, decently sized and comfortable. Free tea/coffee available at the lobby. The tram station is in Leidseplein, taxis available near the hotel. The location is very convenient specially for first time tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing for the price”
Reviews.Author: Acornise
Reviews.Content: Paid â‚¬250 per night to stay here. This review is given with the room rate in mind. Staff - exceptionally helpful. Really could not have done more. Room - fairly nice. Not very big. Minibar was a laugh - â‚¬4 for a 500ml still water! â‚¬2 for a Mars Bar. What a laugh! Awful view from windows. Aircon worked well. "High speed internet" - very pricey at â‚¬20 per day. Someone should report the "high speed" description to trading standards! "high speed" it was not. Shower head would not point where I wanted it to. Room was very well tidied on my second day - to a very standard. Lobby - very impressive looking. Event - I was here on a business event. It included catering etc. CAtering - variable quality. The special evening event was very well catered. Some of the other meals were of questionalbe standard - empty buffet trays, undercooked potato, too much fish. When they got i t right it was great. When they got it wrong it was worse than average. Deserts were nice and varied. Overral, being more of a budget traveller usually, I was disappointed with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hit or miss....”
Reviews.Author: koala2409
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this hotel several times. Location is superb, close to bars, theaters etc! This stay was definitely a miss. Valetparking is always good, friendly staff. Lady at check in also friendly but could not for fill my preferences. Being a Marriott Platinum member and booked long time in advance I would have expected a bit more response to my needs. We wanted a high floor, king-bed. The lady gave us a room at the 5th floor with Leidseplein view. Because these room are very noisy during weekend nights I asked for a room at the backside (quiet side) of the hotel. This was only available at the 2nd or 3rd floor, limited view. I asked for a high floor room with 2 beds but it did not seem possible as well. The hotel did not look very full... So we decided to go for the room she gave us first at the 5th floor. We came into this room and as expected it was noisy (despite new windows), very dirty sheet, smelly. So, we went back to the front desk and we were given a room at the 8th floor, quiet side. All in all we were busy 45 minutes to have our room. Because we were arriving late due to heavy traffic I went to the executive lounge at 7.15pm to have a little snack for my daughter before the buffet closed at 7.30 pm. The lounge was very crowded, packed and very noisy. Lot of empty bottles, glasses, silverware etc on the tables. I found a table, went to the buffet finding out that everything was empty! It looked like it was attacked by wild animals!!!! Found some nacho's for my daughter...People took bottles of wine of the buffet to put them on their tables for refills.The very nice man who used to work in the lounge for several years and who is a familiar face did his very best and worked hard!! But is was too much for him alone! The lounge was very understaffed! We had a reasonable sleep (only our daughter had a very bad cold) after woken up a few times because of noisy people in the hallway. We decided to stay not the 2 nights as planned and checked out the next morning. Do not expect to be back very soon....

Reviews.Title: “Very average”
Reviews.Author: TIGER8697
Reviews.Content: Great location and a short walk to the public transport. The Hotel rooms were "tired" and small which is not unusual for Amsterdam. Good lounge and snacks after a long day.

Reviews.Title: “Stone throw away from fun”
Reviews.Author: Zaufyshan H
Reviews.Content: 3 minutes away from the piazza lookalike Leidseplein and bull dog cafe. 1 minute from a graet pancake place called pancake corner! 2 minutes from the famous Bulldog cafe The rooms are decent sized and comfortable. Free tea/coffee available at the lobby. The tram station is in Leidseplein, taxis available near the hotel. the location is very convenient specially for first time tourists. Take a look at all the tours available. The best tours i took were Van Gogh's Museum and a private tour of the old houses of Herengracht.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel if you are with children”
Reviews.Author: motherlovely1
Reviews.Content: we stayed in this hotel for a city break with our children aged 10 and 9. its in the museum quarter so a nice stroll along the canals into the very heart of town, but walking distance to ann frank museum and van gogh and rijk museum. we ate our evening meals in the bar which had a great choice of curries and other dishes and was a wonderful place for people watching as it looks out onto a busy junction. the staff were helpful and the hotel decorated very nicely and everything seemed new.

Reviews.Title: “service for 2 stars and not more(((”
Reviews.Author: Girl-in-coma
Reviews.Content: The worst hotel in this class I've ever stayed in. Rude stupid staff at the reception. (The only exception is restaurant. Atmosphere was nice there). No wi-fi in the rooms. First day we stayed the door was broken. Next day it was a problem with the washbasin... Shame for famous chain!

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable 3 night stay. Slept like a baby.”
Reviews.Author: bccrab
Reviews.Content: The Marriott is a great choice in Amsterdam. The hotel is located near the major museums and the Leidseplan entertainment area. The streetcars that run into the old town and the other attractions stop very close by or walking is always an option. The room was clean and comfortable with a nice view and the hotel was very quiet. I slept like a rock all three nights that I stayed. Service was very nice at the front desk and the hotel executive lounge served a very nice breakfast buffet each morning. The hotel was very busy and clearly gets a lot of tour groups from around the world. Nevertheless the staff was friendly and the atmosphere overall was very welcoming. Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “5 stars-VERY SMALL ONES”
Reviews.Author: dvedveri
Reviews.Content: Not American(USA) Mariiot standarts.Beds were nice,rest-just an average 3 Stars Hotel. Staff tried to be helpful but :"Sorry,it was not me,it was my colleague" says it all.I would not point on CONS but it is very difficult to say something nice. Just ok.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Location, Great staff, Nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: mstrg325
Reviews.Content: Great location. Can catch a bus across the street that goes directly to the airport for a very low price. Great concierge staff (can rent bikes directly from hotel). Terrific park next to the hotel to catch a great run or people watch. Can catch a canal cruise right across the street. Walk to many bars and restaurants. Rooms are standard, renovated Marriott rooms that should please most everybody. Had access to the lounge and I have to say it's one of the best louges. Complimentary beer/wine/spirits, good food selection at all hours, friendly staff, lots to choose from. This is an excellent choice for a business or leisure stay in Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable beds!”
Reviews.Author: pojaya
Reviews.Content: We won this hotel on a priceline bid, and stayed for three nights. The beds in the hotel were just great, so comfortable! Our room has a great view over Leidseplein and Amsterdam, so really cannot ask for more. Bathroom a bit on the small side, and the shower head was a bit leaky --> not quite five star in this department. The hotel has a good gym. In Amsterdam, we bought a 72 hour travel pass from a vending machine at the Central Station. There is a little building outside Central Station for tickets and info, but the queues were so bad, so I went back inside the station, and eventually managed to locate a vending machine that sells these GVB tickets instead of train tickets. We ended up taking the trams a lot to get our money's worth.... ha ha... although it seems there is no policing of tickets esp in the centre. It seems that some trams only allow entry via a conductor, so you got to get a ticket. The tram stop for the hotel is Leidseplein. It is a little walk from the tram stop to the hotel itself, including crossing a big road in front of the hotel. Downside - internet access extra cost.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Marriott quality....”
Reviews.Author: King06
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this Marriott about 7-8 times, working for the Dutch-based Philips conglomertae. The Amsterdam Marriott is a solid hotel,offering all of the standard amenities that Marriott provides business travelers. Location wise, it is a two-minute walk from the Leidseplein square, very close to restaurants and the opera. It is also a 5 minute walk from the highest end-shopping streets in Amsterdam. The breakfast buffet is excellent and they also have a cafe that will provide Pizza Hut type food in the evenings.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ting w
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location. Close to the museums and close to the boat rides. One thing that bugs me is that I forgot a T-Shirt there, I returned the following week and they have a bible filled with "lost stuff" written down and they said they have no record of it. The breakfast buffet was also great and I loved how they have a suite just for elite members.

Reviews.Title: “Can't fault a thing!”
Reviews.Author: LondonTravelita
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights for a work trip and everything was just right - easy check in, express check out via the TV was so simple, clean, large room, comfy bed, large breakfast selecion. The area Leidesplain is lovely, busy but not seedy like the centre can be. Concierge, door staff, receptionists all great and super helpful. I recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel. great location”
Reviews.Author: ExpectingtheBest77
Reviews.Content: i truly enjoyed my stay at this hotel. some of the friendliest staff i have encountered in the marriott chain of hotels. nice room and a really great location. this place is a must when staying in amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great food, really good rooms for Amsterdam standards BUT no coffee maker in the room”
Reviews.Author: Finke
Reviews.Content: Stayed there two days for business. Good Marriott standard with a slightly stylish European touch on public areas like lobby, bar, etc. All food and waiting was excellent. The midtown grill people and menu absolutely delightful. Check in and check out with lines both times and a certain clumsiness to it. The rooms are clean and well maintained, which is encouraging considering that you are in Amsterdam. But the bathroom is basic Marriott. Same wall papers, in tubb shower with thermostat, but nothing modern, fancy, and special here. Room window opens for fresh air - great! - most Marriotts don't have that. The big bummer: no water cooker or coffee maker in the room - big unwelcome surprise and totally not Marriott standard. Thus, you have to call for coffee at 6.50 Euros but the room service was quick and friendly. The location is fabulous: park for running with 5 k loop just a block away and a short walk from the van Gogh and really charming neighborhoods. Tram and airport bus in front of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: natikeh
Reviews.Content: Great location! Very close to tram station that will take you everywhere very easily. Very decent and clean rooms. Friendly and helpful staff. Would definitely recommend it as a 4star hotel. Our kids loved the location because it was close to restaurants(i.e. Wok to walk) and shops.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, nice location”
Reviews.Author: Sean J
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very close to the Holland Casino in Amsterdam. As a Marriott platinum memeber, I recieved free internet and free access to the concierge lounge, which was quite nice. One of the reviewers complianted that there was no wifi in the rooms. That was not true for me, I had internet in my room

Reviews.Title: “Good Location decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: koray k
Reviews.Content: Good 4 star hotel. the amenities are not enough for 5 five star. expensive internet. Continous noise in the room. location is good. this is the only good thing in this hote. breakfast is ok.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what it says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: Sparkler98
Reviews.Content: We (my Mum and I) stayed at the Marriott in Amsterdam in August on a last minute weekend away. The hotel was a fair walk from the station but proved to be central for all the main sights. The hotel is very big and the corridors seem endless but the room was very nice; clean and functional. The staff were really helpful; we knew when we booked that we were not guaranteed to get a twin room but the reception staff changed our room from a double when we checked in which was a nice touch. We didn't eat in the hotel as plenty of places around and about. We really enjoyed our weekend away and we'd stay at the Marriott here again.

Reviews.Title: “No WiFi in Rooms but Nice Hotel with Convenient Location and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: sautillo
Reviews.Content: Love the hotel. Great rooms. A big drawback: lack of WiFi in the rooms. There are only network cables in the rooms. strange for a contemporary hotel and different from most of the other Marriotts around the world. You can get WiFi in the lobby or the Executive Lounge here for a fee OR only after having previously authenticated for Internet access via the Internet cable in your room. This is a challenge if you rely on an iPad. Hopefully local management will rectify this strange antiquated practice. If you want WiFi in your room from a Marriott property in Amsterdam, go to the Renaissance. If you do not need WiFi, you will certainly enjoy this comfortable hotel with friendly attentive staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: davuda
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel very clean and comfortable. The service was quite good. The staff was knowledgable. There had tickets to many of the local museums that would allow you to bypass long lines. We had a standard king size bed. The room was clean, comfortable and modern. There was an excellent workout facility with a good mixture of equipment, including a rowing machine in addition to ususal treadmills and ellipticals. The only downside was that the internet fees were quite expensive (19.95 Euros/24-hrs).

Reviews.Title: “Ideal spot for short stay, ideally located”
Reviews.Author: Rekyes
Reviews.Content: We had less than 24 hours in which to see Amsterdam and wanted to see as much as possible. Thanks to the concierge we were able to see original Rembrandts, Vermeer's, The Anne Frank House and have a lovely dinner cruise through the canals in the evening. Not a minute was wasted. He printed out the tickets and made the reservations we needed, drew us up a map and sent us on our way. Luckily the weather was perfect and we had a wonderful time exploring Amsterdam. The rooms were exceptionally clean and comfortable. Our only complaints are that the hotel does not have free wi-fi, not even in the lobby and there was only shampoo in the bathroom, no hair conditioner. We were in three hotels while on our trip and none had hair conditioner, must be a European thing.

Reviews.Title: “Located in the center of everything!”
Reviews.Author: canyanyday
Reviews.Content: Within walking distances to EVERYTHING (trams, buses, canal boats, museums, restaurants, shopping). The doorman is very helpful in giving directions. The staff were all friendly and professional. Was able to get a room with a great view of the city. Our room was clean but the carpet looked dirty - spots and stains. Everything else was comfortable and presentable. Didn't like having to go to the first floor to the executive lounge. Seemed like anyone could piggyback in there. The breakfast, hors d'oeuvres, and dessert was delicious in the executive lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Inbetweeny
Reviews.Content: We stayed the 2nd and 3rd of October , 2011 and were so pleased with the location and the quality of the hotel. Near the Leidesplein and all bus/tram lines, this hotel made visiting Amsterdam a joy.Just out of the crazy of the center, this hotel is almost next door to the Rijksmuseum and walkable (15 minutes) to most all other sites. Clean, well appointed and with a professional staff, we highly rec'd this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Southern_Belle815
Reviews.Content: My family of four stayed in two rooms in the Marriot Amsterdam hotel. Our room was roomy; the bed was comfortable; the bath was well appointed; the staff was helpful; and the central location was very convenient to everything. We loved walking to nearby restaurants and shops. The only downside to our hotel was the expense of eating there. In our other European hotels, breakfast was included. Here - breakfast was not included and was very expensive. We just ate elsewhere. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location”
Reviews.Author: Tony Y
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights. Location wise, is good. Walking distance to most of the tourist attractions. Staff are helpful. The best is the bed linen. Good quality. The negative is that the walls are too thin. Noises from closing doors, walking steps and etc can be heard.

Reviews.Title: “One Night, A Rip Off”
Reviews.Author: Miketob
Reviews.Content: We had one night in the Marriot, Room good it was a double 2x Queen size beds. Staff very good. What lets the Marriot down are the very expensive prices for everything at the hotel, including breakfast and internet, a real rip off.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: red25il
Reviews.Content: It is a nice hotel centrally situated in the city with convenient access to public transport. Stuff is professional providing corrective service. Room is spacious relatively to European hotels. We received 2 double queen-size beds, whereas it is more common to see two single beds. Communication costs for the internet and telephone are hideous without any proportion simply a rip-off.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott standard!”
Reviews.Author: zmrzlina
Reviews.Content: I was only here for a single night, but I can happily report that this hotel is up to the usual 5* Marriott standard. It is *not* cheap (26 euros for the breakfast buffet!!) but on the other hand the location is superb -- a minute's walk south of the bustling Leidseplein and only minutes away by foot from the Rijksmuseum. Leave yourself about 30 minutes to walk to the main station. Normally a walk of this distance is a drag but Amsterdam is Oh So Beautiful that walking is the best choice on a nice day. If not, the tram will get you there lickety split. On the morning of my departure I was very politely assisted by the business centre in printing out my airline boarding pass. This was provided as a complimentary service and I was most pleased, as I had been expecting a charge for computer use.

Reviews.Title: “Outrageous internet prices - avoid”
Reviews.Author: Ifoldman
Reviews.Content: The headline says it all. Asked to justify an internet charge of Â£20/E20, yes thats twenty euros a DAY, front desk staff said 'all the hotels in The Netherlands do it' However same staff candidly admitted being embarrassed about this charge and admitted the hotel had lost a lot of business because of it. Its clearly not true that 'all hotels in the Netherlands do this' Best Western (just around the corner from the Marriot) recently announced free internet globally, because they estimate that these egregious charges are costing travellers over a billion dollars a year. In trying to squeeze revenue out of their customers (who are already paying a highish room rate) the Marriot has lost any repeat business from this customer. My low ranking also reflects this displeasure. If all Tripadvisor reviewers take the same approach and down rank hotels charging high rates for room internet access, maybe we can stop this dodgy practice. Having said above, its a great shame the Marriot spoils itself with this cheap shot. Its not a bad hotel. Staff training levels are high, its got a good central location,rooms are clean, functional and well serviced, there's is a real office chair in the room, so business travellers can work without struggling to peer over the top of the room's desk, the breakfasts more than adequate, curtains keep out light and aircon works, So come on Marriot, stop the silly internet charges. Your daily charge equals some monthly charges for ISP provision. At full occupancy you would make around 8000 Euro a year if all customers paid up (I doubt many do) a nice chunk of money, but at what cost to your global reputation?

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: calitravelbug
Reviews.Content: This beautiful hotel was located near the best restaurants and bars in Amsterdam. Friendly and professional staff, and beautiful rooms. You can walk outside right to a canal tour pick up station.

Reviews.Title: “Just great ....”
Reviews.Author: brown812005
Reviews.Content: I have stayed there for 2 nights ...17 sep till 19 . The hotel and services was just great a true 5 star hotel and helpfull staff . Nothing bad to say about them.

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL”
Reviews.Author: travelbug951
Reviews.Content: While traveling through Europe and staying in hostels and other grubby budget hotels with no hot water, we decided to splurge for a new nights and stay at the Marriott. WOW! Hot water on demand, comfortable beds, and great views! This place is walking distance to the fun and a good escape from all the craziness of A'dam. Stay here for a vacation from your vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: JK_NY
Reviews.Content: We got lucky with the Marriott since there was a 20% off deal, so I immediately booked it after reading some reviews. Glad I did. Great hotel to come to after a 7 hr flight. We arrived at 6am and the lady who checked us in was super nice (wish I remembered her name) and found us an empty room with a city view without charging us extra. She even gave us a voucher for free breakfast for one day. Breakfast was a good variety. Room was nice and spacious with 2 double beds. I liked the location since it's in the outer canal belt...but close enough to a lot of sites. If you don't have a lot of luggage, don't waste your money on a taxi. You can easily take the 197 bus from the airport (think it was 4 euros which you can pay on the bus) to the Marriott. Get off at Leidesplein. It was about 30 mins or so. It drops you off about a block from the hotel. People said Amsterdam was a walkable city...I sorta disagree. It's walkable...but a pretty big city too so it tires you out. We started taking the tram everywhere instead which worked perfectly for us. The main trams were about a 5 min walk from hotel. There are lots of bars/restaurants all outside the hotel in the main area - Leidesplein. Good place to hang out and people watch. Vondel park is about 4 blocks away...nice park. We rented bikes for a day and went around the park. Amsterdam is a bike city...I think they have the right of way over pedestrians....took some getting used to crossing the streets with all the bikers whizzing by! We took a full day tour to see the windmills, volendam, marken, delft, the hague and madurodam. DON'T do a tour. It's seriously not worth the money ($80). The first half of the trip was ALL automated commentary! You only get about 45 mins per town to walk around which isn't enough. You can spend less than half that to do it on your own and at your own pace. I knew this, but we were short on time and thought we would learn a lot more from tour guides about each town. But you don't learn much through automated commentary. The towns are small enough to just walk around and enjoy. I regret not doing it on my own. But overall, I liked the different towns, especially Volendam. I also liked the Hague too b/c my friend who lives there took us to the beach which you don't see when you're on a tour. Great place to chill and have dinner/drinks.

Reviews.Title: “My second stay, looking forward to the next one.”
Reviews.Author: Hemsedal
Reviews.Content: I only had one night this time and I wish I had more. I had a fantastic room up on the top floor that had everything you expect. The bed may be too soft for some, but I loved it. The hotel is close to Leidseplein and just across from the Casino and this is my favorite location to be at when I am in Amsterdam. Sorry for the short review, but it is not that much to say, the place is great. End of story.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: chart16
Reviews.Content: If you travel to Amsterdam, and you believe location is truly value added -- when it saves time, and enhances your travel experience -- look no further, this is your destination. The Marriott has great amenities in terms of the fitness center, food, and cocktails. The rooms are spacious, comfortable, and clean. It is so close to Vondel Park, Leidsplein, and the Museumplein. The rooms and service make this an ideal choice if you want to take the guess work out of choosing a hotel. This is especially important in Amsterdam where a glossy advertisement doesn't always represent true quality standards for accommodations -- regardless of the historical hype. The Marriott can be proud of how well the corporate standards are maintained in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great time in Amsterdam - Great location”
Reviews.Author: stbg diver
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with the hotel. All the amenities we needed were there. The location couldn't have been better. It was the perfect central location to sightsee but always close to the hotel if needed.

Reviews.Title: “Average Marriott hotel”
Reviews.Author: Michael D
Reviews.Content: Stayed here primarily for its proximity to the art museums. The hotel was adequate and the room was average size and very typical for a Marriott property. The Executive Lounge was good and had a good breakfast. This was the third Marriott hotel I stayed at on this trip in Europe that had Internet connectivity problems, so again I had limited laptop use. The hotel served my purpose and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Typical of what you would expect from a Marriott”
Reviews.Author: YukonQuirm
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights and had a pleasant experience but with a terrible view. We were placed in a room that looked on to dingy windows of other rooms. Aside from that the hotel was clean, reception was helpful and it was one of the few places in Europe that easily fits 4 people into one standard room. The bathrooms were lovely. The hotel was quite typical of what you would get from any Marriott, Holiday Inn or other North American type hotel. It was in a very central location and handy to Vondel Park and the down town area. I would never eat here - too expensive. Don't get ripped off by the taxi drivers like we did. If you are coming from the Central Train station you could hop on a tram that will drop you off right outside of the doors. If I recall correctly the trams that go in front of the hotel are 1,2,5 and should cost around 2.5 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and convenient stay at the city center”
Reviews.Author: PLN78
Reviews.Content: This is my second visit to Amsterdam Marriott and this time I left with more positive feelings. Last time I was disappointed with the fact that there were no slippers. I still find it weird that they don't provide it. But to know that the hotel is one of the cleanest and most decent hotels in Amsterdam makes me forget it very easy. The rooms are large enough to accommodate 2 people with no problem. Enough storage place both in bathroom and living areas. The large drawers are very useful. Our room was on 4th floor facing the Leidseplein. Not fully form front side but rather form the small street side of the hotel. Very airy, nice room. Everything was very clean and proper, well maintained. The bed is amazing as always. This is one of the reasons I chose this hotel again. They are very very comfortable. The staff is very polite and helpful. Although one giant problem is the cleaning staff. The room cleaning seems to be the most important thing in this hotel. They do it based on their own schedule even Ä±f they do it on the expense of making you incredibly uncomfortable! They were knocking our door 5 times until 14:00 and we were very late to bed so we didn't want to go out very early.
