We didn't know that this would end up as very disturbing experience even though we had "do not disturb" sign at the door. And even after telling that we would be leaving soon (saying it while having wet hair and towel on) the were no later than 5 minutes to knock our door again. Except this harassment by the cleaning staff the rest of the staff is very polite. The hotel is located just opposite of the tram and bus stop. Bus 197 is bringing you from Airport directly to Marriott for 2 EUR per person. If I remember right it's every 20 minutes. It takes around 30 minutes with no traffic. The restaurants are around it's easy to choose them. But I would recommend Restaurant 't Zwaantje at Berenstraat 12, 1016 GH www.zwaantje.demon.nl This restaurant has all the perfect selection from traditional northern european food to some other international classics. But schnitzel and some dutch dishes are perfect. Beware of large portions. Reguliersdwaarstraat has many options for gay bars and clubs. Soho, Eve, Exit are to name few. Perfect for women, too. For little bit more luxe feeling Bump is a good choice for gays and all. Palladium is still packed in the evenings for good food and chic people. For saturday or sunday brunch Caffe PC at PC Hooftstraat is good choice followed by some shopping. And the best part is Marriott is close to all of these.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: RPL_13
Reviews.Content: Fabulous stay ..highly recommended. The hotel is wonderful as is the staff. We stayed in a suite with 2 children and had plenty of room. The executive club was excellent! The Marriott Amsterdam is close to many attractions such as the boat cruise, Anne Frank museum and within walking distance to many other landmarks.

Reviews.Title: “Bachelor Party”
Reviews.Author: Passport-Kid
Reviews.Content: 12 of my friends & I stayed here in April 2011 for a bachelor party trip. This is an average nice hotel with clean rooms and good location. It is located within the Leidesplain district (leidesplain & rembrant are the main tourist locations for partying). It is a short tram (streetcar) ride from dam square and central station. Purchase a multi-day pass for the street cars at the central station...it will help you get around town. Overall the city is beautiful and small. At night we would walk around most of town from our hotel. Make sure you double check your reservations before arriving, they had ours mixed up. It was a fun trip and I would recommend this hotel to any group of young guys traveling.

Reviews.Title: “An Outstanding Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: Osweg0
Reviews.Content: I recently had the pleasure of staying at the Amsterdam Marriott for 3 nights. It is not a new hotel but has been wonderfully remodelled. The Pluses: - Great Location - Great Rooms - Great Executive Lounge - The entire staff at the hotel were outstanding and created a wonderful customer experience - Direct access by bus to Schiphol Airport (4 Euros / every 15 mins) The Negatives: NO NEGATIVES I encourage you to stay at the Marriott Amsterdam, you will not be disappointed!!!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel but not 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: sirtravel
Reviews.Content: Check in was nice and efficient, but right from entering the lobby you start to say is this a 5 star hotel or a nice Holiday Inn. Again, we're talking 5 stars here, but this was more like modest chain hotel. The room was nice and of sufficient space, but the toiletries were again modest for a 5* hotel. No bathrobes, no umbrella, and wireless at $30/day. The location is good as it is mid-way between the museumplein and the leidseplein. Did not use the fitness/health club or eat at any of the restaurants. If this were a 4* hotel, my rating would probably have been higher, but again I am rating it based on the 5* class they are supposed to represent.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Delmart
Reviews.Content: We just stayed there for five nights. Hotel has the perfect location. It is a short walk to the major museums and just down the street from Vondelpark. The Executive Lounge is first rate with a wonderful breakfast buffet. It is well recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good area & lovely room. But noisy air-con!”
Reviews.Author: iTrailBlazer
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel room and amenities. Staff very friendly and go out of their way to help and smile. You get a sense they actually enjoy working there and serving the public. Though i find all of the Neatherlands and Amsterdam especially, is like this. Would reccommend the hotel but the only problem was the noisy aircon which we couldnt turn off, nor could the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average rooms, poor service”
Reviews.Author: Baldistuta
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Marriott Amsterdam with my wife and two children for 2 nights. I had a room with two double beds on the 5th floor, facing a grey courtyard (at the time of booking I requested one overlooking canals, but at my check-in they said there were no availability). The room was enough spacious for us with flat Tv, wardrobe, iron board, a desk and a mini-bar. Bathroom was moderately spacious and basically equipped with combined shower/bath-tube, hair-drier and furnished with average soaps and lotions. As Gold member I had free wi-fi and access to the Executive Lounge located at the ground floor (with access to member and one guest at time). I used Executive Lounge two times in the evening and I found soft drinks, beer and spirits; at that time there were only cakes and little desserts that disappeared very quickly and were no refurnished at all after 9 PM.: I couldn't say if on others hours it's different but it seemed to be an average lounge compared to others in same class hotels. Breakfast was good and served in the Mid-Town Grill restaurant at the ground floor and there was several kinds of bread, cakes, cheese, sausages, salmon, eggs cooked to order, fresh fruits, tomatoes, potato meatballs, yoghurt, juices, tea and so on. After booking I emailed to Marriott to know about the possibility to buy Holland Pass directly from them, as I read on Holland Pass website. They answered yes, but after my check-in when I went to the concierge to purchase the pass, they told me to go to the Tourist Office because they couldn't help me. Hotel is a 2-minutes walk from Leidseplein (with a tram and bus stop and a huge choice of restaurants and cafÃ©), 1 minute from the Tourist Office and the Canal Bus stop. We arrived by train and we easily reached the Hotel by a ten minutes tram ride. With a 10 minutes stroll we could easily reach Vondelpark, Van Gogh Museum and Rijksmuseum. There is an ATM in the Hotel and a supermarket three blocks away. I honestly think that Marriott Amsterdam is overpriced and should improve its service to retain 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Amsterdam with my kids”
Reviews.Author: kchef
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Hotel in Amsterdam is a fabulous find. It's located in the city center within easy walking distance of almost everywhere you would want to be. Quiet, well furnished rooms with great views, and a friendly, helpful staff. We had a short walk to a great place for a fabulous Irish breakfast prior to jumping onto a canal tour boat for a jaunt around the city. I highly recommend doing the same. Afterwards, we visited the many shops and enjoyed what Amsterdam had to offer. Shortly there after we sat with some great coffee in an outside bar and watched the hundreds of young locals and tourists riding by on their bikes. I think we watched for hours. That night we chose to eat in the hotel grill for some great Indian curry, mini burgers for the kids, and a cesear salad for the wife. The wine was great, the food was outstanding and the service was memorable. It didn't break the bank either. There is no question that we will be choosing the Marriott on our next trip through Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lumpy beds”
Reviews.Author: 5Travellers1263
Reviews.Content: My family of five recently stayed at this hotel and found the location to be very convenient. Other than taking a taxi (quite surprised and pleased to find a van for 5 people) from the train station, we were able to walk everywhere with three kids ages 11, 9 and 8. The hotel was clean and updated, but the feather mattress toppers were very lumpy. The breakfast offered enough choices for picky eaters, but overall the hotel was a bit pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Michael Z
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hoterl. The room was great and the location is very convenient to thethe major museums and Vondelpark. The breakfat buffet is very nice but expensive (20 euros) but one can order ala carte. The concierge and reception were superb. The Leidse plein is one block away with tram stops and restaurants galore.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location with all of the amenities”
Reviews.Author: KennyL7721
Reviews.Content: The room overlooked the Leidseplein which was 2 blocks away. The tram returning from the center of town stopped at the Leidseplein while the tram going to the center stopped outside the front entrance of the hotel. The executive lounge had an excellent breakfast and wonderful evening snacks and free drinks (beer, wine, & liquor). The location was superb- within several blocks of the many resturants and shops around the Leidseplein. The main entrance to Vondel Park was 2 blocks away. The front desk was very knowledgeable about Amsterdam. They had a gym that was never full. The maid service was exactly what was requested and the room was larger than expected. We will certainly return there the next time we are in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect 50th b'day trip”
Reviews.Author: trimtabvirginia
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on marriott points the first week of August. Had a great time. Hotel -- location, executive lounge, gym and room all first rate. Take the 197 bus (4 euro) from airport to Leidesplein stop directly in front of hotel. Did not use a tram or bus again until we went back to the airport also by 197 bus...could walk to everything. AH grocery on corner of Overtoom one block from hotel. Recommend Mike's Bikes tour (10 minute walk from hotel) early in trip, did the country ride, a great orientation to the city and a bit in the country (11am,4 hours, 22 euro). Very few post offices/post boxes in Amsterdam, but concierge desk sells stamps and takes mail.

Reviews.Title: “A good Marriott with great location and service”
Reviews.Author: edgardostern
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott in early July. We asked and paid for an upgraded and larger room that included breakfast, Executive lounge access and free internet (only in the lounge and hotel lobby). The hotel is a nice good Marriott, nothing special. Its location is excellent for sightseeing, shopping and museum visiting. The room was very large but the bathroom was ridiculously small for such a large room. Moreover, the ceiling was lower in the bathroom, which i believe would make it very hard for a tall person to stand in the shower (not our problem, though). Breakfast --in our case-- could be had in the main breakfast room or in the Executive lounge. It was good but not special. Concierge and other personnel were very helpful. In fact, we once forgot to remove the "Do not disturb" sign from our doorknob and got a message indicating the fact and that we could have the room cleaned until 7 pm if we called. Unfortunately, we arrived after that time and realised our mistake in not removing the sign. Nevertheless, housekeeping accommodated us by quickly cleaning ther oom and changing our sheets and towels. They did not have to do so.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Anapo
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Amsterdam Marriott hotel for six nights, during the last week of July. it is a typically American hotel with all the standard amenities- best of all, the location. Excellent beds and pillows, great breakfast with many low fat choices and helpful staff. The only downside is the Internet- no free wi-fi and the Internet card for one and a half hours costs 19â‚¬. We would definitely choose it for our next visit to Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: popcorn18
Reviews.Content: This property is modern and has the amenities expected from a Marriott including a great comfy bed. . We stayed there as a two day stop over on the way to Africa to get over our jet lag and did not expect to see very much. However, the location was outstanding and we were able to see so much in the short time we had. It is steps to many of the best of Amsterdam's best sites-the leidesplein, richts and van gogh museums, the market, boat cruise etc. We were pleasantly surprised.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: CSNRWhite
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this hotel for four days. It is in the heart of Amsterdam and convenient to most attractions and great dining in walking distance. The rooms were very clean with nice crisp sheets, soft towels, and a great bathroom. The hotel staff are professional, pleasant, helpful, and service oriented. The only downsides are that: the room was small for a family of four (but that is to be expected in Europe) and room service was inconsistent. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Anon_Brit99
Reviews.Content: I stay here frequently for work and am a big fan of the property Pros: Great location for museums, leidseplein, etc Friendly staff Great (albeit sometimes crowded) club lounge Cons: Only club level rooms have tea and coffee facilities No alarm clocks

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for families (check packages), but no wifi in room!”
Reviews.Author: AGupi
Reviews.Content: This is not one of my favorite hotels, but was a good option considering how hard is to combine confort, location and a reasonable price in Amsterdam. The room is ok, pretty much fits the american hotel chain pattern. As pointed in other reviews, front high rooms have lovely views of Leidseplein however the hotel facede is very dirty. The location is really nice for children, since Vondel Park is few steps away. Many tram lines cross the street in front of hotel, there are many options for dinning around and its not difficult to reach many places by foot. The restaurant of the hotel is very good, and family packages include meals for children. Ask for their map, its very helpful for getting around using tram and to identifie shopping and dinnig areas. Is a good deal get a a package with breakfast because its nice but extremely expensive if not included. Our bigger disappointment was discover that there is no wifi in the rooms (only cable). Wireless is avaiable only in the lobby and is extremely expensive (7 euros for one hour and almost 100 euros for 24 hours package). I got surprised with the fact that the staff advised us to use Stabucks! By the way, the staff was very kind.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and excellent bedding.”
Reviews.Author: Armenia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. Probably should be mentioning that I am Marriott Platinum member. However, the service was regular, nothing special. As Platinum memebr we were not even suggested to upgrade the room. Anyway, the location of the hotel was good. The rooms are standard Marriott type and adequate size. Internet conncection was good. The bedding was excellent like in any other Marriott hotels. In general, would reccomend stayin at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel experience!”
Reviews.Author: RCRDSR
Reviews.Content: This hotel made our trip to Amsterdam after three weeks touring Europe a wonderful experience. It is a must stay hotel if you're planning to spend time in Amsterdam. The rooms were wonderfully appointed and they had plenty of 110 outlets so we didn't have to use our converter.

Reviews.Title: “Was A Fine Choice for Our Purposes”
Reviews.Author: Morgan_Travelers
Reviews.Content: Our number 1 priority for selecting a hotel in Amsterdam was the safe parking for our sports car. There do not appear to be many hotels that have parking in downtown Amsterdam. This hotel, although parking is expensive, has safe, underground parking and we were allowed to park our car, and not have the valet do it. Our second criteria was that it be "well located" for touring Amsterdam, and such that we did not have to drive through the main part of the central area, where the streets are small and crowded. Driving into Amsterdam was no problem, using our GPS, other than finding the correct street to approach the hotel from the correct direction. Eventually we found our way in, but it did take awhile to accomplish this task. The hotel is also in a very tourist friendly location. We bought both the Hop On-Hop Off Boat Pass and a tram pass, and with both of them managed quite easily to go whereever we desired (other than the Library where there is FREE WiFi) which took a bit of walking. We also like to have a comfortable king size bed and decent size room. The Marriott provided both of these, although the rooms aren't huge, they are pretty big by european standards. We ordered room service breakfast a la carte on two days despite the. 6,50e for 2 small cups of coffee, so we wandered down to Starbucks for much cheaper, better coffee. It was only a 5 minute walk away. The only food we had in the restaurant was a piece of apple pie, which was supposed to be warm, but wasn't. There are plenty of places to eat without eating at the hotel (sorry Marriott). As we travel quite a bit, it isn't so important for us to stay in a hotel that is more representative of the town/city we are visiting all the time. If we hadn't had the car, we most likely would have stayed at a hotel on the canal. My only real complaint is the expensive internet. You can buy a package for 25e/day that includes internet and movies. You can buy partial days, but I think it was 7.50e for 30minutes. Hence, getting to the library where it is free.

Reviews.Title: “I loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: BluDevil81
Reviews.Content: Staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Room was quite clean and I had wonderful view of the city. Fabulous location within walking distance of all major attractions.

Reviews.Title: “great location for walking around the city”
Reviews.Author: TravelingCougar
Reviews.Content: We loved having breakfast at the hotel restaurant while watching locals and tourists ride past us on bikes. It is not difficult to tell who the tourists are. We chose the Marriott because we needed a hotel that would accomendate a third person (adult) in the room. The front desk staff were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Loved loved loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: 2txnsincali
Reviews.Content: After a very disappointing experience in a bed and breakfast, we ran as fast as we could to the Marriott. We wanted a doorman, and we got it. Staff was fabulous and the room was large, (by European standards), clean, and comfortable. The location was good and we found we could walk pretty much anywhere wanted. Fairly close to public transporation. They didn't even look at us funny when we stumbled in with Happy Meals from McDonalds!

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel - not on par with other Marriotts”
Reviews.Author: mnck
Reviews.Content: Small hotel with average sized rooms; kind of run down carpeting and wallpaper decor, Executive level floor for Marriott Gold or Platinum members non-existent. Limited service in the lounge. No upgrades for Platinum guests Restaurant was pathetic. One waiter trying to handle 10-12 customers at one time! Food choices limited and very pricey. Would not recommend you eat at the restaurant. Fitness center was small with a maze of up and down stairs and too many machines in inadequate space. Would recommend staying at the Renaissance Marriott as a better option..much better hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Top quality, ideal location”
Reviews.Author: LeVisitant
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in snowy December 2010. The hotel is 3 mins walk from Leidensplein, which is my favourite plaza in the city. You can walk to the Museum district or stroll through shopping streets to Dam Square very easily. The hotel is swanky with plush furnishings and efficient staff. Slept very well in the large room and enjoyed the buffet breakfast immensely. Prices are a little on the high side at the bar and the staff there could be more friendly. This is a minor quibble. We never ate at the restaurant but it was always busy which is a good sign. Wouldn't hesitate to recommend it for business or city break

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: ladiesel
Reviews.Content: One of the hotels we stayed at during our recent European Holiday. Customer service at this hotel was impeccable. We arrived early, about 11AM and although check in was not until 3PM, they got us a room as soon as we arrived. The hotel in general was very nice & clean. It's location was also perfect. Although the rooms were a bit on a smaller side, it was very clean and very comfortable. I must also say that we had the best breakfast (which came w/ our package) at this hotel. It is definitely worth getting with booking a room. If we do go back to Amsterdam, we will surely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “If want Marriott beds and don't mind all the Americans....”
Reviews.Author: Kehsutton
Reviews.Content: Perfectly Marriott and perfectly safe- meaning great beds but circa '92 decor. If you've statues at any Marriott you know what you'll get....decent service, full blown Americans milling around, and more decent service.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the stay”
Reviews.Author: fatginger29
Reviews.Content: We needed a big room because we have 3 young children. We stayed in a top floor room with 2 double beds. We could order 1 extra bed and the room was quite spacious. We loved the free continental breakfast at the club lounge. We booked the room through hotel web site with very good price. The hotel is less than 10 min walk away from the central train station.

Reviews.Title: “A Dam sight closer”
Reviews.Author: colonelcrow
Reviews.Content: This Marriott is to the usual high-standard, well maintained, helpful staff but with no free WiFi! Who needs WiFi when you're this close to the Van Gogg Museum, the canals, the Vondelpark, etc?

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: jcoe
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay in the Amsterdam Marriott. It is super close to many downtown locations. It is easy to walk from the hotel to many shops, restaurants, museums, and the Heineken Experience. It is easy to take the train to Lelylaan from the Airport, and Tram 1 from Lelylann to the hotel. The hotel is clean and nice, and the staff is very helpful. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay...would stay again”
Reviews.Author: janrm
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Amsterdam after a cruise. The first time we stayed at the Renaissance which is nearer the Central Station and many "first time" activities. This time we wanted to do the museums, so opted to stay here. We liked the rooms better in this Marriott, and the food in the restaurant, though pricey (what isn't in Europe?) was excellent quality. The location was perfect for canal cruises and other transportation. People in the hotel were very helpful. We will stay here again...using "points".

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel, except for the concierges”
Reviews.Author: GTAPOmpanoBeach_FL
Reviews.Content: ItÂ´s a great hotel with the best location in Amsterdam. Excellent service, rooms and buffet breakfast. But it has the most arrogant and unfriendly concierges I have ever met, at least the two I had to deal with in different ocasions, so I guess itÂ´s a trend there. The doormen, maitre and waiters are very helpful though, so if you need help or advice, theyÂ´re the ones to go to.

Reviews.Title: “well situated excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: sualit
Reviews.Content: family freindly, great location, room & staff. we anjoyed our stay. expensive but well worth. we didn't take the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for you stay, close to Restaurants and Museums”
Reviews.Author: MaryDomRep
Reviews.Content: Marriott is famous for their comfortable beds, but this hotel has one of the most comfortable ones ! Excellent location close to Restaurants and Museums. Almost in front of the Hotel you can get a tour of the Canals as one of the many companies have a ticket office. 25 minutes from Airport and 15 minutes from port. Also employees are ver well trained.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean, Very comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: jpl88
Reviews.Content: One of the nicest Marriott's in Europe. Stayed in one of the corner kings which was spacious and offered comfort and amenities in line with what you would expect from a good Marriott in the States. Club lounge is on the ground floor and open on weekends. Has a self service guest laundry (this is unusual in Europe) which also makes this a convenient place to stop in the middle of an extended European trip. The bus from the airport stops in front of the hotel. Do get an Amsterdam tourist card (sold at reception) as cost of attractions add up quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel plus excellent location”
Reviews.Author: JSantanaCoralGables
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers all the comfort that you might want to have when traveling overseas. very dedicated staff and always looking to assist you. The room although not very spacious for american standard are quite comfortable. Nice bathroom and overall very clean. Only observation is that wireless internet should be included since the hotel is rather expensive. Close to major attractions and restaurants. I would recommend this hotel for tourist and business trips.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but bad experience”
Reviews.Author: mrs_p81
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located for exploring Amsterdam, you can walk to Damm square in about 15 minutes. The lobby and restaurant areas have been refurbished and are very nice. The bedrooms are pretty standard Marriott rooms. There are a couple of moans, we had water with our meal in the restaurant and was charged â‚¬8.50 for a bottle of still mineral water, even by fancy restaurant standards that is too much. There is no wi-fi in the rooms (at least there wasn't in the part of the hotel we stayed). The breakfast is ok, with a wide selection but is in no way worth the â‚¬25 per person change and for the first time ever in a Marriott the bed linen was really uncomfortable (hard and scratchy) i normally love Marriott duvets but not on this occasion. We did have a really bad experience at this hotel. On day two we awoke at 07:30 to a crane being installed at the front of the hotel, we went out and when we returned in the afternoon there was constant banging and drilling from the room above, this went on until about 6pm. The following morning we were woken at 07:30 by the same banging and drilling from the room above. When we contacted reception we were told they were cleaning the windows. When we actually looked we discovered they were changing (removing and refitting the windows) in the rooms above ours. Not only did the staff treat us like we were stupid but it was the most unrelaxing and noisiest stay in a hotel i have ever experienced. For the pure cheek of the reception staff and for being woken at the crack of dawn on holiday i would not return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant Location”
Reviews.Author: Sugar Grove Guy
Reviews.Content: The hotel has an excellent location-5 minute walk to the museums, about 15 minutes to the city center-actually Amsterdam is amenable to walking exploration from most hotels near the canal rings. For those not into walking three trams routes run just across the street from the hotel to most major sites and the central train station. Our room was very quiet and clean. One downside is the costs of the internet - 20 euroes. Walk to the town square in front of the hotel 2 blocks and there is free internet at the Bulldog Bar.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: jay379
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marriott Amsterdam from the 16th-19th March 2011 and I really enjoyed my stay and don't have too many gripes. Check in was very easy and the staff were polite and professional. Rooms were good and what I expected from the Marriott brand. The gym looked really cool, but I did not use it. The location is GREAT for the Leidseplein area which is full of restaurants and entertainment. The only drawback I encountered during my stay was some maintenance work in a adjacent room that started at 830a every morning. Since my stay in Amsterdam was short and I wasn't concerned about too much sleep I didn't let this bother me too much. Marriott e-mailed me a customer survey and I wrote about my concern with early morning "drilling" and I was sent back a sincere and professional apology from the General Manager. I have stayed in many different hotels in Amsterdam and the Renaissance and the Marriott are 2 of my favorite hotels! I feel this Marriott provides great customer service, good rooms and best of all location. Highly Recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Be very happy to recommend the Marriott.”
Reviews.Author: Kerrs
Reviews.Content: Hotel great. Location superb. Arrived very early - were able to get into our room straight away which was great. Delighted with room. As suggested by tripadvisor reviewers requested two double beds instead of two single beds. Very comfy room. Good decor - very fresh and clean. No faults at all, well just one wee one - coffee and tea making facilities would have been appreciated. The hotel information booklet stated that there was a washing machine and tumble drier available for guests to use free of charge. We all agreed that breakfast was excellent - as good as any we have had. A great range of different foods - fresh and regularly topped up. Staff were all lovely and very helpful as were the people in Amsterdam. Nothing was too much trouble e.g ask for a direction and you're taken to the spot. Concierge was very good too - can book tickets with them - handy and at times saves waiting in line. Theres a gym and sauna - went to use the sauna but it's small and was busy so didn't bother. Before we left home we were recommended to try the INDRAPURA restaurant, Rembrandrplein 42, 1017 CV Amsterdam ( 020-623 73 29 ) - it was superb. It's an Indonesian Restaurant. There were various "tapas type" menus - delicious. The concierge also recommended the "Pantry" - Dutch Cuisine which was also very good. It was reasonably close to the hotel ( Leidsekruisstraat 21 1017 RE Amsterdam ) and reasonably priced. The public transport is very good. Couldn't get over the number of bikes - takes a bit of getting used to! Enjoyed the sights in Amsterdam but also went to Haarlam by train. Another day took the bus from Central Station to Voldendam and then the ferry over to Markem. Took the bus back from Markem to Amsterdam. Markem and Haarlam were both particularly nice spots and not too commercial. Two lovely days out. All in all a lovely long week-end in Amsterdam. To sum up - we were delighted with our choice of hotel. We would be very happy to recommend and if we ever returned to Amsterdam would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The best value for your money!”
Reviews.Author: Pustilnik
Reviews.Content: Terrific location, spacious room, gorgeous lobby, outstanding gym (like nothing I ever saw in any hotel). Sumptuous breakfast that was included in the price. Personnel were very helpful and knowledgable. Nice restaurant in the hotel where we ordered dinner. Wonderful bed and linen! Wish we stayed there longer!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Good Location, Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: CJKatl
Reviews.Content: As many have already pointed out, this hotel has a good location, is clean and the employees are competent, polite and helpful. The bedding was comfortable, the tub was large and the room was typical Marriott in its appointments. This property is a little more intimate than most full service Marriott hotels. It has a small lobby and lacks the hubbub associated with many Marriotts, which is a good fit for an Amsterdam hotel. Here are a couple additional observations: There is a single American outlet, located near the desk in the room. If you need to use any grooming devices near the sink, be sure to bring a converter. There are converters for sale in the lobby, but not to borrow for free. There is a bus (197) to/from the airport with a stop located steps away from the hotel. It costs 4 Euros. It couldn't be any more convenient. The tram stop is also near the hotel, making it easy to get most places most people would want to go and aren't walking distance from the hotel. Several posters complained about Internet access. WiFi was available for a charge, but there was an option allowing one hour access for a small fee. As a Marriott Rewards Platinum member, I was eligible for free access, which was fast and easy to use. I agree that Internet access should be included at no additional charge. The Executive Lounge, located on the first floor, had a good selection of hot and cold breakfast items and finger foods during happy hour. It was clean, but usually pretty crowded. There were enough seats for everyone there, but tables were very close to one another. If I weren't eligible for free access, I don't think it would be worth paying for access. We were talking to people in the lounge who had paid for access and felt as though they had gotten their money's worth, so I might be wrong. Unlike most lounges, there was no computers available in the lounge for Internet access or to print out boarding passes or tourist information. There were computers off the lobby available and you could print boarding passes for free.

Reviews.Title: “An average American hotel in Europe”
Reviews.Author: abitofeverything
Reviews.Content: The hotel is OK in terms of its location, cleanliness, and maintenance but priceline has it marked as a 5 star hotel - this should not be the case. It is located about 1.5 miles from the Centraal station (and thus a large number of highlights). The check-in process took about 15 minutes, the check-out process took 10 more minutes, the receptionist directed us to the concierge for a simple question about a location of a near grocery store, the drain in the bathroom barely drained... Just the little things that did not make this a 5-start experience. The beds were excellent, the room size is nice (but not 5-star), everything was very clean, and the overall appearance was quite nice. No free internet anywhere in the hotel - something I find unacceptable in this day, it is as if they told you that you need to pay extra for electricity in the room...

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Mme_X
Reviews.Content: We were here on business, but would stay here on vacation because ofhte exellent location and nice area of the city. You are near shops, restaurants, canals, historic buildings, etc. I had sayed here a few years ago and am very pleased by the quality of the renovations. The sleek, modern furnishings have been refreshed; the bed is very comfy. Good closet space. The room has all of the business class amenities one usually expects of a Marriott in the U.S., i.e. nice toiletries and linens, in-room safe, etc. I say that because so many European hotels do not provide an iron and board, and I appreciate this amenity for touch-ups. The public rooms are also nice in a modern design, as is the bar. The pricey breakfast buffet was pretty good: 20 EU for a cold buffet, 23 with hot items in chafing dishes, i.e. no omlette guy working magic. Still, this hotel has that annoying practice of charging for internet access. REally, people! You have lots of busines people staying here -- please plan for your clientele without feeling like it's a nickle-and-dime operation. Like the U.S., it seems that the higer you go, the less mre likely that there is a charge for what should be a basic amenity inthis day and age.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful location...lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: capmc
Reviews.Content: The location was great...near Vondelpark, Van Gogh and Reiksmuseum. Easy walk to great restauraunts. Clean, friendly staff, comfortable beds. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MiloK2
Reviews.Content: From the 1st moment we crossed the doors to the moment we left we were treated very warmly with all questions and any help given in a super expeditious manner. It is great to know that in a Marriott you always can expect Top of the Line service and the hotel staff were just great and the best. Everyone at the hotel contributes to the family and friendly atmosphere. The beds and rooms were super comfortable. Gorgeous views from the canal side of the canal and rest of the city. If you upgrade to the executive level you also get to use the Executive lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: happytravels780
Reviews.Content: Great stay in great location. Loved the city! I was not in the room much but it served it's purpose. Standard, clean, Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Not Up To Marriott Standards”
Reviews.Author: A-MFM16
Reviews.Content: Arrived to find our pre-booked two double-bed room was not availabe. Were given a room with two twin beds and a mattress on the floor instead -- REALLY, a mattress on the floor at a Marriott?!?! No reduction in price, not much of an explanation beyond that the hotel was booked and there were no additional roll-away cots available for our child. We were moved the next night to a room with two double beds but our stay was already "tainted" by the mattress on the floor experience and the less than helpful front-desk/managerial staff and their "could have cared less attitude." Other issues: No wireless service in the room or common areas -- cable internet access available at an extra charge. Unthinkable in today's day -- at least have wireless access in common areas. The beds were not comfortable; obvious that the mattresses had not been flipped/changed in some time. Bottom-line: this hotel in not five-star level and is not up to Marriott standards. We will not stay here again and will not recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: KathNYC
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights with a friend and it was perfect. Reception and concierge were very helpful with anything. Room was big for Europe standards with 2 double beds over looking street but very quiet when windows closed. Room has all different outlets so you don't need a converter but the front desk will loan you one. Hotel offers free laundry which was a plus secondary to many places allow smoking so it was good. The restaurant right off the lobby was very good and offered some gluten free options such as the bread for sandwich's FYI. Everyone you came across at hotel was always very pleasant. Concierge stamped my postcard and mailed it as well as giving good suggestions for restaurants. There is free WIFI in the Leidseplein square at the sports bar next to the bulldog cafe. There are also plenty of bars there with outdoor seating and as you walk you will frind many more outdoor places. You can get the train from the airport to Amsterdam Centraal Station and take the 1 tram which will drop you off right outside the Hotel. You can walk to all major attractions as Amsterdam is not that huge. The Van Gogh Museum is around the corner. Anne Frank House is a must do and by tickets in advance for both because there are long lines and with tickets you will get right in. There are canal boats which are nice and bike rentals. Everyone pretty much speaks english so no problem. Overall great place to stay and great vacation spot.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Shantrapoo
Reviews.Content: Love Amsterdam ))) the city of freedom))) Marriott has great location,good service( not excellent) but in general all was great

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: SugarCreek
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights recently. Our room was ready for check in before noon, which was great after an overnight flight. Every time we need something at the reception desk, they were wonderful. We had a quiet room, not facing the street. The location was excellent for what we wanted to do. It was only a few blocks to the Rijksmuseum and the Van Gogh. We also walked to the Anne Frank House, which is in the opposite direction. There is a bus/tram stop almost in front of the hotel. Highly recommend this hotel. Our only quibble was no coffee maker in the room and the machine in the lobby was locked after 8:30.

Reviews.Title: “Excellet location, but lack of some amenities”
Reviews.Author: cemalb
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marriott with a group off my friends last weekend. Location is excellent, right by Leidseplein. The square was only 50 meters away and so was the tram stop. Nice and clean interior with modern decorated and clean rooms. (I had to contact the reception for unchanged pillow covers once and it was taken care) Warm and professional staff, willing to extend their assistance. Excellent room service. Polite and pro. There is no wifi on the room floors except lobby area and it is for a charge. You need to hook up with a cable in the room. Bad business there. Business centre by the lobby provides free internet and deskstations. Try to get a room looking the Leidseplein Square. You don't need to worry about traffic noise. 4 of us booked a room via booking.com thinking it was a good deal, but 2 others in our group stayed in a room of same type with only 15euro/per night extra charge. So you may want to check the web options. Overall, I was very pleased with my stay and will stay there again during my future visits.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good for families”
Reviews.Author: Eurotravfam
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed this American hotel while on a long trip to Europe (American style bathrooms and familiar Marriott bedding). Clean, convenient to many restaurants, short cab ride to the Anne Frank House. Cons: incredibly slow bar service. I went downstairs for a snack and tea one evening and found myself there for an hour and a half due to service. This is slow for European standards! Did not appreciate the "s@x shop" memorabilia in the gift shop of the hotel eye level for my young kids who now read! Minor issues but could use a little tweeking. All in all a nice, pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Macco78
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a stag do with friends and loved it. The location is perfect for access to nightlife, cafes and shops. Â£40 in a taxi from the airport but other that nothing is to far away. Everything you expect from a Marriot with regard to room and service. The guys on the door were really helpful as were all the bell boys and concierge. If you're up for some night life then this is a great hotel to choose.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, fine service”
Reviews.Author: enjoyer80
Reviews.Content: Yesterday we came back from Amsterdam. Great 3 days, as Amsterdam is just lovely place to spent some days. Hotel is a bit far from Central station ( taxi costs about 11 EUR), but you can easily take a walk down to hotel. Check-in was fast, staff is well organised; room was comfortable, spacious enough. As a gold member we received executive lounge access. Lounge is great - large, bright and mostly friendly staff. Non-alcoholic drinks served all day, in the evening plenty of alcohol and food available; Me and my wife did not use any other facilities as we were mostly out exploring :)

Reviews.Title: “A Comfortable Hotel that is great for an Extended Stay”
Reviews.Author: fastueuxcaprice
Reviews.Content: My friend and I decided to stay at the Marriot because we wanted something that was more American style. We were just going to be staying in Amsterdam for 10 days and we decided we wanted the luxury of a large room and a private bathroom. We arrived at the hotel around 11am and was immediately helped. They do charge a 90 euro per night holding fee onto a credit card so you can use their services (internet and movies). This would have been 810 euros for us and they very nicely cut that down for us because that would have been a significant charge (which was our spending money). My friend is diabetic and she accidently left her blood sugar tester on the airplane. She asked the concierge on duty and asked if he could look up US Airways Customer Service number so she could call them. He was very rude to her and after several minutes he hastily wrote down a number, which when we tried to call was not a valid number. That was the ONLY proble we had during our stay. From then on, if we needed assistance we asked the bellhops. There was this one bellhop that was amazing (and I cannot remember what his name is for the life of me). He assisted us with great restaurants near the area and also where to find some Coffee Shops that were a more local favorite. We had to wait about an until we could get into our room, and we were extremely greatful for that since we had a long plane ride and arrived so early. We went to eat at their restaurant within the hotel and their club sandwiches are fabulous! Whenever we just wanted a bite to eat, it was very convenient just to go downstairs and eat a sandwich. Our room was absolutely fabulous. I still cannot believe how large the room actually was. It was just two of us, but it was perfect. The bathroom was huge! Everything was always clean and the housekeeping staff was so nice. We were so screwed up on our time that sometimes we just slept in and therefore the housekeeping staff would just slide a paper under our door stating that if we would like the room serviced, just to give them a call. So we would call them when leaving for the afternoon and when we arrived back home, our room was in tip-top shape. This hotel is not centrally located, it's on the edge of town by Leidseplein square. However, it is not a far walk to the middle of Amsterdam (about 15 minutes). My friend and I walked everywhere! And that's the best thing to do, because we just strolled along the cobblestone streets looking at buildings that dated back to the 18th century. It's only about a 10-15 minute walk to the Anne Frank House and very close to the market and everything. We absolutely loved this hotel. We are actually planning a return trip to Amsterdam as we tour Europe in the summer of 2012 and we definitely be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “ruined our holiday, a terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: dianneDublin
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is lovely, very modern but on the first day my friends phone was robbed from our hotel room. The staff said there was nothing they could do and offered no compensation. This really ruined our trip but to top it all off after our 3 day stay at the Marriott we were asked if we would like to pay by cash or credit card. We paid in cash and my card was charged anyway to the value of â‚¬750. I was charged bank fees at home and they didnt return it into my account for 7 days. I had no money in my account and when I rang to complain when I got home and discovered the news they said they would put it into my account in 7 days but it couldnt be done any quicker. I was very annoyed at this as I was left pennyless at the end of my holiday as I had paid â‚¬1500 in total for 3 nights stay here and had to pay for my own bank charges. I never got an apology for either of these 2 incidences. It felt very impersonal and I felt humiliated when I went to take money out to pay for my shopping when I arrived home. I would not reccomend this place as the staff were very rude. Location was good though.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: Bagehot99
Reviews.Content: My stays there were in Aug, Sept & Oct 2010, for a cumulated 4 weeks. Even though the building from the outside lacks charm, the hotel in itself is great and all you could expect from a Marriott. Very good service by caring staff, very good health club equipement, perfect location, very good bedding and noise isolation, decent Executive Lounge. Would definitely stay there again on a future trip to Amsterdam. One issue with diner at the bar that took over one hour to arrive after we ordered but after complaining they didn't charge us => Good customer care as a whole

Reviews.Title: “Good location, a bit expensive, no free wireless anywhere in building.”
Reviews.Author: caigy
Reviews.Content: This Marriott is well-located across from the Leidseplein, near the Rijksmuseum and van Gogh museums (5 minute walk), and by the 1,2, and 5 tram lines. Rooms are okay, with updated furnishings, but on the small side and certainly not "luxury" level. Staff was mostly helpful, though some of the younger concierge staff on duty at various times did not seem too knowledgeable about restaurants. And at other times, they did seem knowledgeable, so I guess it depended who was there when we stopped by the concierge desk. The only negative I have to report about the hotel is that the Marriott website was a bit misleading, or at least without complete info about wireless internet service. While it's true there is wireless internet service in the building, it's been a long time since I've been to a business/tourist hotel (this seemed to be both) that did not have free wireless service in the lobby and/or bar area. The only free wireless service was in the executive lounge, which was at lobby level but had controlled entry and passworf controlled wireless access- and only for those with Marriott gold membership or higher. For anyone else, the only way to get wireless service in the lobby or bar is to pay for the service in your room- and only then were you given access elsewhere in the building. In this day and age, I find that completely unacceptable. While I am okay with paying for this service in my room (which I did not), for simple checking of local weather, flight info, local restaurant info and similar, all hotels should offer free wireless access in the lobby area and bar area.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect from beginning to end”
Reviews.Author: mikeinbxl
Reviews.Content: Well placed hotel within 20 minutes walk of all main attractions in Amsterdam. Everything you would expect from a quality hotel. Quiet, comfortable rooms with climate control. Love the breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dexter60811
Reviews.Content: Great Location.. Excellent breakfast.. the most comfortable bed ever!!

Reviews.Title: “My New #1 in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Aurora_Guy
Reviews.Content: The Amsterdam Marriott is an old standard in this historic city for both business travelers and tourists. Â The hotel has undergone some major facelifts recently, not the least of which are a new, modern lobby and a completely revamped, elegant executive lounge now transplanted to the ground floor. Â The new looks share some elements with other hotels in the company's stable, including the creative lighting and ambiance found at the Seattle Waterfront Marriott and the Southport Renaissance in Boston. Â As with other properties, Â modernization extends to the rooms with relatively new bedding, re-done bathrooms, and LCD televisions. Â No surprises there. All this investment speaks well to Marriott's intent to provide some very nice accommodation adjacent to Leidseplein and Vondelpark, two of the liveliest locations in Amsterdam. Nevertheless, when you check prices and Marriott's ranking of this as a Category 6 hotel, do not be led to think this is a luxury hotel by today's market standard. The Amsterdam Marriott is a lovely hotel, but rates over 175 euros per night are simply not competitive given the many other options in the area. Upon my arrival -- my first stay here for several years -- the place had a familiar sense about it. Â Surprisingly, I didn't find the doormen particularly friendly as I have found at the Amsterdam Renaissance hotel as well as others, where the greetings seem genuine. Â The ground floor layout is somewhat confusing for a weary traveler. Â After a minor diversion and a U-turn, I found reception. Â The desk staff were on the ball, though. The clerk easily accommodated my request for a check-in two hours early and even provided an upgraded room on the 11th floor. Â (Even though I'm an elite Marriott Rewards member, I often have difficulty with early check-in, about which many international travelers complain. Airlines and hotels seems to have different ideas about the need to sleep.) Â The clerk took my details, explained the differences in the hotel since my last visit, etc. I often make it a point to ask questions of hotel staff, in part to get a "local" perspective on the area, but also to gain a sense of how committed the hotel is to meet travelers' needs. This hotel passes the test, and the staff overall were very quick to share advice and information. My room was spotless, very comfortable, and well-equipped. The bedding was perfect for this weary traveler to rest up for a long journey home. As I said above, the lounge is really quite elegant with modern decor, yet I found it spacious and relaxing at the same time. For convenience, I had breakfast at in the lounge twice. The offerings were a bit meager, and I was surprised to find the overall quality and freshness only marginal. This is a huge faux pas in a city well-endowed with food suppliers. The hotel could do much, much better here. On the other hand, in the evening the staff and bartender in Sorel's Midtown Bar and Lounge served up some wonderful dishes and adult beverages with an international flare. Sorel's is cozy and casual, and I found it well-suited for either business lunches or as a launch pad before hitting the city at night. Location, location, location. Many trams crisscross Leidseplein, just across the street, for easy access to anywhere in the centrum. Taxis and even canal rides are a few steps from the hotel's front door. The hotel is within easy reach of Schipol Airport, too. Several options are available. When arriving, you can take a train from the airport to Centraal Station, then catch the 1, 2, or 5 tram and alight at Leidseplein. It can be a hassle to travel via tram with large suitcases, though, and the relatively new chipkaart system used on the trams will be confusing for newcomers. The Connexxion shuttle bus is another option, which costs 15 euros one way and takes about 30-60 minutes, depending on stops and traffic. I considered this when leaving, but the concierge at the hotel tipped me to an even better deal. There's an express bus (#370), which stops across the street and costs EUR 4.80 and takes out 30 minutes to/from the airport. The Renaissance Hotel used to be my favorite stop in Amsterdam, but after a couple of disappointments there, I decided to try the Amsterdam Marriott again. I was pleasantly surprised, and I will not hesitate to book there on my next trip, rates permitting. The location is unbeatable, especially for tourists, and the comfort level is a cut above. The hotel offers a number of packages and special offers, so check their web site before booking.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect city location with a guranteed good nights sleep.”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous20107
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a little out of the centre around 15-20 minutes walk in, but it is perfectly located for seeing both sides of the city. Notably this is near the Rijksmuseum, Van Gogh Museum & Vondelpark but as the centre is just a short walk you can easily access all the main attractions. What we found useful was that we could split the city in two and see each side seperately because of the hotels location. The service we received was exemplary - a very friendly welcome at the reception and we were given advice about how to see the city and what sights were a must see. The room was as we would expect, spacious, comfortable and all your needs covered. The beds were so comfortable, which was much needed after a 3 hour delay on our very early flight! As the hotel is out of the centre it was very quiet meaning we were able to have an afternoon nap to recharge our batteries before heading out for a first tour of the city. Plus points about this hotel include the check out its quite late at 12pm so it means you can have a lie in if required, service is friendly and the rooms are well equipped. The only downside we found was that two out of the four elevators were broken so the service down to the lobby was very slow...... we never did find the stairs down?!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, and staff was nice, friendly & very helpful..worth it”
Reviews.Author: SwissAir100
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a few days in AMS, and the Marriott is a good hotel especially for 1st time visitors. The location is fairly central, as it is close to many places like Vondelpark, Museum Qtr, Leidseplein & Rembrandtplein. The transit stops are so close to the hotel, that getting to Centraal Station & Dam Sq are just a quick few mins ride away - suggest getting passes esp. for those new to AMS & want to get around like the locals (if you don't rent a bike, ie). AMS is a very manageable city to walk in & the locals speak English & are very friendly. Requested early check-in, and was to able to get in @ 11:30 am (wonderful quality for a hotel in our books), which was desperately needed after a long flight trip. Concierge was helpful in making reservations as well as suggestions to see, eat & do. Front desk staff were just great, especially the NIGHT STAFF of JANUARY 30th. The young gentleman (name ??) helped us out as there were problems with their business printers, and he went above & beyond to help us print out our tickets. KUDOS TO HIM. The use of the Exec. lounge was great for complimentary sodas, wine & beer. The appetizers were also quite good. If you need something additional, just ask the friendly staff at the lounge, and they will do what they can to help you. Good restaurants on site, as well as very good room service. Health club is 3 levels and well equipped. You can also jog to Vondelpark a couple of blocks down for outdoor exercise. - Only two negatives we had (very minor tho) were the thin walls in our room...rest assured, we could hear a little bit more night time activity than we wanted to hear....Also, if you want to avoid the Leidseplein traffic noise Fri & Sat nights, request a room away from the front. However, other nights aren't as noisy. Secondly, the lack of wireless internet in the rooms - since Marriott caters to business people, we were surprised they didn't have that capability yet...But the new renovations to the lobby & rooms are great. Would very much recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended, good locations, excellent breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Michele1972_05
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, worth your money. Changing of the room in 5 minutes. Clean, quiet, good service. Excellent Breakfast. Good locations, a bit far from the centre, but we wanted that way. Recommended

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great gym”
Reviews.Author: RaffaeleB
Reviews.Content: I loved the gym and the location. The rooms are spacious but in my opinion soon will need renovation. I would also expect free wifi at least in the lobby but unfortunately this is not the case and in my 185 euro rate breakfast (25 euro) was not included. Anyway compared with other hotels in the area it is a good option for a business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Not luxurious, but clean with a great staff and location.”
Reviews.Author: ImAllOverThePlace
Reviews.Content: Staff was friendly, rooms were nice with large beds. Location was amazing walking distance to many sites (van gogh, diamond museum, canal cruises etc) and nightlife. Restaurant had great room service for breakfast and a decent steakhouse on site. It was a good value and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: hkatt
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Dec 22 thru Dec 25th. We stayed on the 10th floor witha balcony. Of course it was below freezing and there was snow on the balcony but we loved be able to go out and look at the beautiful city and the canal. We really enjoyed our stay. It is a great location just a few minutes to shops, bars, restaurants etc. The staff was very helpful, giving directions, making reservations etc. The decor was modern but not over the top. The beds were fabulous. The rooms were a good size and clean. We ate 2 breakfasts here and they were great. They were included in our room rate so I think they would have been a little pricey otherwise. We also ate dinner here and the food was just as good for dinner. I highly recommend the steak.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel - excellent staff & great restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Luxtraveller66
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over Easter for a long weekend. The location is perfect as everything is easily accessible on foot - the canals, Anne Frank House (tip - book tickets online well in advance), shops, flower market etc. We bought a day tram ticket from the concierge and had a wonderful time. On check-in I asked for a twin room as my hubby was full of cold, but none were available due to it being a busy Easter weekend. However, when we got back to our room that afternoon, the delightful receptionist had gifted us a bottle of wine and some nibbles with a note saying "something to help you sleep better!! What a kind and thoughtful gesture. We also ate in the hotel's restaurant one evening as it was raining, and was very pleasantly surprised at how good the food was, so would not hesitate in recommending the restaurant. In fact, people who had not booked were being turned away from 8.30pm onwards, so do book if you want to dine there. You will not be disappointed. A wonderful stay, and we would not hesitate in returning to this Marriott in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: caldoo
Reviews.Content: 10mins by tram from amsterdam central, wonderful location 2min stroll to leidsplein where there is theartres, casino ,bars ,clubs,pubs eating places to cater for every budget the location of this hotel is excellent,check in no problem nice room with great view, staff all nice and helpful room was a good size all in all a great place to stay to discover the dam.Trams from a-dam central are no 1,2 and 5 this costs bout 3 euros taxi i was quoted 25 euros dont need to be einstein to work out the best deal!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to stay in a city rich with hotels”
Reviews.Author: TravelMavenHouston
Reviews.Content: We were in Holland for the Christmas holidays and because of horrid weather all over Europe, family events and illness, we needed to crash for a couple of days in Amsterdam. This was the perfect place: excellent service, food, fabulous location ( a block from the Rijksmuseum, two blocks from the Van Gogh museum. Everyone is bilingual (at least), cordial, helpful. The restaurant is excellent (their onion soup is not too salty), the steaks and chops superb. Even room service Eggs Benedict were PERFECT. So, while I hope your trip to Amsterdam occurs in better circumstances than ours did, I really recommend this hotel if you want an "American" hotel to come home to each evening.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and comfortable... but not 5 star”
Reviews.Author: Kims0304
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 6 nights for a business trip. The room was clean and comfortable enough. The location was good, in between the city center and the Rai. But any resemblance with a 5-star hotel is merely a coincidence. The reception staff was not particularly helpful, I had to repeatedly call Housekeeping for items they delivered only on the 4th day of my stay, had to remove the toilet brush from the toilet bowl, and found the room very small with the sofa squeezed tight between the window and the bed. The best part of the hotel is the Midtown Grill restaurant, which hosts the hotel's excellent breakfast buffet and serves good food and wine for dinner with friendly wait staff. All in all it was an OK stay, but it certainly did not have a 5-star feel to it, which left me rather disappointed. I might stay here again for business, but would not recommend it to my friends for a vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice size room and decor”
Reviews.Author: Nikko4Me
Reviews.Content: The Marriott is in a great location near the Vondelpark as well as Leidseplein and a quick tram ride to the museums. Our room was beautifully decorated and fairly spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: PamieP
Reviews.Content: I ahve stayed here before and love the location. You can walk everywhere, or take a trolly or bus from right outside the hotel There is a bus to the airport for only 4 euros. Nice rooms, though ask for 2 double beds to get a larger room.

Reviews.Title: “Still great”
Reviews.Author: FeatStick
Reviews.Content: It is the second time I stay in this hotel and the quality of the service is as good as last time. The staff is very helpful and professional, the situation is simply perfect and the rooms are comfortable and quite spacious. When we went there with a friend of mine, it was snowing, sightseeing was really exhausting as we had to cope with the cold and wind and it was a real pleasure to be back in a cosy hotel like the Marriott Amsterdam. The location is perfect, right in front of Leidsplein where are plenty of pubs and restaurants. The casino is just on the opposite side of the canal, 500m away maximum. The museum district is not far either, one just need to cross the Vondel Park which is right next to the hotel. I could only recommend this hotel for a stay in Amsterdam, it is very convenient to discover the city in good conditions.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BoysInNY
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is very good, and it is easily accessible by the trams going all over Amsterdam. The hotel is a short tram ride from Centraal Station (Lines 1 or 5), and about a 30-minute bus ride from the airport (Route 129). Taxis cost anywhere from 40-60 Euros. It is also a short walk to the Van Gogh museum and some high-end stores. There is also a park really close by if you want to ride your bike or run. The hotel itself is very nice. The lobby, check in area, restaurant and bar are all on the first floor and decorated very well. The lobby has many sofas and chairs to wait for people, and it also has a nice warm fire. Our room was on the 6th floor and faced away from the street. Needless to say, it was very quiet. The room is relatively large for European standards, so we were pleasantly surprised. The bed was very comfortable and large! There is a flat-panel TV in the room that has many English speaking stations. Also, the closet space is ample, and if you plan to work, the desk has plenty of space to spread out. The only downside is that the internet access or wi-fi is expensive. The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful as well - from the check-in staff to the bell boys. Overall, I would recommend staying at this hotel on your next trip to Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Our first five star hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: MiouMiou
Reviews.Content: I should preface this review by stating that our two week stay at this hotel was paid for by my husband's company, as he was sent to Amsterdam on business, and spouses could come along as well. This is a nice hotel, it is considered a "five star hotel". This was a first for us, our style is more like a "no star" hotel, but we certainly can appreciate nice things. So, because the company was paying for the trip, we had a room on the 9th floor, which is considered the "executive" floor. With that "perk" came access to the Executive Lounge, which I will talk about later. The location of the hotel is very good if you are a tourist , since it is within walking distance to the Van Gogh Museum and the Rijkmuseum, as well as the Vondel Park and Leidesplein. Leidseplein is an area very close to the hotel where there are a large variety of restaurants, bars, Boom Chicago Comedy Club, and the music hall. You do have to walk about a block or so if you want to get the tram to anywhere else. If you are staying in Amsterdam for any length of time it is worth it to go the Tourist Bureau across the street from Centraal Station and buy a 7 day or more tram pass. You will save a lot of money, and can use the trams as many times as you want on those days. Just remember to swipe your tram card going into and exiting the tram, otherwise you are subject to a hefty fine by the tram police. The hotel does not sell tram tickets, nor apparently does the Albert Heijn supermarket. You can buy a one hour trams ticket on the tram itself but you will pay 50 cents extra for the privilege. I thought the hotel was too far away from Centraal Station, since I had previously lived in Holland and my interests this trip were to mainly get to Centraal Station to catch a train somewhere else to visit friends and family. (FYI, it takes about 30 minutes to get from the Marriott to Centraal Station). The hotel itself is very clean. We thought the concierge service was wonderful. I became quite ill on my third day in Holland, and needed medical care. Mark, the concierge (if I recall his name correctly) was very kind, calling up the doctor, arranging an appointment for me, then arranging for a taxi to get me there. I was very surprised to read other's reviews stating they felt the concierge was indifferent. My husband and I were looking for very particular restaurants to eat at, and the concierge came through for us every single time. Our room was very large. We had a gorgeous view. The room was quiet, and the bed was a pillow top, very comfy and luxurious with all its' pillows and duvet. The room was always very clean, and the staff would come before bedtime to see if we needed anything else and drop off chocolates, or some other light snack. The bathroom was large and well equipped with all the usual toiletries, as well as a hairdryer, and lots of towels, as well as a bathrobe and slippers. The bathtub was very large, and you needed to step carefully as it had a very high side. We had a coffee machine (which is unusual for European hotel rooms) and a tea service. There was also a small refrigerator. We had a very large closet as well as a ironing board and iron. There was a full sized work desk, a very comfy recliner, and a large dresser. Wake up service was always efficient. We used both the air conditioning and the heat, and both worked very well. I did not look at the exercise room, so I won't comment on that. We did meet friends at the bar several times, and the drinks were quite good, priced about the same as any other bar in Amsterdam. I did not eat at the restaurant, but my husband did several times with colleagues, and he said the food was very good. We did order room service a few times (once for burgers, believe it or not, which were overcooked) and dessert, which was very good). I don't want to forget to mention that you could always borrow an umbrella, which comes in handy in rainy Holland. The biggest "perk" as far as I was concerned, was the Executive Lounge. I ate breakfast in there every morning. My husband also ate in the regular dining room, since his colleagues wanted more than a buffet breakfast, but the dining room was very, very expensive. The breakfast in the Executive Lounge had everything you could want, cold cuts, all sorts of fresh bread and rolls, cheeses, herring, fruit juices, the best tea and coffee maker ever (it made frothing hot milk), eggs (hard boiled and what was probably powdered scrambled eggs). A huge selection of sodas and beers, all included in whatever you would pay for the executive room stay. There were daily newspapers to read, large screen tvs's to watch, comfy couches, and attentive cleaning people. The souvenir shop was actually better than most of the "touristy" shops downtown. It had a very nice selection of some interesting items we could not find anywhere else (for example, a "delft style" nightlight of a little dutch girl and boy kissing (you have seen it before) and the prices of the t-shirts were even slightly less than the other shops. Apparently there was free laundry service here as well, but we did not use that. Free coffee and tea is offered every morning. When we arrived at the hotel our room was not ready (since we came in from The States), but the concierge service very pleasantly stored all our baggage while we went out to visit family, and when we returned everything was ready for us. We both enjoyed the stay at this hotel. If it were in our price range (which I am sure it will never, ever be) we would stay here again. On "our own dime" we like the Hotel Schiphol A-4, even though it is located outside of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been more pleasant”
Reviews.Author: DGA66
Reviews.Content: Clean, modern and quiet. The staff were very pleasant and helpful. We had requested a high. quiet room and that's what we got. We are Marriott Elite members so the benefits of the Executive Lounge were manifest. The location was perfect for us, with easy access to trams, etc. Highly recommended. I would return happily.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean room, comfy bed...”
Reviews.Author: blckscream
Reviews.Content: We were 4 girls in a double room, stayed for 3 nights. The Marriott was recommended to us by several different people - mainly for it's location. And I have to agree - the location is great. You still have a good walk from the hotel to the hot spots but you can walk to lots of areas within 5 minutes as it's very central. Also, most destinations are a 5 minute taxi away. The hotel was very clean as were the rooms. The beds were amazingly comfortable!! Super fluffy and awesome. The room & bathroom were fairly large, so that was nice. 2 things that irked us: 1.) No wireless internet in the room!! Grrr! Annoying!!! 2.) We brought our blow dryer from home and every time we used it - it triggered the fire alarm (though it's a silent alarm). Each time the security guard barged into our room (despite the fact that we weren't dressed) to check it out. This got VERY annoying VERY quickly. We had to keep the windows open each time & deal with the security team barging into the room. Also, the concierge could use some improvements- they were semi-helpful, but did not go out of their way to help us either with recommendations, calling a taxi or for directions. Overall, it was a nice experience. If you're looking for a clean room with comfy bed and central location at a cheap rate then this should be your pick. But if you want ambiance, vibe, and customer service - this is probably not your spot.

Reviews.Title: “I am sure there is much better in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Franz21
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from a week-end with friends in Amsterdam in we stayed at the Marriott. We mainly chose the hotel because it was one of the few where we could share one room in three people. Apparently there are not many hotels offering triple rooms in Amsterdamâ€¦ The best feature of the hotel is the location - right between the historic centre and the Vondel Park. It is just perfect, you can walk everywhere. From the airport there is a bus (197) that leaves you in Leidseplein (2 mins from the hotel) and from the central station there are several tram lines going there, so it's easy to reach. As for the hotel itself, the room was fine, clean, the bed comfortable, TV channel choice ok. The service was adequate but from Marriot I expected more: although we specified in the booking that we would be three in the room and hence needed two double beds, upon arrival we were given a room with a queen bed and almost no space to put a rollaway bed. We complained, they responded that the two double beds are not guaranteed; we asked why do you accept a reservation for 3 people (declaring a maximum occupancy of 4 people in that category of room) and then place them in a tiny room with a queen bed and one person supposedly sleeping on the floor? It turned out that there were double rooms with two double beds still available so they just did not bother to check in advance. Pointless hassle and half an hour lost. We got the room though! Overall, I share the impression of some other reviewers that the only thing 4-star about this place is the lobby and the price. Decor is quite outdated; no tea/coffee making facilities in the room; minimum toiletries (i.e. no shaving kit) and especially a staggering 7.5 EUR charge for 30 minute internet surfing at the business centre. I find this offensive for a place charging +200 EUR per night (and it is not a little boutique hotel in the middle of nowhere). Summing up, unless you get a very good deal with room rate (130 EUR or less) I am sure there is much better in Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and clean hotel. Excellent...”
Reviews.Author: pyotrek
Reviews.Content: Very nice and clean hotel. Excellent steaks in the restaurant. Good location. Value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel- great location and very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: global5000pilot
Reviews.Content: Checkin took a long time- doesn't seem like they have enough desks for the amount of guests, but they did give us an early (noon) check-in, which we really appreciated. Staff was very nice. Being a Marriott gold, they automatically upgraded me to a very nice suite. Very nice concierge room. Internet worked great. The health club is very nice for a hotel. Bar and restaurant looked very nice- chose to eat at one of the many restaurants across the street- great walking mall with plenty of large pubs, cafes, shops and restaurants. Easy access to all the sites.

Reviews.Title: “consistently solid choice in the heart of amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: thekeone
Reviews.Content: Having lived in Amsterdam for six years, I know how hard it is to find a decent hotel at an affordable price. Most of the hotels have rooms that are so small, you develop claustrophobia. The Marriott Amsterdam is nothing special, but it is consistent. The rooms are mirror images of the standard Marriott rooms in the U.S. If you are familiar with the Marriott brand in the US, you'll be content staying at their Amsterdam location as well. The rooms are an adequate size and the hotel is clean and well located.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for business user but no feeling of amsterdam for leisure user”
Reviews.Author: dawninwarsaw
Reviews.Content: My husband was in Amsterdam for business and we decided to travel with him for the weekend. The Marriott is well located, near Vondelpark, Museumplein and Canals, but unlike other European cities location is not so essential although I would think that the location of the Marriott would be preferable to a Central Station location where there are many hotels. The service, cleanliness, breakfast offer can not be faulted however once inside the hotel there is no reference to Netherlands or Holland. We had access to the executive lounge which offered complimentary breakfast, drinks and snacks through out the day, which for business traveler or those in transit is perfect but if you are on a weekend break to discover Amsterdam I would recommend you stay somewhere more Dutch

Reviews.Title: “A perfect location to visit Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Seamus0
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel with most helpful staff who were well versed in all aspects of the city. Beautiful room in excellent condition. Great buffet breakfast each morning.
