The Bar was a little dull and had no atmosphere in the evening. The attached Restaurant was very good if a little pricey. Overall we enjoyed our visit very much for three days.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: alleneinstein
Reviews.Content: if you are a rewards member, they have an amazing lounge. other than that the location is amazing. right around the corner from so many shops and restaurants. about 10 mins walk from red light district. walked to everything, train station, canals, flower shops, coffee shops, restaurants. i loved it. rooms were great. service was great. location is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “At discounted rate of 120 Euro/night: INCOMPARABLE!”
Reviews.Author: Najmeh
Reviews.Content: We got a really good value for the money. I am not sure I would want to pay 700 Euros; that was the suggested price for the room we got which had the highest ceiling i had ever seen; an elegant minimalist decor; and a somewhat awkward bathroom: the doorway was so slim that I bumped into it in the middle of the night and suffered an injury for the next 4 weeks :) I would stay there again because it is located centrally: walking distance from the trainstation. By the same virtue; it may also feel uncomfortable at night because the hotel is very close to the red light district!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location service and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Deepakvw
Reviews.Content: enroute to a cruise to Norway we stayed at the Marriott, the staff on arrival was very helping and made us feel at home. the room for triple occupancy was a little tight but contained 2 queen size beds but not enough room to open our suitcases and leave them open we had to clear the space once done but the location and proximity to the tram station and the busy stopping area was a minutes walk.I would love to stay again but next time we shall book double rooms instead of triple

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great location, very expensive”
Reviews.Author: scbaker
Reviews.Content: The service was great (very friendly staff at check in), the location was great (too bad I was on business and didn't get a chance to take advantage) and the room was pretty comfortable. My only complaint would be the price - 250 euro for one night. For a Marriott? Ouch! If it were my dime, I'd find somewhere a little cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Renovated since last stay- Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: gottogonow
Reviews.Content: When we were last at this hotel it was not great and my review reflected it! This was our third visit to Amsterdam and we chose staying at the Marriott because it was the first visit for the friends we were traveling with and they had Marriott points that they wanted to use. I was hesitant, but because the hotel is in the best location for sightseeing and it had been renovated I decided to give it another chance. I am glad we did. It is still not a bargain but the rooms were lovely and had everything we needed for a delightful stay. We requested a coffee setup in the room and I was a happy camper. My only complaint has nothing to do with this property specifically, but with Marriott, Hyatt and some of the other high end hotel chains we use. Where is the free wi fi? This is the 21 century! It is not that expensive and not having free internet is a deal breaker for a lot of us!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Francescogala
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Marriott in Amsterdam for 1 night. I would like to pint that the customer service was just great. Rooms are very clean but not as You would expect from a Marriott Hotel in the USA . People are very professional and nice.

Reviews.Title: “decent”
Reviews.Author: peter_90212
Reviews.Content: the hotel is situated nicely and the rooms are quite nicer than the facade. make sure to get a room to the back, there you may sleep with an open window. the front rooms are incredibly noisy. one day the hot water was cut off for 5 hours and no one seened it necessary to inform us. unfortunate ly there is no coffee making ficilty in the room, that you may exprct from a hotel that is rated 5 star. all in all a decent deal after all. location, location, location

Reviews.Title: “Good quality hotel, ideal location”
Reviews.Author: where2travel
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Marriott Amsterdam and the hotel met my expectations (my earlier stay was a few years ago and I think they may have refurbished the rooms since then). The hotel is quite large and often busy and so lacks some of the more personal feel of other hotels, particularly the reception area which is often crowded and a bit chaotic. Having said that, this didn't affect my stay (just an observation). The hotel seems to be marketed as a 5* but I do feel this is over-rated and the hotel falls short of what I would expect for a 5* experience - in my view, it's a solid 4* hotel and delivers well against this. Both check-in and check-out were quick and efficient and all the staff we encountered seemed helpful and friendly. The room we had was very clean and comfortable and contained everything we expected. Overall, the room was perhaps a little smaller than I thought it would be but adequately-sized, with enough space so it didn't feel cramped. The bed was very comfortable and the bedding was nice. The bathroom had a bath with a shower in it. The shower was good, powerful and the bathroom clean. A number of toiletries were included and replaced each day but they looked a bit cheaper than I would expect from a chain such as the Marriott. Everything in the room and bathroom was clean and well looked after. The main reason I like this hotel is the location - it's easy to get from the Airport (I got the 197 bus which is â‚¬4 and stops right opposite the hotel, a 20-25 minute journey from the airport in light traffic). We walked everywhere we went from the hotel and didn't use the trams at all for this visit. It's 10 or so minutes walk from Dam Square and another 10 minutes to Centraal Station. The main museums, Vondelpark, De Pijp are all a short walk from the hotel as well. For those people that prefer to use the trams to get around the city, there are a number of tram lines running close to the hotel with more running through Leidseplein just a few minutes walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience!”
Reviews.Author: fmb52
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and helpful; the ambience was terrific. Location was excellent. Room was very nice. Can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, great staff”
Reviews.Author: navsingh12
Reviews.Content: Wonderful amenities, VERY close to the city centre and all attractions. The staff was friendly and you are going to save money on trains if you stay here since you can walk everywhere!

Reviews.Title: “Booked hotel via priceline he week before...”
Reviews.Author: aberdeenlass1903
Reviews.Content: Booked hotel via priceline he week before we went and paid Â£65 plus taxes per night. Because of this I am delighted with this hotel. It is meant to be 5 star but its lacking that certain something to get it there. Room was nice and staff very helpfull. We arrived early at 11am and they gave us a room straight away with no hassle. They even looked to see what the best room available was for us.I know this may be matter of course but it was typical to the good service we received throughout. We tried the pancake place accross the road 1 morning for breakfast but wasn't that impressed. 1 min walk away in the main square is the pancake house. Its a bar type place that never seems to close and does breakfast along with main meals at really cheap prices. My boyfriend had all you can eat ribs for 9 euros. For evening entertainment boom chicago comedy club also near to the hotel was excellent. Overall- I would stay at the hotel again if I got a good deal but I don't think I'd be happy to pay the Â£180 a nice official price.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for families”
Reviews.Author: PLimPortland_OR
Reviews.Content: My wife and two boys (aged 12 & 9) spent four nights at the Marriott Amsterdam in late June and thoroughly enjoyed the hotel. We did not have much success in finding a hotel that offered one room for four and, luckily, the Marriott came through. The room was on the small side but the beds were very comfortable and the room/bathroom was very clean. We also liked the location, close to the Leidesplan and Vondelpark, though, as we quickly learned, all Amsterdam sights are a short tram ride away. We did not opt for the breakfast-included plan (we used this time to explore the immediate area) but would consider it on future visits. My one suggestion to hotel management would be to offer free/password-protected wifi access to guests. I am sure this would raise the visibility of the property to would-be guests, especially those who have narrowed their choices to 1-2 properties.

Reviews.Title: “A good overall experience but service could have been better”
Reviews.Author: donnambrown
Reviews.Content: I booked a room some months ago for myself, my husband and his mother - because we were only staying for three nights we thought a deluxe room with two doubles would be a better alternative than two rooms. I asked twice in advance for a two double bed room and was told it couldn't be guaranteed but they would try. When we arrived I was told that there was only a room with a queen bed but a roll out could be put in the room. This was 8 p.m. We went out for dinner and came back at 11 p.m. - no bed. I called reception. Half an hour later I had to request it again. Finally, it arrived. It was a tight squeeze to fit it in to the room but we did manage and, although it was cosy, we all slept well. Other (minor) quibbles included: being over charged by 8 Euros for water from the minibar (we didn't have anything from the minibar - the charge was later removed after I queried it) and service was a little slow in the bar later at night. Express checkout didn't work on the morning of our departure so we were delayed waiting at reception. These gripes notwithstanding, the hotel was very clean and tidy, calls were answered quickly by the reception desk and the cocktails at the bar were very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Windsong70
Reviews.Content: I took a shuttle from the airport and it dropped me right off at the hotel. Checking in was a breeze and the hotel room was on the small side, but nice. I slept wonderfully! The breakfast isn't cheap, but the food is very good. I felt safe staying at this hotel by myself.

Reviews.Title: “American Hotel with European Service”
Reviews.Author: Schlitterbahn
Reviews.Content: Our stay started off with a receptionist who would not honor the fact that my husband's father booked the room under his name/marriott account. She was extremely rude and talked to us like children (we're in our 30s) - telling us we should know better than to have the room booked under someone else's name, etc. (His father did it for us as an anniversary present.) A few days later in the trip, my husband went down to the gift shop area for some shaving cream. I gave him 8.50 Euros - he had it in his head that I said 6 Euros - so when the total was 6.50 Euros in the shop and he told the lady "I'm sorry, all I have is 6 Euros" - she looked in his hand, smiled and said "oh, that's ok" and took it. I realize 2 Euros is not much in the grand scheme of things, but it's just the principle that she "stole" it. Also, in the bar/restaurant area, the only waitress they had could not have been more scatterbrained. She forgot our orders left and right, and as we were leaving we heard other people complaining about her forgetting their orders as well. If it was busy, I could maybe let it slide, but there were only 4 tables of people in at the time. The only thing this hotel has going for it is American sized rooms and washer/dryer use for free. Oh and there was no free wifi/internet. Get with it Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “American standarts in the heart of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: nicasso
Reviews.Content: the hotel met our expectations for a Marriott..... we had a quad room and it was a bit small, but all the hotel rooms in Amsterdam are small.... the room was very clean, it had AC which was important to us but no free internet and the staff was nice and helpful. it is conveniently located close to the Museums, a canal cruise, and about 15 min. walk from Anne Frank. neighborhood is nice to walk in and there are many places to eat around... just accross from the hotel near the canal there is a great pancake place.... overall very good and reccomended.

Reviews.Title: “V.Good but.....5 stars???”
Reviews.Author: dennieok
Reviews.Content: On the 9th of July, my family and I went to Amsterdam . We stayed in the Marriott Hotel.The reception was very modern and plush.The staff seemed very pleasent .We were hoping for a swimming pool but unfortunately there was'nt one, this was one of the let downs for this 5 star hotel. We got a deluxe room, the beds were very comfy and there was great air con as it was so hot the days we were there.We could have had a better view over the canal but ours was just looking out at the opposite rooms. It was very well located in the centre of the city.There was great buzz in the city as it was world cup final weekend! I really do wonder why this hotel is 5 stars but other than that My family and I had a great time in Amsterdam. I would definately recommend this hotel to others!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, free laundry machines.....”
Reviews.Author: MaineTravel50
Reviews.Content: This Marriott is in the heart of the Amsterdam and situated perfectly for exploring the city. Almost everything you want to do and see is within walking distance. There are free laundry machines for guests which is wonderful if you have been traveling for any length of time. This is mostly a tourist hotel and the staff has a somewhat jaded and cavalier attitude toward guests, but like all Marriotts, their training seems to overcome their weariness with travelers. The internet is way overpriced at almost 20 euros a day and even at that price, is not reliable. There were also major problems with the elevators and one of our party got stuck once, with the back up emergency call system in the elevator failing to work at all. Major code violation!

Reviews.Title: “compact , comfortable luxury hotel in city centre”
Reviews.Author: Europeaninindia
Reviews.Content: Fantastic central location, within walking distance of almost everything I wanted to see in Amsterdam. The hotel is compact and does not impress in size, grandeur or facilities compared to its 5-star competitors. However, if as for me, on a brief stopover, then you will enjoy this hotel's proximity to the sights of the city with a plush design feel to it. The multicuisine restaurant is a great place to people watch through its expansive windows, and the snug extension to the bar could be a great place for a late night apertif. The business centre is chic and sophisticated and very different from the usual drabness one experiences at chain hotels. The rooms are comfortable- and usual Marriott quality.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful service, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: suerocks27
Reviews.Content: The Marriott is located right at the end of Leidsplein, a great spot to be! It is right near the hop on/hop off canal bus, the Van Gogh Museum, Rijksmuseum, Vondel Park, and Leidsplatz. A 10-15 minute walk to the Centraal train station and anywhere else, really. We were given a beautiful room witha gorgeous view of Leidsplein. They were happy to empty our fridge so we could use it for our own supplies. The concierges were helpful (ignoring the one who suggested we stay at the hotel to eat...you have no better option?), and for my birthday they helped us find a lovely restaurant around the corner plus helped my husband with some other birthday surprises. Even the bellhops would pitch in to help us with buying tickets or directions. The gym was ok but crowded with only two treadmills and two ellipticals plus a ton of machines. Overall we very much enjoyed our stay at this Marriott!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and View”
Reviews.Author: 01ofvisadventures
Reviews.Content: Close proximity to Leidseplein and just a fabulous view. The room we were in was on the rather large side, by European standards. Very top floor on the left hand side, and the balcony was HUGE! On my last visit to Amsterdam we stayed on the other side of town, and the view of the canal with the beautiful mahogany boats was fantastic. I liked it, as well, but this hotel has a totally different vibe. The other Marriott is very quiet and nestled in a peaceful neighborhood. This one is bustling and close to everything. The Executive Lounge was very nice here, with the wine and cocktails as complimentary, and the attendant extra helpful and friendly. She was happy to package up treats for me to take back to the room, even sending me on my way with a large cup of Baileys for my bedtime coffee. We had no issues with noise at all, and were never disturbed, so I would suggest a high floor. In all, a very nice stay. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Undistinguished rooms with a ripoff restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Ken43708
Reviews.Content: One good thing you can say about the Marriott brand, you pretty much get what you expect in a room and the Marriott Amsterdam provides a clean, quiet, comfortable room. We redeemed points for this trip but I would strongly consider staying here even if paying as it is quite convenient to the transit and sightseeing. Beware, however, of the restaurant. When we were unable to find any outside breakfast opportunities, we retreated to the hotel restaurant for the opportunity to pay 76.50 euros for breakfast for four. You should note that my mother and my wife both ate very lightly and my father and I had what I would call a typical English breakfast. They added insult to injury - the injury was a coffee pot with only five servings - by charging for another pot of coffee. Consider staying here for a reliable sleeping experience but do everything you can to take your meals eleswhere.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: DKK031
Reviews.Content: Good hotel both for business and leisure. Well located. Friendly, helpful staff. Rooms are a very good standard. Nice fitness facility. Restaurant pricey, but good food. Excellent value for money for business trips with a corporate rate, otherwise look for deals.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, very Comfortable, a bit pricey”
Reviews.Author: EndyBOSTON
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel at a great location, next to a Tram stop that will take you to the Central Station. Also, right next to Downtown Amsterdam, nice walk to Dam square and all the shops on Heiligeweg. The rooms are clean and comfy, no surprise there since it's a Marriott. The price is bit up there though, if you're going on business, it's a great place to be with the executive lounge serving free breakfast, and snacks in the afternoon, did I mention free pop and BEER at the executive lounge? The fitness room at this hotel is the best that I've seen so far, big and full of machines and free weights that goes up to 90 lbs.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Expat-in-Schweiz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is what you expect of a Marriott hotel. Good rooms, clean and in a good location. They serve a breakfast buffet (not included in the price) at 22 euros or 18 euros for the continental buffet. You can also order a la carte. Omelet prices are about 9 euros. Their buffet price is comparable to others in the area and certainely cheaper than other Marriotts in Europe. There is a pancake house (serves breakfast) across the street with outside seating on the canal. We first had room 621 and it smelled like sewers. They changed our room the next day to 636 and at breakfast time (although we were on the 6th floor) it smelled as if someone was cooking next door. The smell lingered for a few hours. Bad ventilation system.... The breakfast crew were super with great attitude and went out of their way to help, doorman and bellhop as well. Front desk and concierge good but not excellent. Internet access is very expensive. the cost is 20 euros for 24 hours and it is not wireless in the room. You can use their internet in the lobby at a cost of 7.50 euros for 15 minutes. Outrageous, if you ask me... We would stay again at this property....

Reviews.Title: “So expensive and internet not included -- Marriott you can do better than that!”
Reviews.Author: golfingaround
Reviews.Content: Great location (I know, as I am from Amsterdam myself) -- had to stay overnight for a conference there. My fellow conventionist also thought it a bit expensive to say the least and what a shame -- internet charged at a really ridiculous price. This is not of this age, Marriott -- I always like your service and quality, but this iBahn thing is a rip-off. Anyway room for improvement, food is also not what Marriott is able to. Counting on improvement. Include internet for free and you CAN be recommended....

Reviews.Title: “Reliable Comfort”
Reviews.Author: Melanocyte
Reviews.Content: We stayed here briefly during a quick trip to Amsterdam. Though this hotel may lack the character of some smaller boutique hotels, we found it a reliable and comfortable Marriott hotel. We were quite pleased to find our room ready when we arrived, several hours prior to the official check-in time. Our room was quiet and of adequate size, with a very pleasant view of the Leidseplein area. Beds were comfortable and not overly firm. The bathroom was small but modern, with a shower that featured a curtain stretching the full width of the shower (unlike the half-walls, which seem to allow water to go everywhere, common in Europe). A hair-dryer was provided, though it repeatedly shut-off after just a few minutes of use. Within the room, we heard no noise from the hallway and hotel itself, though some noise was audible at times from the busy street outside. The room seemed quite clean when we arrived, and housekeeping employees we encountered were friendly, but some dirt we tracked in on the first day remained on the bathroom floor throughout our stay, and some hair in the tub after the first use of shower was never removed. No free wifi was available, but a nice-- if unusual-- feature was a laundry room with a free washer and dryer (as well as free laundry detergent), which proved useful after we were caught in a downpour. We found the location of this hotel convenient. The hotel is just several blocks from the Rijksmuseum and Van Gogh Museum, and we found we were able to explore much of the central area of Amsterdam on foot. The concierge was helpful with arranging a bus tour to Keukenhof and purchasing museum tickets, which saved us from standing in lines upon arrival at the museums.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with easy access to city”
Reviews.Author: cblam99
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in walking distance to the Heineken Experience. Across the street was a hop on/hop off canal tour company. The bar had an amazing view of surrounding area and a great place to people watch for dinner or just drinks. The bellman and concierge had great recommendations for whatever type of activities you are looking for and they are very knowledgable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Easy to get to bit on the expensive side though”
Reviews.Author: jjn42b
Reviews.Content: The Marriott is very easy to get to either by Bus (197 or 320), Train or Taxi. We went via bus having bought a return ticket at the airport, took about 30mins to go from just outside the airport to about 1min walk from the hotel. The reception area and staff were very welcoming and staff very helpful. Roomâ€™s nice size, clean with all you need for a break whether for work or leisure. Bar area nice and what looked like a nice restaurant but did not eat in the hotel. The only thing to say about this hotel is that because it is so well placed (loads of shops, restaurants, Heineken Museum and the Rijks Museum) you can get road noise if you leave a window open.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, good location and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: IJG
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott for 2 nights in April and we were happy with the service and quality of the hotel. We arrived at the hotel in the early morning and we were able to check in straight away, which was fantastic considering we had just been on a 25h flight. The room was very clean and tidy and rather spacious for European standards. We couldn't hear any outside noise from the street (we were on the 5th floor) or corridors. It is a easy tram ride (number 5), it takes about 5 minutes or it is approximately a 25 minute walk from the central train station. We wouldn't recommend walking if you have luggage though, as it is all cobble roads the entire way. It's location is pretty good, you have the Rijksmuseum, Van Gogh and Heineken museums just around the corner, five minutes walking. The Anne Frank house and red light district is about a 20 to 25 minute walk (depending on your speed) but is a pretty easy walk straight down the canals. The only negative part to this hotel is that unlike many European hotels, you had to pay for the wireless internet (which was rather pricey). Overall we would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: gbdecor
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights and had a wonderful experience. The rooms are quite large by European standards, the restaurant was very good and the concierge(daytime) was extremely helpful with very good suggestions. It is in a very nice area of Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Best accomodation for young family with a car”
Reviews.Author: chmeliar
Reviews.Content: We searched long and hard for a hotel that would meet the needs of our family. We had with us 2 young sons and a car. It is not the easiest thing to find a room that will accomodate 4 people to a room, not to mention on-site parking. Be aware that parking at the Marriott is 30 euros a day, but it was worth it for us. The hotel is just beautiful and felt like a total splurge, as we normally go for middle-of-the-road accomodations when we have to get a room. The room was modern, very clean, and very pretty. We got a room with 2 double-sized beds. The beds were excellent. My husband and I (who are used to a king-sized bed) slept great in one bed, and my boys in the other. The staff was very friendly and made our stay that much better. We lucked out and got a room away from the elevator and ice machine, so it was nice and quiet. Sure, I would've liked to have found something lower priced, but anything in the area seems to cost more that we'd like, right? The location was just fantastic and we'd choose to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Amsterdam Trip”
Reviews.Author: ATLTravelBug18
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Amsterdam Marriott for a Spring Break getaway, and it was wonderful. Not only is the location very central and convenient to the city centre, but the quality of the rooms/ interior is excellent. The rooms were very clean, and the staff (especially concierge services) were outstanding. We were able to walk to many shops & restaurants, and, for our tour of Keukenhof, we were picked up right at the hotel. I agree with another review indicating the outside architecture of the hotel is not beautiful, but the location and overall experience more than make-up for the rather bland exterior design. I would certainly recommend this room to others, especially families looking for a room with 2 double beds (these are hard to find in Europe).

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience!”
Reviews.Author: vacaay2009
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks ghetto from outside, but is very nice from the inside! The lobby is very inviting, hotel staff is excellent and helpful, and best of all the location is superb! By the time we were here, the construction had finished. There are PLENTY of eating places, cafes, shops, all around the Leidsplein plaza which this is located in, so plenty of choices. It can get a bit noisy at night on the weekends. Trams 1, 2, and 5 are literally right infront of the hotel. These three trams will take you directly to central station. If you are coming from the airport, buy a strip card from one of the bookstores and then take the bust 197 to the Leidsplein stop. The bus will stop infront of the hotel. only down side was that housekeeping didnt replenish soaps and toilettries until we requested to and then they did. And any good channel on the tv you had to pay for, but not a real big problem since we spent most of our time outside of the hotel. But on the whole a GREAT experience...would stay here again if Im in amsterdam and would recommend this to any prospective traveler.

Reviews.Title: “American Hotel in Amsterdam? Why Stay Here when there are better choices?”
Reviews.Author: HPM1984
Reviews.Content: Okay- why stay in the Marriott in Amsterdam? Let me list the reasons why I did and would do this...followed by why I would not. Why stay? 1. Because you know what to expect... It is a Marriott in every sense of the word...you could be at the DFW Airport (well the views are different) or Philly, or LA or almost anywhere- the rooms, the workout facilities the lounge all scream "American!". I don't mean this pejoratively- simply take this for what it is. 2. Nice meeting areas and semi-private sitting areas around the restaurant and lounge for informal business dicussions. We used these and they are relaxing and informal. 3. Location- we walked to the the Concertgebow in 7 minutes- right in the middle of old Amstedam-and the views of old town from the upper floors are charming 4. Set up for business travels- painless- decent workout room (good but not great), executive lounge- internet charge is steep at 19 Euro a day and no WIFI (for Europe this is NOT understandable) so you are linked to a wire in your room. Hard to understand how Marriot could have missed this. Bottom line if you are not adventuresome, are on business and are an American need the feel of America in Holland then this is the place for you. Plus the location is tops Why Not? Well for starter this city is chock full of hotels/pensioners that are charming and Dutch in culture- there are at least five or six nice ones. Here are the ones I stuck my head in the door of and might be worth a chance (I think there are reviews of these in Trip Advisor): 1. Fusion Suites (pricey but beautiful- but no more expensive than the Marriott 2. Seven Bridges (less expensive than Marriott- very nice and location just as good!) 3.Hotel Esthera (excellent location, less expensive than Marriot- cutsey Dutch WallPaper) If I were not on business with colleagues and did not have meetings scheduled at the Marriot I would encourage travelers to try the hotels I listed above rather than the Marriot despite the bland niceness of the hotel and the location!

Reviews.Title: “More elegant than I expected; perfect location”
Reviews.Author: travelerkt
Reviews.Content: Ok, first the caveat: There is no local flavor to this hotel, nothing to tell you you're in Amsterdam; from the outside, it looks as though it was designed by a renegade Soviet architect. Beyond that, it's truly terrific. Chic touches (post-modern fireplace in the lobby; small, trendy bar with private, glass-enclosed lounges) surround a very good business hotel that would leave most leisure travelers thrilled. Situated at the foot of the Leindseplein, it is within walking distance of many of the major museums; and much of the best top- mid- and bottom-end shopping. And if you need to get anywhere else in town, three tram stops -- serving seven routes -- are across the street (you can buy up to a four-day pass.) Canal boat cruises leave from, virtually, the side door of the hotel. The rooms are standard for the better Marriotts, which is to say, quite good: clean with high-quality bedding, flat-screen TVs, good working space, sockets for virtually any plug, and nice -- though not luxurious -- baths. Service is uniformly friendly, and usually strong, especially from the front desk and concierge. The bar staff is encouraged to create their own drinks, adding a little personality to the proceedings. Food is merely ok, and definitely overpriced, but there are so many great restaurants in this town, it would be a crime to eat in the hotel. Room service is fast, and handles special requests well, if you communicate very clearly. The gym is adequate for most people, and there are health clubs within walking distance, if you need something more elaborate.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, staff and food”
Reviews.Author: elanem
Reviews.Content: Would definately recommend this hotel for anyone wanting to stay in Amsterdam. The rooms are spacious, has a great fitness center, the bar and restaurant are awesome and the location (in the Liedsplein) is fantastic, very close to the Heineken Museum, Rijks Musem and Vogh Museum. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Comfortable Hotel close to amenities”
Reviews.Author: adarshry
Reviews.Content: Amsterdam Mariott is quite centrally located just a couple of tram stops away from the main train station and is about 20 mins walk to the centre. The hotel is plush and cosy and perfect for all types of travelers. The breakfast is a bit expensive, but everything else about the hotel is nice. I would definitely recommend it for a city break.

Reviews.Title: “Not really a 5 star”
Reviews.Author: Freelance60
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my partner from Friday to Sunday. The hotel was undergoing renovations during our stay and my hands became covered in white dust everytime we walked through the lobby. Much of the service was good but when we tried to get a drink in the evening there was no bar and we were told we would be served in a temporary area. We waited 20 minutes for someone to come and take order and another 10 for our drinks. The room overlooked Liedsplien and we were kept awake by traffic noise most of the night as there was no double glazing. The room lacked the usual extras expected in a 5 star such as coffee making facility robes etc. Our meal in the restraunt was very good and the service there was good too. Breakfast was expensive and no more than adequate. Overall we felt that this hotel was barely a 4 star and certainly not up to 5 star standard. I am a Marriot Rewards customer but will certainly not be returning to this Marriot

Reviews.Title: “Great place. Good location”
Reviews.Author: AeroGman
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a night. Bed was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable Location!”
Reviews.Author: tom_redlaw
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally located near a great square, fantastic shopping, decent cafes, and the van gogh museum. It is easily reached on the streetcar lines from either the central station or the airport. While the lobby was under construction/rennovation while I was there compromising the experience, the location and the excellent concierge lounge for the loyal Marriott customers make it ideal. The alternate location to be in Amsterdam is near the central station itself, but the public transport is so easy and inexpensive and this area so cool and the hotel so nice I would stay here again and again. Should be even better here when the lobby is complete, I was on a high floor and so far away from the noise could imagine lower occupancy to be a bit annoying right now.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel- Great Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: louielaba
Reviews.Content: Stayed here fo a weekend with wife. Though I have been to Amsterdam before a few times, staying at the Marriot this time was the best ever experience. Right from the check in where we were upgraded to the time we left the place, we were treated royally. After reading a review on this site, took the bus from the Schiphol Plaza in the Airport (Bus 197) to the hotel (get down at Leidseplein which is right in front) for 3 Euros. It took just under half hour and is much beter valuewise and time wise compared to the train and the overpriced taxis. The service at the hotel is truly impeccable. We were allowed early check in as we had reached in the morning. The hotel is close to the most trendy bars, restaurants in Amsterdam in Leidseplein. Also, check out the world famous museums like Van Gogh and Rijks which are less than a miles walk away. The best way to go around Amsterdam is with Trams and walking. Would go back very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: ILuv2Trvl007
Reviews.Content: We just got back from staying at the Marriott Amsterdam and we're so happy we chose to stay there. Not only is it in a great location but the hotel room is clean, modern and very comfortable and the staff (concierge, reception desk) are quite knowledgeable and helpful. Even when we had problems with people next door smoking pot (the smoke seeped into our room through the adjoining door) the hotel dealt with it right away by fining them the first time, which is standard policy, and then kicking them out after the second offense. I'm not sure if they were kicked out or just moved but whatever they did we didn't have to deal with pot in our room anymore so thank you! Make sure to use the stripkaarts for the trams as opposed to paying for a day pass - it's just much more economical. Don't miss out on trying the apple pie at De Winkle in the Noordermarkt or Pancake Bakery on Prinsengracht. In fact both places are quite close to each other and to the Anne Frank house. To go between Schiphol airport and Marriott please do yourself a favor and just take the public bus #191 (at Schiphol Plaza) which drops you off pretty much in front of Marriott (Leidesplein stop) and you can take it at the same Leidesplein stop when you're ready to go to the airport. The trip only takes about 30 minutes and costs only 3 euros!

Reviews.Title: “superb!”
Reviews.Author: Kelju
Reviews.Content: truly a great hotel with nice atmosphere and good clean and spacious rooms. Bit out of center but in a short tram ride you get everywhere in the city. Hotel area has many good restaurants and some bars and a beautiful river atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: babe2221
Reviews.Content: Reasonable prices, perfect location, very clean, most comfortable beds, and helpful staff!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: AnyC3
Reviews.Content: friendly staff, polite, helpful (especially at the concierge & check-in desk) and good food at the restaurant..clean room..

Reviews.Title: “amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: nashwajoseph
Reviews.Content: this hotel is amazing as it is city center hotel surrounded by shopping area, restaurants, dam square, means of transportation and train station. its crew are very friendly, very helpful. the rooms are well designed, comfortable and clean. we didn't try the breakfast as we have taken bed only category. the hotel has everything a traveler will request during his trip either leisure or business.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay and Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: JohnChiongLuke
Reviews.Content: Having just arrived from the Paris Rive Gauche Marriott, we were used to the standard Marriott amenities and facilites but where this hotel stood out is in the great staff who went out of their way to make us feel comfortable including showing us a couple of rooms for the views and freely giving helpful tips, the wonderful location smack bang in the heart of shopping and cultural districts and all of this for a winning bid of USD110 on Priceline! There's free coffee and tea in the lounge for all guests as they do not provide beverage making facilities in the room but you can still request for a kettle (they call it a water boiler, how cute).. the windows can open (partially) which is good for air circulation.. and of course the usual Marriott standards are all there: amazing bed, nice bathrooms, great gym with sauna, Philips LCD tv, fluffy towels etc. The fascade of the hotel may look a bit Stalinesque but with the X'mas light decorations, it looked better than the website. Also some of the interior may look a tad dated but added to the charm of the lodge atmosphere especially with the X'mas wreaths and decorations. Top tip from the hotel: there's a public bus in front of the hotel that takes you directly to Schipo airport in 25mins for less than euro5! Top tip from me: There are a few eateries in the square area in front of the hotel which serves all you can eat Grilled Ribs for euro12! Had a great X'mas lunch at the Sports Bar with dutch santarinas serving unlimited ribs.. how's that for a nice X'mas present!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel near the Leidseplein and Park.”
Reviews.Author: viajero200942
Reviews.Content: This hotel has great rooms, great service, and an amazing but expensive restaurant. It's near many of the major Amsterdam sights and strolling in the Leidseplein at night, RIGHT near the hotel, is a great way to people-watch and experience Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at Marriott Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: UrbanK
Reviews.Content: The Amsterdam Marriott, is an ideal place to stay at, as it is close to all amenities, town centre and has one of the cheapest car parks in the city (book parking well in advance as there are only a few places), They also have a fleet of bicycle that can be hired at a reasonable price which is the best way of getting around the city. Also ideally located for all the famous museums, and a must see the red light district best seen at night. Highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BJGfrankfurt
Reviews.Content: This hotel and rooms were clean and it is well located and the front desk staff was ok. I have access to the concierge floor and room which was nice two computers and appetizers and free wine beer and liquor which was very nice and it was not too crowded. The free breakfast served in this room was good and the staff in the concierge room was great. Bottom line: I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: nattyjazz10
Reviews.Content: Hi, This is to tell you about a wonderful hotel that we stayed in during our trip to Europe, The Marriott Amsterdam. Amsterdam is a lovely small city and the location of this hotel makes the city all the more enjoyable. The hotel is situated near Leidseplein square which is an area of activity with a lot of eateries. The room was of average size and extremely well maintained and clean. The lobby had a tea and coffee dispenser which was a real boon for people like us who need a couple of cups to get them going in the morning. This hotel also has a laundry room on the second floor which is free to use for the hotel guests. This is very convenient for tourists on long trips and something which not all hotels provide.. The tram stop is just a minute away across the street and the Dam square is at about 5 -8 minutes away..There is a tourist office also just outside the hotel. So I would definitely reccommend this hotel for a lovely stay in the beautiful city of Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “OK location, avg. restaurant, good service”
Reviews.Author: ADDHongKong
Reviews.Content: The Marriott is located in the southern edge of what's considered the tourist heart of the city. it is a couple of blocks from the Rijks museum and Leidseplain, but all other attractions are more to the north and west. But location in Amsterdam is not so crucial because trams are plenty and the entire city is fun to walk through. The Marriott has two restaurants. One is more of a small bar and serves a few dishes and simple drinks. The main restaurant focuses on steak but is often not open for lunch due to conferences that take place in the hotel. Internet access is outrageously priced for this day and age. All in all, an average business hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location to visit Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Adventure25
Reviews.Content: Location is ideal, great place to crash after all the shopping and touring! Everything is at a walking distance from the hotel, Van Gogh museum, restaurants, shopping, canal rides, etc. Rooms are comfortable, great pillows and bedding, personnel very helpful, umbrellas available at reception (since it rains all the time) but breakfast is very pricy, I suggest going out for a great local waffle place instead. The room has a mini-fridge filled with drinks, smoothies, alcool, water, for a price of course. There is valet parking (only), which is also expensive. Overall, I recommend this hotel if you're not on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Super in every respect”
Reviews.Author: AtlantaGary
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly located - with easy access to the city center, museums, shopping, and amusements via their excellent city trams and bus lines. The room was exceptionally clean and well-tended by the housekeeping staff. The desk staff and concierge were highly professional and genuinely courteous. All together, I've spent close to three years in one hotel or another - and the bed in my room was the finest I've ever slept in - a welcome relief after a day of adventuring. The hotel is across the street from the Leidesplein - a trendy, hip, happening place - with restaurants from virtually every corner of the globe in and around it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Jonny5Star
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Marriot Amsterdam last Month and thought it was a great place. Clean, friendly staff, beautiful room and well positioned. Breakfast is over priced so you are better to walk into the town centre (5 Min walk) and get something there. I stay in Amsterdam quite a bit and will will definetly be staying at the Marriott again. Top Tip - when walking home after a night out, just walk at the side of the tram tracks and it takes you straight home!

Reviews.Title: “Marriott, best location”
Reviews.Author: TexasPony
Reviews.Content: I can not say enough good things about the Marriott. Spotless rooms, cozy beds and very safe. Only steps away to bus, tram and water taxi stop. Very nice relaxed area with lots of variety of eating places. I purchased my room from priceline for $ 125/night.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced Ugly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: scott_lboro
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel while traveling on business in Nov 2009. The main thing about this hotel is that it is not worth the â‚¬200 - 250 a night they charge. I'm glad the company holding the meeting was paying. The rooms were of a decent quality and mine had one of the most comfortable beds I've ever slept in. However the room was quite small, had a terrible view, had no tea and coffee making facilities and had a rubbish shower. Also you had to pay â‚¬9 hour for Internet. Obviously â‚¬200 night just isn't enough to cover basic facilities like Internet. The quality of food was good but like the room itself not worth the money (â‚¬25 for breakfast). If I were paying I'd definitely look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel In Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: LikaDenver
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Amsterdam Marriott for two nights. The location was perfect for walking to the major attractions and close to several bars/restaurants. Ideal location for anyone wanting to experience the highlights of Amsterdam! The rooms were clean and had everything you would expect from Marriott. The staff was helpful in recommending restuarants and transportation options. I will stay at this property the next time I have an opportunity to visit beautiful Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: kydonnia
Reviews.Content: I loved the breakfast there. rooms are quite comfortable. location is good. internet access was so expensive and the reception was not very helpful. although our room was going to pay by the host company they got my crredit cards details and when I arrived at home I realised that they charged the money. then the host company fixed it but it was not nice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for our needs”
Reviews.Author: uzubuzu
Reviews.Content: This being our first trip to Amsterdam and not knowing the city, I wanted the security of staying in a chain I was familiar with, even though chain hotels are not my style, especially in Europe. I was pleasantly surprised by the Marriott. The location was ideal. Amsterdam is a great walking city, we walked everywhere from this base. It is particularly close to the museums and the Leidsplein where there are many restaurants. While the hotel was a little soulless, the rooms were clean, the concierge was helpful and the included breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: romeo14
Reviews.Content: The Amsterdam Marriott was in a great location. It is walking distance to many of the attractions you would like to see. Across from the hotel is an area you can do shopping, stroll along canals or find a local eatery. The service was extremely accomodating in every aspect. I will always stay at the Marriott when in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: housmony
Reviews.Content: Spent two weeks in Europe and ended in Amsterdam. All I can say is it was the biggest room I stayed in out of 5 hotels. Great location. I would reccomend learning to use the water taxi (jump on jump off) Taxi have to navigate the canals and it takes a while to walk most places, I understand why everyone rides bikes. Food...highly reccomend the Pancake Bakery about 100 yards from the Ann Frank House. Looking for a "coffee shop" try the Grey Area and I would reccomend the Chocolo.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in Central Area of City”
Reviews.Author: jeamon
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel the night before I left Europe from Schipol Airport. The location was great, I arrived by train at Centraal Station and was able to take a tram almost right to the hotel. I walked around the city that evening: hotel is within easy walking distance of Museumsplein, the museums, the Red Light District and many other attractions. As a solo female traveller, I felt like it was a relatively safe area. The greatest danger is posed by wandering into bicycle lanes unaware. The room was well appointed, not spacious by American standards, but a huge bathroom for a European hotel. The bed was comfortable and all amentities were nice. Had a decent (but pricey) omelet from room service in the morning. One note about the laundry - the self service laundry was great but be aware that once you make a selection, you are committed to that wash or dry cycle. Do not think you can successfully get your clothes out or change the cycle, just make sure you know what you're selecting before you start it. All in all, a good stay, a comfortable bed, and a nice location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Very nice room”
Reviews.Author: sunnyskiesabove
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location right next to the Rijksmuseum and across a canal from Liedsplein where there are a ton of bars/pubs. From the airport, take the train to central station. Then, hop on either the 1, 2, or 5 tram from there to Liedsplein. When you get off of the tram, you will see the hotel. Very easy to get to... Check-in, check-out and everything else was a breeze. The hotel staff went out of their way to suggest things to do and how to get to various spots. (such as suggesting the Stop and Go bus to the Anne Frank house.) We ended up walking instead, but we did see this bus and it would have been very convenient too (and only cost 1 euro). When we didn't have our luggage with us, we were able to walk all around the city. Amsterdam is very easy to get around. The room was very nice with nice furnishings and a very nice bathroom. The bathroom had a great large countertop with additional built in shelves. Also, it was refreshing to have a full shower curtain rather than a tiny glass wall that only covers a bit of the tub as so many European hotels choose to have. I am being generous in my review because I think that most times this hotel is probably great. When we were there at the beginning of October 2009, however, there was VERY LOUD renovations going on upstairs that woke us up each morning. There would have been no way to sleep through that. They started at exactly 8:30 each day. If we had been staying longer, I would have asked to change rooms. In my opinion, though, they should have never put us in that room to begin with. Very poor on management's part... Additionally, while you won't hear noise from Leidsplein, the windows are relatively thin - - so you will hear some noise from outside. It's nothing like the construction noise that was going on inside of the hotel, though! If I was really rating this just based on my stay, it would have to be a 2, but just make sure that they're not doing any construction work above you, and you should find that it's a 4 or 5 star place.

Reviews.Title: “It's a Marriott, better than some, not as good as others”
Reviews.Author: OlympiaSteve
Reviews.Content: This is kind of a psychotic hotel. From the outside it looks like a Soviet-era low-income housing block; drab, dreary, and uninviting. And the lobby doesn't do much to dispel that notion (nor do the check-in staff, for that matter). Like another reviewer, I took one look and was ready to bolt. And the common areas smell like an Amsterdam canal on a hot day, making us both quite apprehensive on the way to our room. But the room was a pleasant surprise. It was modern, clean, and reasonably stocked with the amenities you expect at a Marriott business hotel. Even mouthwash - which you won't get at The Ritz in London. We had a wide-screen LCD TV, iron, ironing board, hairdryer, and even slippers in the closet. A little Marriott secret another reviewer apparently didn't know is that if you don't have a robe in your room, all you have to do is call down and request one. We were on the 10th floor (room 1034) overlooking the neighborhood behind the hotel and we never heard any street noise at all. It was a very quiet, comfortable room. The only negative was the outrageous â‚¬19.95 a day for internet access. The breakfast buffet in Quoy wasn't luxurious, but it was entirely adequate, if overpriced. We took the full buffet at â‚¬25. At that price you can stuff yourself to the gills with the pre-made offerings or get special order eggs of your choosing. There was also a nice assortment of very tasty breads, sweet rolls, fruits, cheeses, and so on. Even the coffee was decent. We didn't have dinner at Quoy, but I had a burger in the Characters Grill one afternoon and it was very good. As others have said, this hotel is well-located for seeing the Centrum, the Museum District, and the surrounding areas. While other reviewers have taken advantage of the public transport system, please know that if you like to walk you can see pretty much everything from the Jordaan to the Red Light District, to the Museum District on foot. It's a great walking city and the Marriott is in a good place from which to start. All in all, the hotel worked out very well for us. I can't speak to the other offerings in Amsterdam as this was my first visit. But I will say that I wouldn't hesitate to stay at the Marriott again.

Reviews.Title: “Great locale!”
Reviews.Author: Mis_Adventurous
Reviews.Content: Our extended weekend trip took us to the Marriott in Amsterdam. The rooms were great for a family of four with two full-sized beds. We were basically within walking distance of most everything: shopping, the Rijksmuseum, street car line, etc. Amsterdam is a very walkable city and being centrally located helps immensely. Our room was comfortable and clean and the staff were generally helpful . . . with the exception of the "confused/overworked/not interested" baggage guy that placed our bags in a holding area since we needed to check out before it was time for our train. He managed to separate and lose our 4 small bags in the span of two hours. Other than that, everything was great!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good service, nice room”
Reviews.Author: GarryLee316
Reviews.Content: This is in a perfect location, you have the nicer entertainment spots of Amsterdam nearby, the museums are less thn 5 minutes walk and it has a network of trams less than 2 minutes away to get around the rest of the city. The service was good, the restaurant we are told is great (we didn't try though) and the rooms were of a good size and very clean. It's certainly not the cheapest Amsterdam option but if you can afford slightly more then we would suggest it.

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff, two mistakes on bill, sub-par for a Marriott - avoid”
Reviews.Author: MarshaC
Reviews.Content: My partner and I had a great weekend in Amsterdam, the only poor decision was to chose the Marriott as our hotel. The Marriott is nothing like the Marriotts you would be used to in the States, upon arrival we were greeted by over wrought staff at the old and tired looking lobby. Having waited about 30 minutes to be checked in (some issue with the card machine), we were brought to our room. The deluxe room was very small (which I dont mind in europe) but it was the tiny window with no natural light at all was disappointing when we rang a week before to request a room with any type of view. We stayed for two nights and both mornings (saturday and sunday) we were woken before 9.30am by the cleaning staff knocking. On the sunday she called 3 times before 11.00am (each time we told her to come back at midday). Check out is at 12.00pm, and on a weekend this is completely unacceptable. Having had a disappointing stay over all, we went to check out on the sunday. My partner had given 100 euro cash as a deposit and we asked for that back. The receptionist said she had taken it off the bill. When we checked however we saw we had been charged the full amount. When we said this to her, instead of being apologetic, she got very aggressive actually using the words 'I know how to do my job', it was only when we pointed out a second mistake on the bill ( we had been charged 55 euro for a lunch we never had) she actually started to take notice, and realised we had been overcharged 155 euro in total. At this point we were at reception about 45 minutes (there were other disputes going on at the same time too it seemed) and when she finally had settled our bill correctly, there was a muted apology but no offer of anything complimentary etc. If you expect anything in terms of standards of service, or hotels that put the customer first in your choice of accommodation, please avoid the Marriot in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location and excellent restaurant (Quoy)”
Reviews.Author: donnass
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Marriott in Amsterdam was of course, the usual, the best. We were on the executive floor which made it even better. The hotel is very clean and very customer friendly. The restaurant "Quoy" was great. I had the Lobster with spinach and mashed potato with rosted onions, the food was great and every thing freshly cooked. The only thing I did not like was the parking. It's 30 Euros a day to park at the hote, which is not unsual. However, you are not able to get your car or park your car between the hours of 11:00 P.M- 0700 A.M. The garage closes at 11:00 and reopens at 7:00 A.M, so if you plan on being out with your car watch those times. oOher than that the hotel is great and it's in the center of everything, so you really don't need your car unless you are going out of the city to explore.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely comfortable and luxirious suites...”
Reviews.Author: Baisland
Reviews.Content: The internet service was not free.. as for me that service shouldve been free. food was good but they need to make changes everyday imo.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Good room”
Reviews.Author: LindaReviews
Reviews.Content: I'd chosen the hotel primarily for its location with regard to the museums, Van Gogh and Rijksmusueum both within a ten minute stroll. Leidesplaan opposite hotel and this provided easy access for trams into centre - I would suggest getting an IAmsterdam card for 24/48hrs which gives access to major musuems and transport and represents good value if you intend seeing 3 musuems. Room was spacious with a comfortable kingsize bed and good wardrobe facilities. On the downside bar is rather uninspiring and the restaurant doesn't offer much choice and is rather pricey. The location is its best selling point.

Reviews.Title: “3.5 , but a good location”
Reviews.Author: MrsMK
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night with my son about ten days ago. The best quality of this hotel is the location. Almost all a tourist wants to see is at a walking distance. But: the lobby is like from a 3* Bayswater hotel. I almost turned on my heels at this stage. We have stayed at other Marriotts, e.g. in Zurich, which is better. In my opinion this is a very basic hotel, there's nothing luxurious here. Fortunately, the room was a little bit better, a small, but clean, bathroom, no separate shower, very basic amenities. There were no bathrobes. Ok, I can live one night without that (if I must), but there were no slippers (very bad!)! How much would they cost for the hotel, a dollar? The beds were ok and comfortable. Some traffic noise could be heard from the street. We didn't eat at the restaurant, but at the opposite street corner in an Italian restaurant called Il Sogno, which was very nice. No pizza here, but proper food and wine. We had some room service breakfast and I was chocked to see that none of the food/drinks were covered! Yikes again! There was only one plate per person which was already covered by thin slices of ham/cheese which didn't look very appetising (even if you eat ham). Everything was very basic, again.

Reviews.Title: “My second stay here, and there WILL be a third!”
Reviews.Author: MMMH
Reviews.Content: Just back from this hotel. I really enjoyed my stay there. I got a great deal on their own website, four nights including breakfast, for the price of three!! I had stayed at this hotel in 2007 and was keen to go back as the location is superb. The little bit extra you pay to stay here is saved as there is no need for any taxis and the location is safe and secure. The location means that you can walk almost everywhere in the city and if you need to get to Dam Square or Central Station quickly all the trams across the road in the Leidesplein (1,2 and 5) go through the centre and end at the station. there isn't much of an atmosphere in the hotel at night, but who cares with the wonderful Leidesplein so near with hundreds of people sitting outside enjoying a drink. We ate in the hotel "Characters" bar and grill twice. A good selection and great value (except for the coffees â‚¬4 for a cafÃ© latte!!). There was no problem leaving our bags on the day we left. we were able to check out using the interactive TV in the room (our bill had been put through the door during the night). A great system. I would wholeheartedly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly as expected... and not disappointed”
Reviews.Author: FreqTravUK
Reviews.Content: OK, so it's a chain... and here in Amsterdam its clientele is mostly American (nothing wrong with that, of course, but if you're in the Exec lounge or around reception, then you might forget you are in the Netherlands!)... but it delivers. (and, in any case, if you're in Amsterdam, you shouldn't be hanging round the hotel anyway). We stayed on Executive floor; the lounge was fine, but not up to the usual Marriott standard, and service was not quite where it should be. But overall, the lounge breakfast was excellent and filled up to the finishing time. Maybe they could get some proper fridges in the lounge? Oh, and make sure they work? But our room was excellent (small for a Marriott and the price, but not small for Amsterdam). It was perfectly clean, smart, and had a nice feel to it. The location is PERFECT... and I would definitely consider this hotel again! P.S. Only gripe is that the maintenance staff, office staff, waiters (well, OK they should), were all friendlier than the door staff and concierges! Is there some kind of Union for the doormen?

Reviews.Title: “scary experience at Amsterdam Marriott”
Reviews.Author: globalhomeexchange
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night at the Amsterdam Marriott on the way to rural Netherlands. Rooms were clean, front desk inspected our passports and my AAA card upon registration. The room was clean attractive and smallish. About an hour into our stay there was a knock at our door, someone saying they were hotel security and wanted to see our room safe, claiming the previous guest left some valuables in the safe. My wife foolishly let him in. He was not wearing a badge. He did a quick survellance of the room and after seeing the safe was empty, left. Afterwards we had thought it would have been safer not allowing him in and checking with the front desk to confirm that he was an employee. We stopped by the front desk afterwards and explained what happened. They didn't appear to care and just shrugged it off not stating whether they had a security person or not.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: claude1492
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed 4 nights in this Marriott, it was a very clean and well kept hotel. The room service food was very good, and the room itself was well kept. The location was great, we could go on a canal cruise right across the street, walk or take a train to any museum or attraction in town. It was a bit high-priced, as with most Marriott's, but I could not find anything wrong with this hotel or their staff, other than a noisy hall way, due to loud guests(not hotels fault). The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful, the consierge staff could answer any question about the area, and provied great detail if needed. If you don't mind spending a little more money for a hotel, this is definitely the hotel to stay in while in Amsterdam, we enjoyed it. I would not recommend parking though, the cost if very high in Amsterdam, we decided to not rent a car for our first 5 days in the city, it saved us a bundle.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: drkcwu
Reviews.Content: Travelling with two little ones and driving so a bit limited on choices but this one came up at â‚¬100 a night. Smart hotel and we had a decent sized room with good-sized bathroom. No kettle/tea making facilities so bring your own kettle unless you want to pay â‚¬7 for a pot of coffee, which we did on a few occasions. The parking was valet â‚¬20 per night, which is not bad for Amsterdam. Didn't try breakfast. The location is quite good in the South part of the centre with a 15 minute walk to Dam Square. Certainly would recommended if you are driving and have small children.

Reviews.Title: “Offered a pleasant away from home experience”
Reviews.Author: gladystbaslo
Reviews.Content: This hotel, while a little shabby on the outside, provided us with a very comfortable place to stay which was convenient to many places tourists like to visit. The rooms are very comfortable, have flat screen TV's, free internet access, and nice bathrooms. There is coffee service in the rooms. We ate in the hotel's "bistro" the day we arrived and thought the food was very good and reasonably priced. We also had access to an executive lounge for drinks, breakfast foods, snacks, desserts, hors d'oevres, etc. The gift shop in this hotel is very nice and has beautiful (but expensive) handpainted Delft ceramic items, as well as more moderately priced gifts, t-shirts, chocolate, and so forth (I spent over 200 Euros on postcards, souvenirs, and gifts in there) and the people who run it are extremely friendly and helpful. The concierge employees are very friendly and helpful. We were within walking distance of The Van Gogh Museum, Rijksmuseum, Vondelpark, canal boat rides, shopping, and restaurants. We were also located right across the street from bus and tram stops. The hotel has a shuttlebus to the airport (28 Euros per person, I think).

Reviews.Title: “Great Culture!”
Reviews.Author: RA123
Reviews.Content: Stayed with husband and children ages 9 yrs and 16 years for a long weekend. Great check-in. Free upgrade to executive rooms (Though no use of executive lounge). Rooms were clean, well appointed. Room service very good. Bar was good as well. Breakfast was good, though not as great a spread at Hilton. Food seemed to run out very quickly and we always had to ask for refills! Lots of americans staying. Service by staff generally good. Within execellent walking distance of restaurants in streets off Leidesplein. Bella Napoli was good. Also in the square behind the casino (where Hard Rock is) there is a Wagamma, and a wonderful chess board on the ground for players. It was a fantastic atmosphere. Spent happy evenings there. Within walking distance to Van Gogh Museum (there's a good cafe), Anne Frank House. We took the Bus from the airport No 197 to Leidesplein. The Marriott is 1 minute's walk from bus stop. The driver kindly told us to buy a ticket for â‚¬ 12 which would cover the 4 of us, plus be valid for 24 hours. Thereafter, that is what we would buy. The concierge and the Tourist Information did not seem to know about this type of ticket. This ticket is only available on the Connexion buses. Just show the driver your expired ticket when you wish to buy a new one. Apparently this is quite a reasonable ticket. Can take the bus to Magna Shopping Plaza near Dam Square. Can also go to Central Station. A nice outing is to Volendam. Take the bus to central station, then walk past the Tourist Information to the other Connexion buses. To Volendam you can take the 110 or the 118. A small supermarket throughout amsterdam is Albert Hijn (Not sure about the spelling).

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: labern116
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay here based on reviews and location. Used Priceline to book it which was about $100 cheaper than the hotel website. The room was a little on the small side. We did not try the bar or restaurant so cannot comment. I agree with below review that there was a strange smell in the hallway but it was not in the room. We had room 730. There are so many places close by the hotel to eat/drink at. We peaked at the gym which had nice equipment and a good size. Only dissatisfier was that the internet was not free. From the airport, take bus #370 or 197 for 3.60 euro. Get off at Leidseplein stop and then just walk over the canal. The trams are very easy to use and we walked all over the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, room and breakfast. Will definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Woutey
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend and was pleasantly surprised by the location and quality of the hotel. The room was spacious and clean, and despite its central location, there was no noise at all in the room. We also loved the breakfast here, it's the typical Marriott breakfast so if you like variety and lots of made to order food, you will love the breakfast here. It is an expensive hotel but if you are looking for a good quality place to stay, which is right in the middle of the city then look no further!

Reviews.Title: “No surprises, nothing special, but very nice”
Reviews.Author: swj
Reviews.Content: The Marriott's Amsterdam provided a clean, comfortable, modern room. No surprises here. However, there was nothing about it that told me I was in Amsterdam. I could have been in any number of corporate-type hotels throughout the world. Our room was not large, but of adequate size. All the furnishings were modern. The bed was comfortable. The room was nice and quiet; even the air conditioner made little noise. The bathroom was modern and in great shape. Everything was nice and clean. An internet connection was available in the room but at a very high price. It is located very close to major museums and the theater district, but required a tram ride (or taxi) to avoid a long walk from the train station. Our stay was, altogether, very satisfactory, but nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with proximity to museums and shopping”
Reviews.Author: dflo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for several nights last November with my fiancee and his parents. We scored two double rooms via Priceline.com for $100 dollars per room - and it's been the best Priceline purchase to date! Although this hotel is part of an international chain and probably lacks the charm of a smaller local establishment, this was still a great hotel with 4 star service in a great location. The rooms were spotless and comfortable and the staff were helpful and attentive. We never ate at the restaurants in the hotel as I had many places in the city I wanted to try instead. There were several great restaurants right in the neighborhood and the Vondelpark is right outside your door. We never used them (prefering to walk everywhere) but the bus and tram lines ran right in front of the hotel. I have no idea of the usual rates for this place but if you can get a good price, it's a great base for exploring Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Int_Bus_Travel
Reviews.Content: My family and I were pleasantly surprised by our weekend stay at the Marriott Amsterdam. The location is fantastic with good access to Vondel Park, Leidesplein, Museumplen, and plenty of closeby shopping. The surrounding neighborhood is quite nice and has plenty to offer. Hotel rooms are good sized, particularly by European standards. However, there's no mistaking you're in a Marriott with their standard and recent fittings (I swear I've seen the carpet in Hartford, the wall paper at Maida Vale, and room fittings at Heathrow Marriott). It is generally nice and bedding including the sheets are super soft. Vondel park is closeby and great for a bike ride or a picnic. The conceirge can arrange a booking for one of the hotel's bikes or you can try nearby bicycle shops (De Baron Fietsen on Overtoom street). I recommend stocking up on picnic fixings at Pepervoertel a small deli also on Overtoom. The hotel restaurants are pretty average by Marriott standards but there a plenty of nearby options near Leidesplein and Overtoom streets. There's also a pancake restaurant in the small park across the street that provides a nice start to the day. Public transit options are plentiful and you can catch several different trams at Leidesplein. Overall, I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and great location.”
Reviews.Author: travelpartner72
Reviews.Content: Post-cruise stayed at the Marriott Amsterdam. Very comfortable. Walking distance to Van Gogh Museum and Riiksmuseum. Very professional staff. Gave us some great sightseeing tips. It was far superior to the Hotel Pulitzer where I stayed 2 weeks earlier. Restaurant was terrific, with very tasty entrees. Bus and trams very close to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A PERFECT STAY”
Reviews.Author: Sunset71
Reviews.Content: we were four people staying at this hotel. I can say that we had no regrets at all! Excellent location. Rooms are sufficiently spacious for four people both children and adults. Nice bathroom with sufficient toiletries. The room was very clean, comfortable, sound proof. We had a pleasant sleeping as the mattress and pillows were really soft and nice. Although this hotel is not a cheap one, I think comparing the prices paid by other hotels in the same area with much less quality like the Apollo Museum Hotel, the Marriott hotel offers a much better value for money, especially for families. Astrid /United Kingdom

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Hotel but poor restaurant”
Reviews.Author: captor
Reviews.Content: The Marriott is a good hotel I have stayed in many Marriott Hotels and they mostly are good. The location in Amsterdam is good, you can walk to all the sights just bring good walking shoes. You can take a bus from the Airport the 197 and the 370 the Airport bus stop is B11. The bus stops outside the hotel and only costs â‚¬3.50, a taxi will cost â‚¬35-â‚¬40. My only complaint was the Q restaurant the meal was so bad they gave us a compliment bottle of wine avoid it also the breakfast was not so good they ran out of eggs and they did not keep the the items topped up, you can get great breakfasts for half the price in many small cafes near by - that been said I would recomment the Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “A very peaceful night, even with the kids!”
Reviews.Author: GMcDPaderborn
Reviews.Content: Great location, nice room, spotless bathroom, comfortable linen and an excellent breakfast. My wife and I have stayed in a variety of hotels with our two young children, some more comfortable than others; The Marriott was very good in all respects. Highly recommended, even if you have children.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot”
Reviews.Author: Calan2000
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights and loved the location. Able to get to anywhere. Tram line from Central Train Station made getting there easy.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: weezee42
Reviews.Content: Staff was not overly friendly, hotel was your standard Marriott, close to Leidseplein tourist area.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Marriott”
Reviews.Author: sezme
Reviews.Content: From check-in to check-out we experienced very friendly reception and concierge. The non-smoking room was very clean and newly renovated. The bathroom was a bit nicer than most Marriott hotels we have experienced. Many amenities were provided including shampoo, conditioner, shower gel, body lotion, mouthwash, slippers, robe. There was a hot water pot for making complimentary coffee or tea in the room, as well as a minibar. There was a large flat screen t.v. and very comfortable bed. Our room was on the 10th floor facing the street where the trams and buses stop, but the room was very quiet. We like to keep our room quite cool and the a/c worked great. Our room price included breakfast. It was an average buffet set-up, the usual items but nothing out of the ordinary. We also had beer and a quick bite at Characters. It was fine and not very expensive. The location is great for getting on a tram or bus. We always take taxi's from airports, but this time we decided to take the hotel shuttle buses but the Holland Tourism reception talked us in to taking the public bus. So we took bus no. 197 from the airport and got off just across the street from the hotel. It was so easy, even with luggage. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AmericaninGermany08
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel for our trip to Amsterdam. I traveled with my husband and our 2 children in March. The room was nice...roomy, with 2 queens and a nice bathroom. Everything seemed cleanly and the mini-bar was well stocked. We also had access to the executive level...and we were right next to the lounge. My only compaint about that was that it was very noisy at night after cocktail hour ended and they were cleaning up (a lot of dishes and silverware noise). Location was good...we had a good view, especially of all the trams...my 2 year old son loved to look out the window at all of them. The conciere was very helpful. We made reservations through them for a boat tour and they were also helpful with directions. I have to give the hotel many kudos for helping to find a doctor on short notice. Our daughter was suffering from a ear ache and we called the conciere and they immediately got us in touch with a doctor, who made us an appt. immediately. The doctor was competent and friendly.
