Breakfast was great...a LOT to choose from (they even brough hot chocolate out for our kids) and they had a chef that would make food to order. We also tried the other restuarant for dinner and it was also very good...and a good value for the money. My only complaint about the hotel...my daughter was up a lot of the night crying with the earache, so we called the front desk to see if we could get another room...so at least 2 of us could sleep. They were able to accomodate us, but charged the full rate. I would have expected a discount...this was an uncontrollable circumstance AND a room that they otherwise wouldn't have booked that night (it was already 10PM). So, I was a little disappointed in this respect. However, other than that, nothing bad to say about the facility itself!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in the midst of it all”
Reviews.Author: ILnative
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in mid April 2009 using Marriott points - so this didn't cost us a thing. Not sure I would pay to stay here but it was very nice for free. I have Gold status so we were able to use the Executive Lounge as well - which provided us with a means for a free breakfast, snacks and internet access. The room was fine - very clean and well appointed. There are no coffee/ tea making facitliites in the room - but we were able to use the Exec Lounge for this. The location is wonderful - just across a bridge from the Leidesplein where you can catch 3 lines of trams and who knows how many buses. We took the 197 bus directly here from the airport - so no transfers from train to tram etc. We also took the same bus back to Schipol to get to Keukenhof. There are TONS of restaurants around - about any cuisine you would want. We did not eat at the hotel. The staff were very helpful during our stay for the several small requests we had. One of the greatest things for us was the ability to do laundry for free - they have a guest laundry facility that is free and the machines have preloaded soap - so no money or supplies needed.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wish they had reasonably priced Internet access”
Reviews.Author: cqfp123
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. Nice rooms and bathrooms. Recommend having breakfast and using the Internet elsewhere since they are both very expensive at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, quality hotel as a base to explore Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: choirgirl
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel having read the reviews on TA. Our family of 4 including kids aged 10 and 12 booked a room with 2 double beds for 2 nights. The journey from the airport, travelling by train then tram was ok as we only had hand luggage and I'd been to Amsterdam before. Used a debit card for the train tickets (approx 13 euros for 4 of us) and had a little problem finding somewhere to buy the tram tickets, eventually finding a paper/sweet kiosk inside central station. The hotel is only 200m from the tram lines (1, 2 or 5) so easy to walk to. Check-in was pleasant and polite, clean lobby, lots of staff at the reception and concierge all friendly, everyone spoke English, lots of information available about tours, museums etc. We are very independent so just took a map and used that to wander around for 3 days. Room ok size, lovely beds with a very very comfortable mattress topper. Bathroom well equipped, nice toiletries (mirror steams up when showering!). TV free to view for about 30 basic channels, we didn't use anything additional. Hotel provided free tea and coffee between 7-10 am weekdays, until 11 am weekends in the lobby area, very nice too as we didn't take the option of having breakfast which was very pricey on our budget!! We ate at a brilliant waffle shop called Australia which is within a 5 minute walk of the hotel, just past H&M. We didn't eat at the restaurant at all as the choice of food locally was SUPERB!! There are Indian, Dutch, Indonesian, Argentine, Portuguese, Italian, French, Irish, English, Greek, Turkish.....well you name it! KIds loved the food and coming from London we are used to a wide range of food options, but this area beat London, hands down. Had very tasty unlimited spare ribs meal at the local Sports cafe (5 mins from hotel) whilst watching Man Utd V Porto. Bar was packed as there was also an Arsenal match on too. Atmosphere very well humored and friendly. Going back to the location, we walked with the kids everywhere and just took our time strolling along, through markets and museums, parks and canal streets, amazing to sit down too and people watch. Greta place to take kids who were so fascinated with all the types of traffic, though a real need to watch out and be careful as we couldn't tell who/what was coming in any direction!! Price wise I would say it is worth paying a tiny bit extra for this 5* hotel as we found it comparatively well priced given the facilities it offered as compared to some 2 and 3* properties. Also we have no real loyalty to any hotel chain but would definitely stay in a Marriott again if this is the level of service for the price. Only negative is that internally the hotel is soundproof BUT there is some street noise, from the tram bells, to passers by and car horns. I am a light sleeper, but other hotels do manage to design soundproof rooms in similar location types. I would say though that this should not put you off unless you are over noise sensitive like me!! (husband and kids were fine with the noise).

Reviews.Title: “Update of the Marriott Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Flagger
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed again at the Marriott from March 29 until April 4. Once again, the staff was pleasant, efficient, and even friendly without being in the way.This time we stayed in a room with a view north over Leidseplein to City Center. The noise was definitely more than when we stayed in February, but since we were on the 10th floor, it didn't keep us awake. The noise from the bathroom fan was less in this room. The location of this hotel is excellent, but my personal opinion is that Leidseplein is a bit seedy. I prefer the Jordaan, but it is a short (lovely in the Spring) walk along the Prinzengracht from the Marriott, and I think the value proposition is better at the Marriott than at the Pulitzer. It is also steps away from the tram stop that will get you anywhere in metro Amsterdam, except Schipol. The parking lot is small, but we only used it for one night. I wish we had used it for two because a nearby lot charged us 58 Euros for 11 hours!!!! This time we ducked into the restaurant ("Quoy") right before they were closing and they didn't make us feel as if we were keeping them from leaving. The entrees were very good, as was the wine (bought on the waiter's recommendation), and since we were the only patrons, other members of the wait staff stopped by to chat. We had returned from a days drive to Friesland and the conversation - in English - took on the tone of talking to neighbors about your day. This is very typical of the interactions with the staff of the hotel. When I stayed in a Marriott in Paris, the staff made you feel as if you were taking all the energy they had. The prices and food at Quoy are on par with other restaurants we visited, such as DeLeutwe, De Rieger, Lucidous, and Sluizer. The best reason to stay here is the consistency of the experience. You can trust that the room will be clean and comfortable. The executive lounge deploys very good breakfasts, snacks, and hors d'oerves and the bar provides a comfortable place to unwind after a day sightseeing. The check in and check out experience are efficient and when I had a question about the bill, the young lady that answered remembered me from February. That counts in my book! My only complaint about both stays has nothing to do with the hotel itself. Its just that I like to be a part of the place I'm visiting, and coming back to a hotel full of Americans is...well....disappointing. It reminds me I have to go back to my routine.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: TammyWendell
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed here for four nights in April. we booked using Marriot Reward Points, and were upgraded upon arrival with access to Executive Lounge. Both the front desk as well as the concierge were quite friendly and helpful. Our room overlooked the Leidseplein. . We also made easy walks to Jordaan neighborhood as well as the Rijksmuseum, Van Gogh Museum, and Heinekin Brewerly. The room was spacious enough for the four of us with two queen beds. Lots of good restauants a couple minutes walk from the hotel. We found everything that we wanted to see to be easily walked to from the hotel. The only time we took a cab was to and from the train station, and this is only because of the luggage. Would stay again if I was in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Curate's egg - but more good than bad”
Reviews.Author: Londoner5870
Reviews.Content: To start with the bad points. The hotel was extremely busy over Easter so it wasn't relaxing in the public areas: lots of people around, and very long lines for breakfast on the Saturday morning. At one point, the Executive Lounge had lots of used glasses and cups that hadn't been cleared away; and it seemed like a busy weekend was matched by fewer hotel services than usual (gaps in service in the Exec Lounge, no turndown, more lines at reception and the concierge desk...) But the most important function of a hotel is to provide a good room, good bed and good location. The Marriott scored on all three. The rooms aren't particularly cutting edge, but they're extremely comfortable with nice armchairs and sofas. The ones we were allocated were huge with views over the canal and towards the city. As other reviewers have said, the beds and the proliferation of pillows are extremely welcome: they give a great night's kip. And despite the dreaded connecting doors, there was no noise from surrounding rooms: the sound-proofing seems to work. Then there's the convenience of having trams, canal boats and nice restaurants all within a short walk. More than that, there are welcome bonuses: food in the Challengers bar wasn't at all bad - much better than in the American hotel brasserie. Breakfast was decent quality once the weekend hordes had thinned out. And house-keeping is of a high standard. So I would stay there again and it does the job, though I wouldn't see it as a prime candidate for a quiet getaway...

Reviews.Title: “Superb location”
Reviews.Author: SonCor
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a trip to Amsterdam, was a bit wary of the hotel but it hit the mark on all levels, the location is second to none being within walking distance of all amenites including tram, canal cruise, museums, shopping etc.., room was large enough for 3 and although we didn't have any views it was quiet and the bed was very comfortable. I booked B & B which I think is advisable as breakfast is a fortune at min â‚¬ 26.00 a head ( and its not worth that) One perk I did, was book a lift from the airport to the hotel with www.limotaxiamsterdam.nl superb service and for an extra â‚¬5.00 you can travel in style defo worth looking up. Would go back in a flash

Reviews.Title: “Staff and management needs re-trained or fired.”
Reviews.Author: JaksWV
Reviews.Content: Traveled here with family including my husband, my sister, her husband and 2 children (infant and toddler). As a platinum member, I suggested to my sister that we stay here and came to regret it. Right away, when we pulled up to the hotel our mini-van would not fit in the parking garage. At first it seemed like the valets were just going to leave it to us to find our own spot; however, after much discussion we were told to remove everything valuable and they would park it at another location off-site (although, we got the impression they really didn't want to do this, like we were inconveniencing them). Went to check-in, and I was not offered anything as a platinum member - no room upgrade, no 500 points or check-in gift -- and this was no bargain booking, it was costing over $300 US / night and we were getting 2 rooms. The room was a disappointment - very small, on a smoking floor (ok, admittedly in Amsterdam probably all floors are smoking), over-looking an alley. When my sister checked -in she had reserved 2 cribs but was told the cribs would not fit in the room (yes it really was that small). When asked why she wasn't notified that at booking the clerk shrugged her shoulders and said she should have been. The only alternatives the clerk gave was to pay another 90euro/night (approx $120US) to upgrade the room (which mind you if I was given the upgrade that I am supposed to get we could have just swapped rooms) or downsize to one crib. My sister already felt the hotel was too expensive, so at this point I said to the clerk "Look, I'm a platinum member, if there is anything you can do to help us out I would really appreciate it". The clerk responded by laughing and saying, "Oh my gosh, that is just the cutetst thing I have ever heard. I'm sorry but that's really not how things work. There is nothing we can do. But, oh, that was just so cute." I was just flabbergasted and my sister knew I was really pissed so she agreed to the upgrade just to get me out of there. Right after my sister and family got settled they found that their door lock broke and the maintenance man wouldn't be available until the next day. They were offered a different room, but the cribs were already setup and stuff unpacked (and the room offered was going to be smaller) so they declined. Everytime they left their room they had to go down to the front desk and find the bell hop to then take them up to their room and use the manual key (instead of key card) to let them in. With 2 kids this is quite a pain especially when you have to wait for the bell hop to finish with his previous customers. Hotel management gave a bottle of wine but did not offer any discount to the room. Overall the stay really made me question why I bother with customer loyalty. Since this stay I have opened up point accounts with Hilton, Hyatt and Radisson. If you spend over 60 nights / year in one brand hotel and they still treat you like crap, why bother?

Reviews.Title: “Good Brand - know what to expect”
Reviews.Author: uktew
Reviews.Content: I lived out of this hotel for 2 months on a work assignment and it catered for my needs, both as a business and pleasure hotel. In a good location opposite Leidseplein - main nightclub district with loads of tourist restaurants, and easy access via tram. It lives upto the standard expected of a Marriot, but is a bit expensive in terms of both room and services offered. (â‚¬28 for a haircut!, â‚¬25 for breakfast, room service menu wasn't the best - I tried every dish and out of the 11 options only 2 were any good.) Great staff - especially the receptionists - very friendly and helpful. - Got me better rates than previously booked by the agent. The rooms were always cleaned to a top notch standard.

Reviews.Title: “friendly staff, comfortable, well located, functional hotel/marriott”
Reviews.Author: Kate70
Reviews.Content: I chose the Marriott to be able to use points for the stay (but did not get charged anything additionally). Plus I checked the location and it was near 2 art galleries I wanted to visit this trip. For once tho- no upgrade with a gold card so I got a standard room. Fairly small, but adequate and comfortable. Access to the exec lounge tho- which was fairly good- excellent service, free drinks and food during cocktail period and soft drinks/coffee during the day. There is a gym, bar and restaurant also on the ground floor - which felt quite local and cozy- and not like the usual marriott formal types. TV- standard TV, no idea what other people mean re problems as fairly easy to use- and even had BBC1 and BBC2 - so great for catching the end of The Apprentice. The location is good- easy walking distance to all main locations- the rijksmuseum (most of it closed to 2013 due to renovation so a big disappointment) and van gogh museums (latter is brilliant) are 5 mins away. 10 mins to the first shopping street.. and 2 minutes to the first canal... you can walk everywhere- a major plus as taxis are extortionate. 2 days and you can see pretty much everything in Amsterdam- unless you linger in the cafes and bars but as it was raining and cold- we did not linger... just did stores, museums and caught up with old friends... 20 mins to the airport (tip- get the local airport shuttle bus which picks up and drops off at all hotels for 16 euros- taxis will set you back 40 euros). It is a red brick building- nothing special. The room decor is also red. Perhaps not as good as some of the Marriotts of the same grade and price- and surprizing it is classified in one of the higher groups? One side of the hotel (not my side) has a reasonable view to a secondary canal and nice buildings-but I looked out on to offices and a bike park so not too exciting. My stay was fine, nothing special tho and a bit disappointing re views and not being on a canal to give a bit more local atmosphere. If I went back again soon- I might look for an older more unusual hotel on a canal. If someone is looking for a standard business hotel- I would recommend it. If looking for a more unusual hotel and a unique experience- probably I would not recommend it. Having said that- the staff were all great in this Marriott and you usually get a good level of service at all Marriotts- and if a gold card holder or booked with a room with exec lounge access -you get pampered with the lounge offerings! incl computers with free email access.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: zanzibardotcom
Reviews.Content: The was the best location for us. The room was clean and checkin was a breeze. TV is free but the menu is very misleading. Just click TV and the free CNN channels will appear. There's internet TV there so you don't need to take your laptop. FYI you can't download attachments on internet TV. I had to use the internet while I there and it was 10.00 EUR a day. I only ordered it on the last day. There's complimentary tea and coffee in the am hours and they shut it down a little early saying it was out of order and I had just had a cup but had to go back down for me and my guest and I only have two hands. lol. My only complaint was the room had a mold odor or something. They sprayed the room and we could have moved but we thought the entire hotel probably had the same problem. lol. It was coming out of the bathroom so we kept the door shut.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel, questionable charges”
Reviews.Author: Croback
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked a few night using our Marriott Rewards and received confirmation from Marriott that no additional room fees would be applied. When we showed up we were advised that a 60 euro per night fee would be added on for each night. We complained to the front desk, showing them the email which stated there were no additional costs, but they still charged us anyway. We also used Marriott Rewards for our stay in Paris on the same trip and our confirmation clearly stated an additional fee. We still have not been reimbursed after a month. The 29 euro breakfast is definitely a waste of money, there is so many other places to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Its a very nice marriott”
Reviews.Author: MrJohnMd
Reviews.Content: I just spent 7 nights of my 14 night trip to Amsterdam at the Marriott. Its the 3rd time I have stayed at this property over the years. Tough to find any thing wrong with it. Good location. Spotless. Quiet. Great staff. There is nothing that says "amsterdam" here. This modern hotel could be in any major city. But if you can get your price then I think you will be very happy. Now one of the previous reviews mentioned that you have to pay for the use of the regular TV channels. This is not correct. But I can see how the reviewer made this mistake. The TV instructions are a bit misleading. But I can attest that you do not pay to watch BBC One or CNN. And they have a really great selection of english channels. I stayed there on Marriott points.

Reviews.Title: “Heart of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: azsmitty
Reviews.Content: My family and I (five total with two adults and three kids aged 8, 11 and 12) recently stayed at this Marriott hotel in Amsterdam. It is a first rate Marriott, similar to what you'd find in any big city. The location makes a great jumping off point for exploring the city. You can walk just about anywhere, or take the tram line or water taxi. Although we squeezed five into the smallish four person room, it was no problem. One of the best things about this hotel was that it has a laundry room, and it is free to use it! Our two nights in Amsterdam came in the middle of our two week trip, so the timing was perfect and we were able to get all our clothes washed and dried, although both washer and dryer are small European style and it takes a long time to complete a load. This was one of the only "nice" hotels we stayed in on our trip (we stayed in B&Bs and small hotels in all the other cities except for Munich, where we stayed in an equally nice Marriott), but it was perfect and worth the splurge.

Reviews.Title: “Room not warm enough, but location good for sight-seeing”
Reviews.Author: 2FK
Reviews.Content: There are two parts to this review: the hotel/room â€œin isolationâ€� as itself and then how it fitted in with the weather and locality. So, the hotel itself: yes, good service, decent room, large, comfortable bed (not bad pillows!), relaxing chair to sit in and good if small bathroom with (a pretty good) mixer shower, although the bathroom did lack a heated towel rack. And good location near museums, restaurants and trams. You can walk (quickly) in to Dam square in around half an hour. Characters bar and grill was good â€“ nice food for what it offered, warm and good for people-watching outside! The one disappointing thing was the lobby which (unlike other Marriots I have been in) was small and you couldnâ€™t relax in it with a coffee if you wanted to. However, we went between Christmas and New Year and this is why the hotel let itself down badly: firstly, the room was almost constantly only-just-warm-enough, and sometimes cold. Yes, Amsterdam was going through a cold patch (as in just below zero at night) but I would expect a five star hotel to be planned to manage that and cope with it. Instead, the built-in room heating, even when constantly set to 28 degrees, blew out just-about-warm air (although not until after several hours after we initially arrived) and on its own would not have made the room warm enough. When we mentioned this to the Marriot, I was told â€œthe hotel is running out of heatersâ€¦â€�, so clearly it was not just our room. That said, they did bring us an electric heater within 5 minutes and it did help. Another reason I think the room was cold was because it had a nice big window but without double-glazing. Therefore, not only did that mean a lack of warmth but it also provided very poor sound-proofing. We were on the seventh floor but at night we could hear every shout and car door slam in the street below. Yes, the hotel is on a main road but our room faced a side street and at night it was quite noisy on several nights. I do realise that one could argue that we should expect a degree of cold at this time of year, and a degree of noise as it is party season, and thatâ€™s fine if you want to accept that. But one of the reasons we booked a five star hotel was to get a better hotel which should negate those issues. We have stayed in other Marriots before in other cities and at this time of year and they have been fine, but unfortunately this did put us off the chain if we were considering doing another trip next year at this time. Finally, for food, we recommend Het Molenpad at Prinsengracht 653. Excellent food (full meals and snack menu) and great atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Ridiculous why this hotel isn't in the top 10.”
Reviews.Author: d-Family-Guy
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in a lot of hotels, some very cheap, some exorbitantly expensive, some very good and some extremely poor. This hotel is one of the very best we have stayed in. We stayed at the Marriot Amsterdam in Dec and booked via the website. I was a bit anxious about booking a standard room as we were traveling with a child and infant. The rate was 189euros with breeakfast which was very good value by European standards. The hotel is well located in the fashion/night district of amsterdam and will take you all of 3 minutes to walk to the center of Liedseplein. The best way to get to the hotel from Schipol is to take the 370 bus from in front of the airport ($3.60euros). This bus stops in front of the American hotel just a stone's throw from the Marriot. Main downside is that the bus comes half hourly on weekdays and only hourly on weekends. Cabs will set you back 35-40euros and the journey takes just as long in peak hour. Another alternative is to catch the train from Schipol into the centraal station and then take the number 5 tram to the hotel (stops also in front of the American hotel). Looks can deceive as the hotel doesnt look impressive from the outside (unlike the American Hotel - which I stayed in October). The service at the reception was very good, friendly and efficient. We found the concierge service to be consistently helpful and friendly. The room we had (252) was amongst the most spacious standard room we have ever had in Europe. Two double sized beds in 1 room with ample space on either side and in between was pretty impressive - much larger than the standard in the American hotel. The bedding was very comfortable and clean. The bathroom was clean and functional with a lot of vanity space around the sink. The shower hose was leaking but was fixed promptly after we filled in a repair slip (all hotels should have one of these) and left it on the door. Internet is not free (8 euros/hr). If tv is important, you'll get a flatscreen tv with a good selection of english channels on cable. Breakfast was adequate with a reasonable selection of continental and American but if you want a classier selection with a lot more ambience, head to the American hotel for this. Overall, a very spacious, clean, functional and friendly hotel in a good location without the bells and whistles. I will come here again with no hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Chirk
Reviews.Content: We used Marriott points for a two night stay and were very pleased with our accommodation: very quiet, fantastic bed; good amenities; fine location. The restaurant was overpriced so we never dined in. One note to watch for: the web site offers you a choice of picking an "executive room," which we did. Upon checking in, they said that would be an extra fee per night--and indeed, that was listed in very very fine print online. The check-in clerk was very kind about it but it was a little frustrating after a long flight.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: mld80
Reviews.Content: Absolutely beautiful room! We had a desk, chest of drawers, beautiful carpet, bathroom and a comfy bed. In a beautiful part of Amsterdam, close to canal cruises and good food. We had a corner room with a very nice view. Everything was clean and top of the line, from the furniture all the way to the carpet. The staff was lovely, especially the gentleman who helped us with our bags. He gave us some tips and a map of the area. Coffee and tea in the morning was nice and overall we had a pleasant weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good experience”
Reviews.Author: DaveH-ExPat
Reviews.Content: I booked the Marriott Amsterdam at the last minute because of a late event that came up in the city. The front desk and reservations operators were not able to givethe Marriott website price, so I had to borrow a computer in the business center to make the booking (for 12% less) then go downstairs to check in. If you use AAA for further discount, they will want to see the card at check-in; room upgrades are only available to Gold or Platinum members. Otherwise, checkin was friendly and the clerk did upgrade to a view room on the 8th floor. Valet parking is available for 30 euro per day, breakfast is not included in the rates I was quoted and is 25 euro per person. The room was very comfortable: two very soft queen beds with a mix of pillows and comforter. There was a good desk space, and wired internet connection for 20 euro per day. There was a large minibar and safe, but no in-room coffee or tea. The flat-screen tV gets a good mix of cable channels and movies; the shower / tub has lots of hot water at moderate pressure. The sliding window-door opens to a railing overlooking the Leidseplein, but nighttime traffic creates too much noise to leave it open. The hotel has a very nice fitness center; breakfast is a large buffet but it seems expensive for what you get, and good meals are available within easy walking distance for half the price. Noon checkout was appreciated, but the staff was limited and the desk overwhelmed with people trying to get in and out at midday. There is security at the door at night and you ahv eto show your room card to get back into the hotel. Overall, the experience was good and the location, near the Rijksmuseum and canals of the city center, is very good. This can be an expensive hotel compared to others in the immediate area, so check the web site for deals before booking.

Reviews.Title: “What a surprise”
Reviews.Author: ELSUSHI921
Reviews.Content: Loved it, it was in the perfect location to walk to most places in Amsterdam. The staff was excellent and it had the feel of being in Holland and not the USA. The room was large and lovely and a great bathroom. The staff was beyond wonderful. The breakfast was pricey but you were able to order off the menu too so you don;t have to spend $30pp for the breakfast buffet which was nice but not amazing. The Holland Casino was 2 minutes away for late night fun too. I really thot this was a great location, clean and lovely hotel and it made the trip perfect.

Reviews.Title: “geat location, superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: passiontravel9
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Marriott in AMSTERDAM in the early part of october.The hotel is very well located as everything important from a tourists point of view is at walking distance.A wonderful park Vondel is right next to the hotel.The museums are at a walking distance and would definately recommend the Van Gogh MuseumThe staff is excellent and the club lounge is just superb.The rooms have been newly renovated and are really nice. Would definately return to this hotel when next in amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “Good place”
Reviews.Author: PacoO
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, located near a lively square and casino. Excellent check-in - let me check into my room at 7:30 am after a long flight without even asking for it. Clean, newly renovated, safe area. Good choice for a hotel and good price on Priceline. Only downside was that certain rooms face a busy street.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Carry0n
Reviews.Content: Beautiful very large room. Excellent location near Landesplaat, Culp Market. Room had wind blowing through closed windows. Hotel manager responded to problem ASAP, engineering did temp fix, and we got the lovely breakfast buffet free as compensation. Would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Cweis
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Amsterdam Marriott for 1 night during a stopover en route home from Italy. This was our first visit to Amsterdam. The hotel was a good home base, even though we were only there for a brief stay. We had dinner and then walked over to see the Red Light district - about a 15-20 minute walk. The next morning, we took a canal tour before heading off to the airport. The canal tours conveniently leave from a dock about a 3 minute walk from the hotel. The hotel room itself appeared to have been newly renovated. Very typical and very clean and comfortable. We have gold status with Marriott and so were able to use the executive lounge for happy hour. In addition to drinks, they had both hot and cold appetizers -- and there's a great view of the city from the lounge area. I would definitely stay here again on my next trip to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't Live up to our Expectations from a Marriott Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BillyMac4902
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a two-week European vacation which included stays at other Marriott properties in Athens and Brussels. Our three-night stay in Amsterdam was during the first week of August, 2008 The Amsterdam Marriott has an excellent location. As others have said, it is steps away from the tram stop at Leidseplein, one of the central areas of Amsterdam. It is literally two blocks from major attractions such as Vondel Park, Rijks Museum, the Van Gogh Museum and Hard Rock Cafe. The Leidseplein area will provide you with everything you need including outdoor cafes and restaurants, entertainment, shops and stores. From Centraal Station, it is extremely easy to find. Simply, get on the 1,2 or 5 tram and it is about a 10 min ride. If you will be utilizing public transportation for several days, consider buying a Strippen Card from a tobacco shop for 6,90 euros. It will provide you approximately 7 trips on trams or busses. Ordinarily, one ride will cost around 1,30 euro each, so the Strippen Card is a very cost effective way to get around the city. If you have trouble navigating the public transportation or anything in Amsterdam, about 95% of Dutch people speak on average four languages, so you shouldn't have any trouble getting around, Regarding the hotel, I must say first, I am an Elite member of the Marriott Rewards program, and for the past three years have averaged over 100 nights per year at Marriotts. Nothing to be proud of, it simply means I have to travel quite a bit fout of town for my job. However, I remain loyal to the Marriott properties when I travel and have come to expect a certain level of predictibility from the hotel chain. We also utilized award points for these overnight stays, which should not - and did not influence the level of service we received at the Amsterdam Marriott. Check in was smooth and easy, and we were welcomed in the usual way. When we arrived to our room, we found it spacious by European standards, with average sized bathroom and normal ammenities. Yes, the beds are extremely comfortable after a long day of walking and touring. However, I found that the cleanliness of the room was definitely not up to Marriotts standards as the first thing we noticed was residue on the toilet from the previous guest(s). From days on, our room was not cleaned to anyones level of satisfaction. Used glassware was not removed. Glasses were not replaced from our minibar, even a complimentary bathrobe was not refolded and left over the back of a chair. For a full service Marriott, I have never stayed in one that did not provide a complementary telephone call from Guest Services to see if everything was in order, or the lack of turn-down service in the evening. As a Marriott Elite Member, I am offered, and appreciate the complimentary access to the Executive Lounge. While it is an advantage to utilize the breakfast services and evening snacks, we found the lounge had very poor management as there were many underage youngsters utilizing the services sometimes up to midnight - long after the lounge service was closed - to utilize the free internet terminals. While the kids were supposed to be under the guidance of their parents at all times, many parents simply gave them the access cards and left them unsupervised. On several occasions, during normal hours, we wanted to look up tourist activities for the day and had to wait in line for children to complete their activities on Facebook or other internet sites. In short, we found the Executive Lounge very poorly managed. To conclude, you will find the location of this Marriott very convenient. The ammenities are what you should come to expect from the Marriott brand of hotels. However, we found the level of cleanliness from the housekeeping staff, Executive Lounge management and general level of feeling "welcomed" at this Marriott was sorely lacking. With a modification in the General Management of this Marriott property and their better customer service training, I feel certain your stay will be more "special" than ours.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: zryder
Reviews.Content: To be honest, we only booked the Marriott because of a special deal on Expedia but were really pleased. We usually stay at Hilton hotels due to my loyalty card status but the Marriott was less than half the price of the Hilton - my loyalty has limits!! Whilst not right in the centre of Amsterdam, it is a sensible 10 minute walk to the main shopping and tourist streets and the Hard Rock Cafe is right opposite. The location suited us perfectly - close enough to everything but not so you get bothered with noise. The rooms had been recently refurbished to a very high standard, including bathrooms. The bed was a dream and led to a very good nights sleep and a bit of indulgent watching TV in bed. We spent most of our time out and about so did not use any of the hotel facilities. Breakfast was much cheaper in local cafes so we ate all meals out. However, the concierge, door staff and check-in staff were extremely friendly and nothing was too much bother. Definitely an excellent choice, particularly if you can find a cheap rate.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MaximillianAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: I've stayed two nights in a Senior Suite for â‚¬ 365.00 per night including taxes, excluding breakfast. The suite is located on the 9th floor and offers a great view over Amsterdam. The suite is decorated very well, a large diningtable, two large sofa's and several chairs. The bedroom is located in a seperate room. The bathroom is very small and basic for a suite, a shower in the tub, ( doesn't fit for tall people ), and also the toilet in the bathroom. Compared to for example an Executive room in Amsterdam's hilton, these rooms are almost the same size. Roomservice offers a large menu and the food is from good quality. A plus is the location, just a few steps from the Leidseplein, with lot's of shops and restaurants. Overall; It was ok, not very special.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott never lets us down”
Reviews.Author: Kezhs
Reviews.Content: The Marriott was really easy to find, central and very close to transport like the tram and bicycle hire place. The service was great, and the room was fabulous. The bed was the best, huge and soft like a marshmellow. If you are planning on a good meal out I would definetly suggest the Quoy restuarant at the Marriot, fabulous service and the steak was the best Ive ever had in my life. The New York cheesecake was too die for. The rooms were big, clean and the air con was helpful. I would definetly suggest the American buffet(this kept us going till 3pm), you wouldnt wanna miss out on the delicious waffles. Marriott never lets us down.

Reviews.Title: “all gets so easy when it is perfect”
Reviews.Author: ruienc
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night in July, have been there few times in the past... and it is always a pleasure to return. Stay in the executive floor, flawless room, breakfast on time, check in and check out were literally 2 minutes... and the car I had book on the previous night was waiting and redy to go when I got to the lobby. All is so easy when it is perfect....

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: sighttraveler10
Reviews.Content: If you want to go to Amsterdam, stay in this district. The environment is much cleaner and further away from the Red Light District, as that is growing and growing over the years. Amsterdam could be a beautiful city, but the drugs and sex make it a bit uncomfortable when traveling with family.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but sketchy city and people”
Reviews.Author: VMC1967
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Marriot in the city center of Amsterdam for two days. We had never been to Amsterdam but have been to The Netherlands several times. We like the places and people so far but Amsterdam was our least favorite and the Marriot had something to do with that. It was hard to get to from the central train station. We walked for at least 45 minuted before we finally got to the hotel. We arrived at the hotel at 11 am and our room wasn't ready yet. No problem for us because we wanted to explore the city. They offered to hold our luggage so we could go out and about. Everything okay so far. When we returned at 3 PM our room wasn't ready still. Eager to freshen-up we inquired how long it was going to take. 15 minutes the staff said so we opted to wait in the reception area. We ended-up standing around for at least 40 minutes because all the local businessmen seem to use the lounge to keep meetings. No one of the staff offered any drinks or otherwise. When the room was finally ready (after asking at least 6 times) we got a key and that was it. We went up to the room and didn't find our luggage there. We called down to the reception and they appologised for not returning it to us. Then they told us to come down to indentify it but never offered us help to get it to our room! How rude! They didn't even have a cart to use. The room was nice and the hotel itself was great, but the people ruin it. It might be an Amsterdam thing because everyone seemed to be rude. Now don't get me wrong, I'm a New Yorker so I'm used to something. But this was out of the ordinary. The upside is the location of the hotel and the breakfast which is nice. But honestly we won't stay here anymore and we won't visit Amsterdam anymore either. Been there, done that. Never again!

Reviews.Title: “Just Right”
Reviews.Author: fishtail86
Reviews.Content: Located in the Liedesplein area, this hotel is in easy walking distance from public transportation. Lots of restaurants nearby (both local and chain restaurants like Hard Rock Cafe.) Also lots of good shopping. Convenient to the big art museums. The room was spacious, the bed very comfortable (lots of pillows and a cushy comforter!), the bathroom was large and had all the amenities. Very quiet and you can get a good night's sleep. Check in and out was easy and the staff were very helpful. The only complaint I had was that you had to pay for Internet access, which should be free.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay- busy hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravlFam
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the Hilton and 2 nights at the Marriott. The Marriott is located smack in the center of everything. You couldn't ask for a more central location. We upgraded to an executive room and had breakfast and cocktails everyday at the Exec. suite. Food was great and had a nice selection.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Gerard72
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, easily accesible by tram from central station. Right in the centre near the Leidse Square. Plenty of terraces bars and restaurants around. Hotel room in very good condition and have to say that the beds are really comfortable. Also the staff very friendly and corteous. Will return when travelling to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Dependable Stay”
Reviews.Author: henryv731_123
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights at the Amsterdam Marriott in late May and early June. On balance, I was pleased with the hotel and agree with the mostly positive reviews other travelers have offered here. The location is pretty good, especially for the Rijksmuseum (a 5 minute walk) and the Van Gogh museum (a 10 minute walk). The Anne Frank house is about 15 minutes away, and the Red Light District is a little farther, probably around 25 minutes or so. The hotel offers free coffee in the lobby in the morning, which is kind of a nice touch before heading out to start your day. I would add a few additional observations: First, if you're looking for places to eat, the Leidesplein is literally a three minute walk out of the hotel, and it's a place replete with cafes and outdoor seating sure to make you feel like you are having an authentic Amsterdam experience. If you're looking for a quiet table at a canalside cafe, I would also recommend the Jordaan neighborhood. It's in the direction of the Anne Frank house, about a 15 minute walk from the hotel. It's much less crowded than the Leidesplen, and there are a fair number of outdoor table that directly overlook a canal, which is probably the most visible characteristic of Amsterdam. Getting from Central Station to the hotel can be done fairly cheaply on the tram, but if you've got luggage that's at all bulky, I might suggest spending the 20 Euros for a cab.

Reviews.Title: “Loved! Loved! Loved!”
Reviews.Author: stroalki
Reviews.Content: I will keep this review short and sweet - this hotel was fantastic! Perfect location (clubs, restaurants, sightseeing venues within walking distance), friendly staff, beautiful and wide variety of food for breakfast, extremely comfortable bed (so much so that we overslept and missed breakfast - something we never ever do!!!), great room, great view of the square from the room, stylish bathroom (perhaps this could have been a bit bigger but it was very adequate). Can't say much more than that. Will only ever stay in the marriott if i ever return to amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, amazing location!”
Reviews.Author: pstadnick
Reviews.Content: I stayed 10 days at the Marriot near Leidsplein, and it was a memorable experience. The hotel is great, the staff very helpful and the location is just amazing. Nearby you can find Vondelpark, Rijksmuseum and also walk to nice shops! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent as always”
Reviews.Author: burt1972
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from 9th thru 11th May. As always excellent service and I love the Marriott beds - hard to get out of in the morning. Great location Great service Great if you are like me and want comfort and no one bothering you during the stay. Maybe not so great if you like old world architecture and local feel from a small hotel. Amsterdam is a fabulous city. Friendly people, fantastic buildings, clean as a whistle (except the canal but hey - its in a city so...). I loved strolling along the canals with my wife and stopping for coffee here and there watching the world go by. She loved the shopping and relaxation. Weather was fantastic whic halso helps. If you are looking to get there from Schipol get the train to the Central station (â‚¬3.60 from the airport per person) and get the number 2 tram outside the station door. (The central station is the terminus so the 2 only goes towards the Marriott at that point). Pay â‚¬1.60 per person to the driver and it will pass up through the town centre, past the flower market on the left (beside a canal) and keep an eye out on your right immeditately past a big busy square (you will have been on the tram about 5 minutes and you will be taking a sharp left turn at this point) for the Marriott in big red letters on the hotel across the road. Get out at the next stop and it is 5 minutes walk or less back. we got ripped of with a taxi who brought us round the city from the station for 20 minutes. Not a pleasant start but if you are a reasonably seasoned traveller the tram is easy and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: BinDereDoneDat
Reviews.Content: I stayed her on a business trip which came up at the last moment. I had not been to Amsterdm before so I could not judge what other hotels were in the area, and I picked this one as it was where my meeting was to be held. As a hotel it's fine and the room was worth about say â‚¬150 per night but it cost something like â‚¬315 or â‚¬350. And breakfast was extra! Restaurant was OK. The location of the hotel is good as it is near the major museums, but Amsterdam is a small place and it is easy to walk anywhere. There is a hotel shuttle from the airport to city centre hotels and this cost â‚¬21 return as against â‚¬30 each way by taxi (- which will be no quicker). I saw the Rijks museum and Van Gogh museum and Anne Frank' s house. The most poignant item in Anne Frank's house was the markings of the childrens heights on the wallpaper. I am not given to sentimentality etc but I thought this was quite upsetting. There is also a park called the Vondelpark beside the hotel which is lovely to walk around or to kill time in instead of at the airport. Schipol airport is quite good for facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Covenient location but not much else”
Reviews.Author: BirminghamNetty
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 days with my husband and 9yo daughters. rooms are comfy though not spacious and pretty expensive. no free in room refreshments. location convenient. take care with their packages. we had a package where children eat free with adults. was given no info on booking in. asked at reception who told me to ask in the restaurant. asked in the restaurant who told me reception should have given me vouchors - they had not. had to revisit reception to sort. then got charged for children's food on leaving. also 2 of my children's soft toys were lost in the room. two attempts to sort by us were inadequately responded to by the hotel. left us with very miserable child. won't go again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: BeakerTX
Reviews.Content: I recently had the pleasure of staying at this hotel for over a week. I have stayed at many hotels throughout Amsterdam, and this is one of the better options. The location is decent, very close to Leidsplein (a nice shopping/restaurant area) and easily accessible via several trams that lead to Centraal station. The staff was very nice and accommodating. The restaurant bar and restaurant were excellent. The hotel has a very nice breakfast buffet. The room was clean and comfortable. Internet access is a bit pricey, but that seems to be common in most higher end hotels. The only minor strikes against the hotel are distant location from Centraal station, and some street noise bleeding through the hotel room window. I plan to return to this hotel on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Beward of excess charges”
Reviews.Author: Flaesb
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation in January (for a March 08 stay) and paid in full via a credit card. Upon checking out of the hotel, the Marriott attempted to charge me an additional 60 Euros ($90) claiming that I had not been charged in full. I showed the asst manager the email I had received showing full payment, as proof. That was not good enough for them! Finally we called my credit card company in the USA, and the agent verified full payment had been made by me for the reservation. I am a silver Marriott Rewards member. Additionally, the internet access charge PER DAY was over $30! If one wanted to use the business center, the fee was over $10 per 1/2 hour. I found those fees inexcusable. The hotel was very nice ( I have stayed there before) and well located, but watch your additional charges and check that bill upon departure!

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary Service - Seriously Good Enough to Rave About”
Reviews.Author: antipodienne
Reviews.Content: I am not inclined to rave, as my many Trip Advisor reviews will demonstrate. But this hotel was extraordinary and is therefore my first 'five star' rating. Easy stuff to start: The rooms are very large by European standards. I expected a room too small to leave my suitcase open in, and was completely (but happily) mistaken. Very large, comfortable and well appointed rooms appear to be the norm based on my room and those of my colleagues (I saw two others that were the same as mine). Internet connection was speedy, so I think the issues previous reviewers had must have been resolved by the time I visited. It's pricey, but no more so than any other hotel in Europe. In fact cheaper than some. The breakfast buffet is very good with plentiful quantities and options, but I'd suggest going out for lunch and dinner as the hotel's excellent location makes it easy to explore. Now's where I start raving. If service isn't the thing that makes or breaks a stay for you, just skip the rest of this review. Every single staff member at this hotel truly embodies the "spirit to serve" that the Marriott markets itself on. I've stayed at countless Marriotts and never thought much of it - everyone was OK and the rooms were clean. Other than the Book of Mormon in the bedside table, I can't think of anything that's distinguished Marriott from any other hotel for me in the past. But the people at this hotel put their counterparts - and virtually every other hotel's staff I've ever stayed at - to complete shame. The very busy front desk staff remembered me every time I had cause to pop down (and it's not like I'm particularly distinctive in any way). In fact when I rang on my last day to query something on the bill, the man who answered was the one who'd checked us in several days before and he had remembered both me and the special billing request I'd made. I just about fell over. The most amazing part for me was the concierges, who must attend to literally hundreds of guests each day. Every time we dealt with them I left with great information and a smile on my face. One quick example: Silly me had lost my luggage tags somewhere between my meeting and the hotel and was rushing to pick up my luggage and catch a cab back to the airport. I had to complete a form because I'd lost the tags (which they made quick and painless, even joining me - respectfully - in my own joke about my stupidity to lose my tags), Before I'd even finished signing the form, the second concierge had all of my bags sitting next to me. I hadn't described them or told him anything at all about them - he's just got an extraordinary memory and is very good at his job. Every exchange I had with the hotel staff, even when I was rushing like a mad fool, was not only courteous but also friendly in the very direct Dutch way of being friendly but not obsequious. It was truly a landmark of the stay. And it's the feature that will make me pay extra to stay at the Marriott even when I travel to Amsterdam for leisure. I really have seen evidence of the "spirit to serve", rather than reading the beautiful book they put on your nightstand (of the same title) and wondering why I never see those people when I stay at Marriotts around the world. The answer is that they all work in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel with Updated Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: ATLyuppie
Reviews.Content: After spending 7 days in Italy where we stayed at somewhat average hotels, arriving at the Marriott in Amsterdam felt incredible. I guess we Americans are somewhat spoiled in terms of what we expect a hotel room to be like and the Marriott lived up and exceeded all of those expectations. The rooms were very clean and completely updated with a flat screen TV, US electric adapter port, and the overall decor was very modern with lots of wood paneling. The bed was SO comfortable with a pillow top mattress and all the usual accompaniments. We were also never able to anyone else the entire time we were there and in our room. The concierge was great in getting us tickets to the Van Gogh Museum and some of the other local attractions. They also provided very good advice on planning our return trip to the airport to avoid security delays. Location was also fantastic, being within a 2 minute walking distance from the main Museum area and Leidesplein square area with lots of great international restaurants and bars. Whenever we go to Amsterdam from now on we plan on staying at the Marriott for all of the above reasons.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: UCFKnightsFan
Reviews.Content: I came to Europe to visit friends in Brussels, Belgium. We planned to take a weekend trip to Amsterdam so I booked our room on the Marriott website on February 8. We paid $176.97 Euro for the room which equated to $275.59 USD. While this is rather expensive, I wanted to stay at a US brand hotel chain and this was the least expensive of the ones I looked at. I booked it under the AAA rate, but left my AAA card in Belgium. The front desk staff would not budge, so they changed the rate to the prevailing rate (above). I was slightly disappointed at the inflexibility, but realized it was my fault. Our room was on the 6th floor with a nice view of the city. The hotel is in a beautiful safe area! It is within very easy walking distance to beautiful Vondelpark; the Museumplein, home to the VanGogh Museum and the Rijksmuseum, Hard Rock Cafe, canal tours, the casino, nice cafes, and the trolly station. It is about a 15 minute trolly ride from Amsterdam Central Train Station. The trolly costs us $7.00 Euro for two people for 7 trips. -Our room was large with beautiful modern stylish decor and a flat screen television. -The bed was incredibly comfortable with clean, fresh, soft linens. -The bathroom was beautiful with high end accents. The shower had incredibly strong water pressure and good water temperature. -The concierge staff was top notch. They let us borrow an umbrella to use on Sunday. They provided us with exemplary customer service, were professional, were extremely knowledgeable about the area, and answered all of our questions to our satisfaction. We purchased the VanGogh Museum tickets at the hotel to avoid the long lines ($10 Euro per person). -The front desk staff were all professional, cordial, friendly, and efficient. -It is a full service hotel with a great fitness center (rated the best at a hotel in Amsterdam according to Frommers), sauna, 24 hour room service, and two full service sit down restaurants. I would recommend this hotel in a heartbeat to anyone going to Amsterdam and if my travel plans take me to Amsterdam again, I would stay here again without hesitation. The location, amenities, exemplary customer service, and decor simply cannot be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: mosttravelbuck
Reviews.Content: I took two of my pre-teen boys to Amersterdam for a long weekend. None of us had ever been, nor do we speak Dutch. The trip was very easy with a direct flight to Atlanta. The airport isn't far from downtown and the shuttle, train and taxis were easy to locate. I had booked a stay at the Marriott in the museum district. I was not too excited, since I didn't get a sense it had much charm from the website. We were pleasantly surprised. We had a room on arrival (right when you need a nap), which was EXTREMELY clean, very roomy for European standards, big bathroom, too. We were on the executive floor, which provided GREAT ammenities. Loved the breakfast and cocktail hour in the comfortable lounge on the 9th floor, which overlooked the city. Staff was very nice and accomodating, too. Not super quaint, but did turn out to be super good! We would stay there again and have recommended to my husband, who travels a lot on business.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: tricia27
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Marriott for 3 days/2 nights in early February '08. Hotel is located further from Centraal Station, and transportation to hotel will be more convenient than walking. Taxi cost us approx 20 Euros, trams are also convenient to hotel. The hotel is located near the the Leidseplein, with trams, cafes and museums nearby; casino located across canel from Marriott. Restaurants are available in the Marriott with room serice and an all-night convenience shop across the street. We enjoyed being a little further removed from Dam Square, and this is the perfect place for families not wanting to be on top of coffee shops and the RLD (although all still just a few minutes away). Rooms are clean, larger than European standards, and the beds are very comfortable. Would be my choice again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Travelgal1155
Reviews.Content: I was traveling in Italy for a month with school and we decided to take a weekend trip to Amsterdam. We chose the Marriot and were very happy with it. The beds are super comfortable. The rooms are clean and we payed a decent rate for the weekend. You are also in a great location. I would highly recomend

Reviews.Title: “Good location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: MonikafromSurrey
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a pretty good spot, close to a canal boat station and museums. There are plenty of restaurants around just within a short walking distance. Our double room was quite smart and with a really large comfortable bed. In the hallway on our floor there was always a big bowl with fresh apples for guests. What a great idea! Staff at the concierge desk were friendly and happy to advise on interesting things to do in Amsterdam. Overall, not a bad stay.

Reviews.Title: “good location, really comfy beds!”
Reviews.Author: hooleyholmezonhols
Reviews.Content: hotel is in a really good location for concerts at the melkweg venue which is a 5 min stroll away (although the venue suffers from really poor organization, shame cos it has a great intimate atmosphere). got the train from the airport into town which only took 15 mins and was about 4 euros, then took a 1 or 5 tram for 5 mins to get to the hotel. lovely comfy bed with lots of squidgy pillows. vondelpark is a five minute walk to the right from the hotel, boat trips leave just opposite the park, the hard rock cafe is also opposite the park. if you come out of the hotel cross over and head straight on for a few mins there is a nice restaurant called gauchos which does lovely steak and chicken (near to bulldog cafe). carry on walking for all of the shops (the adidas shop is pretty cool). the french toast in the quoy hotel restaurant for breakfast is yummy. staff and the hotel were pretty much all very friendly and helpful, was a bit of a surprise to be told we had to pay a few extra euros of 'city tax' when we arrived. the biggest problem i found in the city is that everyone smokes everywhere, there is no escape, as it was freezing cold we had to wear many layers of clothes and as soon as you go in a restaurant / bar / shopping centre your clothes reek of cigarette smoke.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: guy_traveller
Reviews.Content: Check in was efficient, the room was in good order and comfortable and checkout was seamless. We did not eat at this hotel due to the pricing of the breakfast being a deterrent, but this seems to be the case for hotels in Europe. The internet was abysmally slow to the point that it was not useful, and this was the most expensive internet on the trip! It was slow to the point of not being useable. They refunded the fee the next morning, which was good of them, but the point is that the internet should work properly in a top rated hotel like this. The excuse I was given was that "I bahn was new to the hotel and they were still working out the kinks". Give me a break. If I-bahn doesn't know by now how to do hotel internet, that is indeed a sad story. It should be almost routine to put hotel internet in place nowadays. They put the ashtrays inside the doors at night so they won't blow away. The end result is that during the day, the smokers are encouraged to be away from the door of the hotel, but at night, they are right inside the doorway. For crying out loud, is it really so difficult to understand that smoke is offensive? Here we have a chain that has gone "smoke free" in North America, and in Amsterdam, they can't seem to buy the proper ashtrays and as a compromise decide to choke people with smoke at night. How does this make sense?????

Reviews.Title: “Great for families”
Reviews.Author: david9498
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed here for 2 nights during a weekend trip to A'dam. A'dam is an expensive city and this hotel offered a room for 4 (very rare) for a decent price. It has a great location near museums and tram lines. Breakfast was not included and is expensive in the hotel. We had trouble finding any food at that time of day nearby and had to take in the hotel 70 euros and one kid didn't eat anything!) .. so pack you some breakfast in your bag before you go but otherwise was a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you expect from a Marriott”
Reviews.Author: KKAustin
Reviews.Content: First of all let me say that I booked this hotel so I could use my Marriott rewards points and save on the exchange rate. We used the Connexxion airport shuttle that someone else referenced in another review. They were very helpful and efficient. Upon arrival, we were immediately asked if we wanted to upgrade to the club level. For 50 Euro per night I thought it was a little too expensive since you basically get continental breakfast and access to a computer. The room we received was very quiet and clean. We chose a courtyard view to stay away from the street. Rooms are small by US standards but ours was big enough to have one suitcase open and still walk around. Room service was spotty. Although they cleaned every day and changed the sheets when we asked, they left glasses unclean and mirrors not wiped down. We did dine at the Pizza hut restaurant. The food was much better than any US Pizza Hut I ever went to. However, the other room service wasn't very good. The food we received was far undercooked, even though we asked for well done. I had to ask to have it taken off the bill over the phone, as well as when I checked out. The location of this hotel is great. It's within easy walking distance of the museums, the Leidseplein, and a lot of shopping. And, the tram is super easy to catch across the street. My biggest complaint about this hotel is that you get nickel and dimed on everything. Internet is 20 Euro if you want to use it in your room. There's no free wifi and even the business center is expensive. The only inclusive is the free coffee in the lobby if you manage to make it down there before 10am. All in all, if I had the points, I'd stay here again. If I had to pay for it, I'd look elsewhere first. If you plan on booking, you should know that this is a very business centered hotel and you will be charged like a business person. It's safe and nice and will cost you

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a beautifull city”
Reviews.Author: OBERMAN
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at the Amsterdam Marriott and had a wonderful experience. From the airport we took the connexion minibus to the hotel 19 euros per person -return.It is is only a 30 minutes ride. Our room (#917) was on the 9th floor- executive room with lounge access. We had a partial view of the canal in front of the hotel . The room was renovated and very nice, big king size , very quiet .The breakfast at the lounge was good , but the breakfast at the main restaurant is bigger,with more choises. In the afternoon there is a cocktail hot buffet and later dessert with wine free wine and bear.There is a free coffe and tea machine with cookies all day and cold free beverages. The location of the hotel is very central. Overall - Excellent hotel in a beautifull city Tips: buy the 3 days amsterdam card- for 53 eurosper person. we calculate that we saved around 50 euros per person in this 3 days. Eat at the V&D restaurant - LE PLACE- very good an cheap with all kind of food in a beautifull place.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Amsterdam = Zeer Goed”
Reviews.Author: Brklynrider
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at the Amsterdam Marriott and had a wonderful experience. This was my first time to Amsterdam and the hotel is a perfect location. From the airport we took the train to the Centraal Station and a cab from the train station. The cab was 16 Euros and there were plenty of cabs waiting outside the station. Our room (#1043) was on the 10th floor. We had a great view of the canal in front of the hotel as well as the nearby Leidseplein. The room was quiet and we had no problems during our stay. Our fight (from NYC) got in at 8 am and we were at the hotel at 10 am. Our room was ready, but being a Marriott Rewards Gold Member, they had an upgrade for me if I wanted to a bigger room with a view. However, that wouldn't be ready for an hour. We had breakfast nearby and came back in an hour and our room was ready. The room was very nice - big bathroom, new-comfy Marriott bed, flat screen tv, mini-bar and a nice view with sliding screen door to open. The major plus factors at this hotel were the English speaking concierge - very very helpful as well as the actual concierge lounge itself (on floor #9). I had free access to this lounge being a Rewards Member, however if you have to pay extra for a room on that floor we found it had a very bountiful breakfast each day and numerous appetizers in the evening. Plus, they have free internet access there as well so we were able to find info online, etc. I cannot stress how the hotel location is very good here. Unless you want to be in the center of the Red Light district or The Dam area this locale is perfect - close enough to everything yet pretty quiet at the same time. It is a 5 minute walk to the two-big museums Van Gogh and the Rijksmuseum. The canal tours right across the street were great. 10 Euros/each and we had a complete canal circle- hour tour. The other historic sights: Anne Frank House, Beginhof, Rembrandt's House, etc were all short walks. We had dinner in the American Cafe in the American Hotel - which is just over the bridge across from the Marriott. Very nice dinner - a bit on the pricey side, but great dinner and atomosphere. Other tips we came across is get the audio guides at all the tour stops, museums, etc. they are highly worth it and add so much more information. Also, we went on a day trip to The Hague (Den Haag) - the capital city and visited the Mauritshuis Museum. This was my favorite museum in the Netherlands. It is a small museum, but each piece of art is stunning including the most-famous Vermeer, "Girl with the Pearl Earring" The audio tour said there are 36 known Vermeer paintings in the world and this museum has three of them on display (the Rijksmuseum has 4 Vermeers as well). The train ride to The Hague was very inexpensive and about 45 minutes each way. The Hague is a very small/compact city and easy to navigate. I would highly recommend the Marriott for its location, comfortable rooms and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott's magical beds”
Reviews.Author: MandaB
Reviews.Content: I stopped at the Marriott for one night only, We had a room overloooking the courtyard, which although lacked a view it was very peaceful. I have to mention the quality of bedding, although we failed to receive our roll away bed for our daughter who is 6, it hadn't arrived when we came in at 11pm, she was so exhusted we just put her in our bed, it was so huge we never bothered reception, we all climbed in and overslept in the morning. I have to say it was delightful, crisp clean and very comfy. We ate in the Hotel Bar/Grill, We tried Dutch mussels, they were splendid. Breakfast in the hotel was also very good, the staff were eager to please the wants of a 6 year old, the food was plentiful and the choice amazing. Taking a child to Amsterdam has its drawbacks but we enjoyed our stay, we carefully choose our sites, did the canel cruise, even ice skated at the Leidseplein. The Marriott has an exceptional concierge, quick, eager to please and help. I would stop again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: Miss_Pie
Reviews.Content: Booked a last minute weekend in Amsterdam so not all hotels were available. This hotel is entirely satisfactory but I could not describe it in the glowing terms that other contributors have done. I had booked it directly on the Marriott website and had requested a non-smoking room. When we arrived at the hotel there were no rooms available so we left our luggage with the concierge and went for a tour of the city. On our return we were allocated a room on the second floor which was a smoking floor. As soon as we stepped out of the lift we could smell the cigarette smoke and the smell in our bedroom was even worse. My husband went down to reception and requested an alternative room. We were then allocated a room on the sixth floor (a non-smoking floor) and this was much better - it is just a pity that we had not been given this room in the first place. The bedroom itself was very comfortable. The people in the room next to us had breakfast in their bedroom and left their dishes outside our room. These dishes lay there all day and were not removed until the evening - not what I would have expected from a hotel of this standard. The breakfast was very good and there was a very large choice at the buffet. The staff in the restaurant were also very pleasant and helpful although the staff on the concierge desk were less helpful. As mentioned in other reviews the situation of the hotel is very good but I think there are probably better hotels in an equally good position.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: FrqTravlr
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night before returning to the USA after 13 days in Europe. This hotel gave me the type of service I expect from fine American hotels. There were plenty of staff people to assist you, they were bilingual, and they were pleasant. The hotel is outside of the main downtown but taking the trolly is easy and cheap. I was to the Red Light District in 15 minutes. There's a Pizza Hut in the hotel which came in handy after 13 days away from American cuisine. I also ordered a steak and it was the worst meat I have had in months. Most of the food I had in Europe was fantastic but it was either pasta or seafood. If you love beef, don't eat it at this hotel. The room was spacious with the bathroom area being seperate from the room. There was plenty of extra space so I could relax and opeing the window let in the hustle and bustle of the city. A very pleasant sound for those who enjoy big cities. I'll probably stay here when I go back to Amsterdam with my wife.

Reviews.Title: “Good conference location”
Reviews.Author: Berkshire_UK
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Marriott for a conference in mid-October. The hotel is located fairly centrally, but still a short walk from most of the tourist areas. I got a taxi from the airport which took less than 20 minutes and only cost 26 Euro. The room was on the 3rd floor and was very quiet and of normal Marriott standard i.e. very good bed, lots of pillows, storage space and very clean throughout. Two negative comments are that it is 19 Euros for 24 hour internet connections which I consider to be too expensive, even by Mariott's standard. Also the room was not particularly big. It was ok for me just me, but still I consider it to be on the small side. The conference facilites were very good and the staff were very helpful, both in the service around the conference (i.e. lunches etc) and in the main restaurant areas and reception.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families”
Reviews.Author: Chrssher
Reviews.Content: Spent a weekend here; highly recommend this location for families. We have two boys, ages 6 and 3 and travelling with them in Europe is a challenge at times. Marriott Amsterdam was perfect - rooms are large, with two double beds and great size for the four of us. Nice amenities, very comfy beds - room in great shape (clean carpets, new wallpaper and bathroom fixtures, etc.) The hotel breakfast is more than abundant - cereals, pastries, eggs (including cooked to order), breakfast meats, yogurt, pancakes (small Dutch ones and cooked to order, along with waffles made to order) as well as assorted cold meats and cheeses. The hotel rate with breakfast included is a steal. The bar and grill has a nicely varied menu, including Pizza Hut pizza (all is available via room service as well, which came in about 20 minutes and was served by a most pleasant gentleman.) Everyone we encountered was more than pleasant, very helpful and friendly and spoke excellent English. The location (just blocks from the Leidseplein, a busy, fun area of restaurants, theaters and shopping) is terrific. You are a short walk from the tram stops, canal boat tours and a casino. A bit longer walk takes you to the Rijksmuseum and Heineken experience. We arrived via train, and had no difficulties taking the trams, even with all of us pulling a suitcase. It was a quick easy trip to the hotel. Would highly recommend this hotel for families - close to trans and sights, with easy connections and lots of restaurant choices (even McDs and BK in close proximity.) It is a nice neighborhood as well; felt very safe here even returning later in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: davidzenof
Reviews.Content: I am currently staying at the Marriott for 6 nights. I reserved a corner room and encountered issues with the internet connection. After some discussions with the clerk at the front desk, I was upgraded to a suite. The suite is beautiful. It has an awesome view of the nearby canal and Leidsepleine. On the downside, as other reviewers have stated, the street noise could be bothersome for those who do not sleep soundly. Another negative is the value for the money. Even though I was upgraded, the cost of the corner room was expensive to begin with, enough so that I feel that the value for the money is questionable. Hope this info was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MrTarkanian
Reviews.Content: If you are hesitant to travel to Amsterdam based on its general reputation, then the Marriot is an excellent place to stay with nice accommodations in one of the most interesting cities in the world. The hotel is nicely situated near the museums and parks although the busy neighborhood makes the area rather loud at night, but hey, it's Amsterdam, what did you expect? The room was top notch and provided a nice contrast to some of the dodgy hostels we walked by. A real winner.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Moonette
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Amsterdam Marriott one night pre-cruise and used Rewards Points for our stay. Arrival and check-in: We arrived in Amsterdam early and decided to take the train from Schipol Airport to Central Station, and then the #1 tram from CS to the hotel (or a square about 1 block away). The trip was relatively easy and stress-free even though we had to drag 4 pieces of luggage with us. Next time, I think I will use the airport shuttle for a few Euro more. When we got to the hotel around 10:30 am, the front desk was very nice and let us into the room immediately. We were using our points to pay for the night, but they offered us a chance to upgrade to the Executive Level for another 250 Euro, which was the rate had I just booked the room outright. We didn't think we'd eat and/or drink enough to validate spending almost $300 more for a room! ;-) Once nice tough, by the way, was the bowl of mini stroopwafels on the front desk. Our room, on the 6th floor, was average size and spotless. The bed had a wonderful, fluffy matress cover into which you sink. There were also 6 pillows and a great comforter on the bed. When we finally decided to go to bed after a day of seeing Amsterdam, we slept very well in that comfortable bed! The hotel;s location is great! The Marriott is very close to almost anything. While we did buy a Canal "Bus" pass, we also walked a lot, seeing everything from the flower mart to the RLD on foot. One word of advice if you are walking around Amsterdam: Watch out for the bikes!
