There are 600,000 bikes in Amsterdam, and it seems like 90% of them are on the roads at any given time. Bicyclists do have the right-of-way, and they don't stop for pedestrians. The one negative comment I have is about the restaurant. . .It's over-priced, and the food was not that good. It wasn't bad, but it definitely wasn't worth the price. We would stay in this hotel again should we make it back to Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Napoleon72
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Marriott hotel i Amsterdam for a weekend in sept., and found this hotel very nice. The staff members were great and the rooom as one can expect from a high class hotel. Its location is perfect with the museums, the park, shopping streets, bars/pubs in a short walk away from the door. It was also very quite and we didn't hear a sound from other rooms or from the street. The training facilities are good. The restaurant and hotel bar are standard for these kind of hotels - no feelings! I don't know if the prize we paid a a good deal, but about 200 euros for a 5-star in Amsterdam seems OK.

Reviews.Title: “Love the staff at this hotel; great location”
Reviews.Author: SkiAdcock
Reviews.Content: This is the 10th year I've stayed at this hotel during the annual IBC trade show. The staff is excellent, and the location superb. GETTING TO MARRIOTT There are 3 ways to get to the AMS Marriott from airport. 1) Taxi. Expensive, but if you have more than 1 person & any type of luggage best way. About 35Euro + tip. 2) Connexion hotel shuttle (which I did this trip): 12.50E 1-way; 19.50E RT. You can book at Schipol & they take cc's. Have to call 2-hours prior for return shuttle (or night before). On the return, they tell you up front that the shuttle can be up to 15 minutes late so I booked the timeframe one before I really wanted to get to airport to compensate. The bellstaff has the pick-up schedule at the front desk & will call the shuttle service to arrange pick-up. 3) Last is take train from Schipol to Central Station & then backtrack on the 1,2 or 5 Tram to Leidesplain & then a 5-minute walk to hotel. I'm not into schlepping & this trip I always have lots of luggage, so that doesn't work for me but I know others have done it w/ no problem. CHECK-IN Arrived about 9am. Check-in went easy-peesy. Being Mariott Platinum member, they sent me up to the exec lounge to wait until room was ready. Bellman stored luggage. They're used to that, as they get a lot of morning arrivals. FYI for others. On the credit hold, in addition to the room charges, they put 75Euros (approx $110)/night additional hold on the c.c. EXECUTIVE LOUNGE The executive lounge is lovely. 2 rooms overlooking the Leidesplain. One room has couches, chairs, tables & 2 free internet terminals. The other has a couple of tables/chairs, & is the main section for meals. They have a flatscreen television in one room, and they carry USA Today, Wall Street Journal Europe, and the rest varies - London Times, International Herald Tribune, and an Amsterdam newspaper. Hours: Weekdays: 6am-Midnight Weekend: 6:30am-Midnight Breakfast is served in the lounge: Monday-Friday: 6am-10am Saturday-Sunday: 7am-10am Cocktail hours are: Daily: 5:30pm-9:30pm Hors d'oeuvres: 5:30pm-7:30pm Dessert: 7:30pm-9:30pm Wine & beer is free. Hard booze has a charge (form to fill out; honor bar). Wednesday night is the 'manager's reception', and from 6pm-7pm Quoy (the hotel's restaurant) sends up food (lamb, duck, sushi, gourmet type stuff). Brekkie in the morning has dif types of meat, cheeses, 6 dif types of fresh fruit, lots of juices, 8 types of cereal (boxed), hard-boiled eggs, yogurts, toast, pastries, croissants, etc. Cocktail hour munchies vary from Dutch items to seafood to couscous. Also veggie trays and at times cheese trays. Dessert is various desserts (chocolate ones, pastries, cakes, cookies, etc). During the day & until midnight, there's free soda, bottled water, tea & coffee. I LOVE the exec lounge staff here. They're great. Also thumbs up to the guest relations managers. ROOMS The rooms were recently renovated, and are quite nice. The beds are lovely; you sink into them. 6 pillows. 3 foam; 3 feather. Great duvet. The headboards have nightlights on both sides. Granite sink tops etc. Hairdryer provided, as well as make-up mirror. Usual bathroom amenities. Television gets several channels in multiple languages. CNN is 1 & I think Sky is 5. There's a channel called Veronica (channel 16) that has a lot of American television shows (NCIS, The Shield, Profiler, Seinfeld, etc). BBC is on channel 2 or 3. Closet has a lot of hangers, including skirt hangers, and also has a programmable safe that's large enough to hold a laptop. Also has ironing board/iron. The desk has all the outlets built in, and also include 110V US-style outlet too. Note to others. Do not plug your personal hairdryer into the 110V; blows the fuse. I didn't do it, but the electrician mentioned it to me when he repaired the fuse from when the previous occupant did. PHONE/INTERNET There is for-charge internet access in the rooms & wifi in the lobby. There are also 2 free i-net terminals in the exec lounge, with a limit of 20 minutes at a time. Charge for i-net in room is 19.95E, which includes tax. The sign on the box says noon-noon, but I confirmed w/ guest relations that it's 24-hours from when you log on. Phone charges: 1st 5minutes/each additional minute Local Call: .75E/.50E National: 1.00E/.75E Mobile: 2.75E/2.25E USA/Canada: 3.00E/2.50E Europe: 3.00E/2.50E Asia: 9.00E/8.50E Middle East/Gulf: 9.00E/8.50E South-America: 9.00E/8.50E Russia & Baltic: 9.00E/8.50E Africa: 9.00E/8.50E Special Numbers (0900): 3.50E/3.00E Internet Numbers*: .75E/.50E * starting w/ 0676/0677... Access Fee (0800)*: 2.00E * fixed charged after 60-seconds Please note that '1-800' numbers ARE NOT TOLL-FREE outside the U.S. and will be charged as international phone calls (3E per number). ROOM SERVICE Open 24 hours. Rates include tax+service, although there's a line for tip. If they don't deliver in 45 minutes, food is free. HEALTH CLUB Health club is open 24/7 w/ room key. Treadmills, weights, spa, etc. Nice. If you're more into outdoor stuff, Vondel Park is literally next to the Marriott & you can go running, walking or biking through there. RESTAURANT Quoy is the main restaurant. Have never eaten here, although I've heard good people say good things about it. I've heard the breakfast is pricey so you'd probably want to go elsewhere for brekkie. There's also a Characters bar in the hotel, which is a basic pub bar. Think it has a pool table. And there's a Pizza Hut on site (w/ salad bar). You can charge to room service. CONCIERGE/BELLMAN They're quite helpful. Like other staff, been here quite a long time. They can sell tickets to some (not all) of the museums. I've heard it's good to do that, as it avoids the lines at the museums. Also good for restaurant recommendations etc. LOBBY/GIFTSHOP/BUSINESS CENTER/HOTEL DOCTOR This is the miscellaneous category. The lobby is ok. Not super large or exotic, but servicable. Same as the exterior of the hotel. There is a gift shop w/ most of the usual stuff, plus AMS type gift items which I've purchased in the past. There is a biz center w/ the usual stuff. Boarding pass printing is free, btw. Charge for other stuff. Each elevator foyer has a plate w/ apples for guests. Elevators require a room key to operate. Had a bit of a medical problem during my stay. Nothing urgent, but needed antibiotics which requires a prescription. US doctor can't prescribe over here, so needed to use local doc. Hotel had on-call doc call me in my room, and then I went over to doc's office ('bout 10 minutes away). Because I went there for quick test, rate was 20E cash vs 100E if doc came to hotel room. Got prescription & had it filled at pharmacy around the corner hotel recommended (12.11E for 'script). STAFF I can't speak highly enough of the guest relations managers & the executive lounge staff, not to mention the GM of the hotel!!! They're all excellent & truly kept track of things/were so service friendly, I rank them as some of the tops in the Marriott chain. LOCATION I like the location of the Marriott. It overlooks the Leidesplain, and is only a few minutes away from Museumplein & a lot of other attractions. Doesn't really take long to get to any attractions. Nice central location. Also, there's a canal close to it so people can sign up for canal tours there, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Mouse in hotel restaurant”
Reviews.Author: WalterWalter
Reviews.Content: My wife and me had booked this hotel for our twentieth wedding anniverasry. We browsed several hotel sites on the web before deciding on the Marriott Amsterdam. As is the norm on most hotel sites you are given the impression of grand lobbies and facades only to find a lobby that is slightly larger than a normal house kitchen. Our room was not so bad, with a view of the square in front of the hotel. The only thing that bothered us was a smell that constantly was coming from the bathroom. We decided to eat at the Quoy restaurant which is the main restaurant at this hotel. As soon as we started eating I noticed a mouse crossing the restaurant floor and entering one of the cupboards that are used for cutlery and napkins. I immediatly went to talk to the waitress who seemed to imply that it is normal. We have travelled to many countries and eaten in many restaurants, but have never seen a mouse in a restaurant. We talked to the hotel manager and advised her that we will not be eating any food from this hotel, not even the breakfast which was pre-paid. What was strange was the fact that the restaurant was kept open as if nothing had happened. Mice mean disease and uncleanliness. To add insult to injury on check-out they didnt deduct the costs of the breakfasts that we hadnt eaten from there. I have waited for 3 months for a response from the hotel management before writing this report as they know very well how distressed my wife was because of the mouse. In fact we are members of the Marriott Rewards scheme and I can inform them from here that I will be sending back my membership in disgust. W. Shaw Malta

Reviews.Title: “No soundproofing”
Reviews.Author: abcdefghi
Reviews.Content: Amsterdam Marriott Hotel is a recently renovated 5 star hotel by Leidseplein. It's close to the Rijksmuseum, the Van Gogh Museum and right by a canal boat stop. Several trams stop right by, making it easy to get around the city. I recommend crossing the canal to have champagne breakfast at the famous CafÃ© Americain. We stayed at this hotel for three days. We were given a room on the 10th floor, and it was well equipped and had a very comfortable king bed. The bathroom was quite small, and the toiletries were limited to basics (but they smelled great - lemongrass, I believe). The room could have been cleaned better; - there were greasy fingerprints on the inside of the window and the carpet was very thick and apparently difficult to vacuum properly. We would, however, have been quite pleased with the room had it not been for the noise. There was a machine-like sound that made it impossible to fall asleep (it felt like being aboard a ferry). After a night without any sleep, we complained, and were told that they would look into it. We got back to our room to find that they had placed a piece of cardboard over the bathroom fan (which is impossible to switch off at night). However, the next night proved that the bathroom fan had not been the culprit. The noise was still there, and it was not coming from the bathroom, but from somewhere outside the room. After another night without any sleep, we asked for a new room. When we returned to the hotel that night, they had moved our suitcases to the new room. It was on the 6th floor, close by the elevator, facing the street, and it was smaller and not as well appointed as the room we had been in. Hint to the hotel: When someone complaines and shows great patience by letting you try to resolve the situation first, and you're not able to, which results in guests that haven't slept properly for two nights, and you have to move them, at least have the decency to give them a room of equal or better standard. The new room had a harder, less comfortable bed, only one nightstand (which translates to one nightstand lamp without blue light; not good news if you like to read), fewer toiletries (no conditioner for instance), no bathrobe, and a more limited minibar selection. Housekeeping seemed to have the same problem vacuuming the carpet in this room, and the bathroom fan could not be switched off here either. Fortunately, though, there wasn't the same machine-like sound to keep us awake at night. But who needs machine-like sounds to keep you awake at night when the room isn't soundproofed? We heard every word of the conversations in the rooms next to us, we heard the people in the hallway, not to mention the traffic outside, and we woke up every time an ambulance passed by. When cheking out, the receptionist asked us if we had any suggestions for them on how they could improve, and I said that they ought to work on the noise problem. She answered me back saying "yes, well, it's a busy city". Second hint to the hotel: I know very well that Amsterdam is a busy city, and apparently so do you. That is the reason why you should install proper soundproofing. People expect that from a 5 star hotel. I should also mention that there is internet access in the rooms, but it's very expensive (I think it was â‚¬20 per day). I always find it tacky when five star hotels charge extra for internet access, I really think it should be free. If you're going to stay at this hotel, I suggest asking for one of their larger rooms not facing the street, and keep your fingers crossed that you don't wind up in the room with the machine-like noise.

Reviews.Title: “Just Back from Amsterdam Marriott”
Reviews.Author: njtravelpros
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from our 8 night stay at the Marriott Hotel in Amsterdam. Our flight from the USA arrrived into AMS at 6:30AM and after quickly going through customs and avoiding baggage claim since we do carry-on whenever possible, we headed downstairs and took the train to Central Station and then the #2 tram which lets you off a short walk from the hotel. (You can take the 1, 2 or 5 tram to the hotel from the Central Station) All in all an effortless trip and very inexpensive (approximately $8 per person). Upon our arrival at the hotel we were told our room was not ready, which we had expected since it was 8:00 in the morning. We were directed to the 9th floor Executive Lounge since my husband is a Platinum Marriott member. What a great perk to have use of this lounge..........a great breakfast every morning, afternoon snacks and cocktails and evening coffee, tea and deserts. Also, located in the lounge are 2 computers with high speed internet connections available for use at no charge (in room internet costs 20 Euro per day). The hotel is very well run. The staff is very polite and everyone that we encountered spoke excellent English. The newly renovated rooms are excellent, large enough, and the bathrooms well appointed and very modern with brand new fixtures. The location of the hotel is excellent due to the close proximity and an easy walk to the major museums, abundant shopping areas and varied restaurant choices. We had a rental car for 3 days and utilized the hotel parking, no problem, although at 30 Euros per day a bit expensive. As far as the hotel, I can say not a negative word about the facility or the staff. As previous reviews have mentioned, the outside appearance of the hotel might lead one to have less than great expectations. But once inside everything is terrific! We would not hesitate to stay here again while in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: ShariNyc_Ny
Reviews.Content: I recently spent two nights at the Amsterdam Marriott with my teenagers. We used Marriott points for one room on a regular floor. This room had a view of the canal and was very lovely to look at . The other room was paid for on the Exceutive floor. THis room had no view. There was a decent breakfast there in the morning and snacks in the evening. We had to change our room as we were so close to the lounge that at 6 AM we awoke to the clanging of dishes and glasses. Just across the street from the hotel is the Canal Cruises, which is nice to do if this is yoru first visit to Amsterdam. The hotel is also about a 20 minute walk to Anne's Frank's house. I would suggest buying tickets ahead of time to Anne Frank's house as the line was nearly 90 minutes long. Well worth it though. I also recommend eating at the Resturant Pancakes. Delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Papad
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights during and extended vacation in Europe. Given we were bringing our kids to Europe for the first time we wanted to stick with an American chain we are familiar with. We loved the hotel and it's central location on Leidsplein. One of the popular canal cruises starts literally one block to the left accross from the hotel. It was walking distance to the museums and had a ton of eating and shopping options all around. The rooms at the Marriott were small but completely renovated and stylish in decor. The decor was snazzy and young and the hustle and bustle around the hotel was great as well. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Marriott and highly recommend Amsterdam to others. It's one of the most vibrant and fun city we have visited.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay”
Reviews.Author: CoClare
Reviews.Content: Finding a good hotel room for four (2 adults & 2 children) in Europe is never easy. Our room at the Marriott Amsterdam was good size (by European standards), and the toilet/shower area was separate from the sink. We had a balcony overlooking the little park and canal, and had access to the Executive Lounge which was a great place to pick up coffee and fruit. The staff was friendly and helpful, the location suitable for walking to museums or taking the tram, and the hotel was clean and quiet. Amsterdam is a accommodating town for families, as long as you don't do anything silly regarding the more notorious (though overplayed) areas. Be aware that there are virtually no taxi stands, but anyplace will call one for you if needed. And don't worry, their English is vastly better than our Dutch. We would recommend both the city and this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Marriott”
Reviews.Author: BCSandman
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location with easy access to many restaurants shopping areas by foot. From the outside the hotel and in the halls it may look a little plain, but, when you get into your room, a nice surprise awaits. Our room was large and very clean and looked as though it was recently renovated. We really enjoyed the three nights we stayed here. Service was good.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: kwh
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated near the Leidseplein, which is a very crowded square, but it is on the other side of the canal, so it is also separated from the Leidseplein madness. We had a clean, quiet room. There are also rooms with nice views of the Leidseplein, but the woman at the desk said they could be rather noisy. The hotel is very convenient for the art museums, and you can catch a tram just outside the hotel that will take you just about everywhere in the city. The hotel is close enough to everything, but far enough outside of the central section of the city to provide an escape from Amsterdam's hectic atmosphere. In regard to atmosphere, the hotel is rather generic Marriott American, and it doesn't offer European charm. So if you want that or if you want to be close to the train station, you probably should look elsewhere, but we found our experience here very positive.

Reviews.Title: “Booked Trip Using Points”
Reviews.Author: am470
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located in a good spot. They upgraded us to a nice large room. We used Marriott points for our stay. The only problem I had was a shifty cashier in the gift shop that tried to give me the wrong change. Rooms are clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Marriott”
Reviews.Author: Dimebueno
Reviews.Content: I've heard that finding a nice, comfortable accomodation in Amsterdam can be tricky. Originally, I had planned to stay in a B&B, but due to last minute booking, my choices were not available. However, I was delighted with the Marriott! It was extremely clean, with a super central location. The bed was very comfy and the bathroom was well appointed. The staff also were very friendly and helpful. Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel to any tourist looking for a great location and a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “civilized city accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Robinhoodguy
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the amsterdam marriot a week ago. after having previously visited amsterdam and stayed at lovely quiet hotels out of town this time we needed to be in the centre due to some temporary mobility problems. the hotel didnt dissapoint; the rooms are beautiful and the beds simply amazing. i wish i new what they were, i'd buy one, we had two fantastic nights sleep in a huge king size. we had an incredible view of amsterdam, and the room was cool and airy. the only dissapointment i have is that there are no facilities to make tea or coffee in the room. We had upgraded to the executive lounge so could go and fetch whatever we wanted but it would be nice to not have to leave the room early in the morning for a tea or coffee. only a minor thing though. the executive lounge may not be amazing value for what you get in terms of food, but simply having a pleasant place to relax, get a drink and a cookie, maybe surf the internet and print off information for your next days activities was really useful and welcome. the breakfast buffet itself is fairly standard continental fayre, and i rather enjoyed the relaxed informal atmosphere in the room at breakfast time, people often share tables and it all seems a little friendlier than sitting just in rigid ones or twos. the staff were friendly and courteous, even the lady i almost floored swinging my bag back onto my shoulder in the corridor as we arrived! the concierge service was helpful in my request for sporting event tickets, though i did get 2 different answers from the 2 guys i asked over 2 days, i still got what i needed. the hotel doesnt feel oppresively posh; it has some pretty relaxed public areas, the bar actually looks like a bar and there's a place to grab a Kip sate and frites or a pizza as well as a more formal restaurant. (the pizzas looked very small though) while we were in reception we heard a bride from the UK complain that her room was filthy and demanding her money back but that wasnt our experience. i guess mistakes happen; or maybe some people just over react. after we left we spent a week in a cottage in rural holland with the family. but both of us wished we were heading back to the marriot for a few more nights before we returned home.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in top location”
Reviews.Author: sketchym8
Reviews.Content: managed to get this hotel at a great price but regardless it is a really nice hotel with all the amenities you would expect from a 4* hotel. bit twin room, good room service. breakfast is exp I think but there was no chance I was going to be up by 11am which is when breakfast finishes anyway. I would highly recommend this hotel and this area Leidesplein (spelling?). I have also stayed in the NH hotel which is almost next door and the NH is also just as nice but a little younger in it's decor and general mood.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: name_screen
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in Marriott Amsterdam on business trip. It is located close to plenty of restaurants and sight-seeing. A canal tour dock is just steps away from the hotel entrance. Rooms are nicely appointed and recently updated with comfortable beds, flat screen TVs, marble bathroom, etc. In-room safe is large enough for computer and other items; iron & hair dryer included in room. Restaurants on-site are not overly exciting, but breakfast is a nice spread (a little expensive). Museums are 10-15 walk from hotel, and Anne Frank house about 20 min walk. Trams are avaialble too. Would recommend the Marriott Amsterdam for tourists and business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Refurbished rooms are outstanding!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Rich934
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel through priceline for a very reasonable $110 and came away very impressed. If you read through the past reviews, the consensus is that the hotel, while in a great location near the Museums and Vondelpark, left a little to be desired. Recently the hotel went through some rather major renovations and this probably contributed greatly to the bargain price. Anyway, I cannot say enough about the quality of the newly renovated room I stayed in. You can get a good idea of the value management placed on imparting a luxurious impression to the visitor by the quality of the improvements. Lets start with a 42 inch high definition flat screen television. How is that for luxury. In the bathroom we have black granite countertops, Grohe faucets, Villeroy and Bosch sink, and real porcelain tub. Then we move on to what looks to be solid cherry wood accents throughout. In the bedroom we have a nice Marriott take on Sheratons Heavenly bed. Very cushy, plenty of pillows, etc.... The desktop is solid black granite, with a nice high end leather or leather look chair. The rug was a beautiful red pattern somewhat akin to a Belgian rug. You get the picture. This is serious luxury we are talking here. The room itself, and the outside matching renovated hallway look 5 star all the way. The other parts of the hotel. Well, they were not bad. The outside of the hotel is not renovated and appears seriously dated. Inside the lobby, the renovations are not as obvious. Although the area does look new, it does not stand out. The location of the hotel is quite ideal. Walking out the door straight ahead about two blocks you head straight into the center of one of the cities hottest Restaurant sections (Leidesplein). and a Tram stop for convenient transport to the Central Station area. You can of course walk to Central station from the Marriott, but it is quite a nice hike. I would say 40 minutes or so. Also a short walk accross the street are a number of Canal tours. To the right one block or so is one of the cities largest parks (Vondelpark), another block or so down is the Rijksmuseum where you can see many of Rembrandts finest works. The Van Gogh museum is also in this area. I tried the Quo restaurant for the breakfast buffet at $25 Euros and was underwhelmed at the quality of the offerings at that price. A few days later, for comparison, I tried the breakfast buffet at the American Hotel and formed a similar impression. This time it was only $21 Euros. Anyway, you get the picture. If you can get this hotel at the price I paid via Priceline you will likely get yourself a luxurious room at a great location for sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, fab hotel, breakfast staff rude”
Reviews.Author: nicolac
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a party of 14 women - 4 in 3 rooms and 2 in 1. The hotel is gorgeous, fantastic location - watch out for trams and bikes they're everywhere!!!!! The rooms are gorgeous, spacious and cosy - beds are amazing i loved them!!!! paying Â£5 for music is abit much though! Breakfast....now this was fun!!!!! there were 4 people in each room and when you go for breakfast they ask you your room number - easy??? you'd think so - they ask 2 people then us and then start getting "stroppy" with us as they've already crossed our room off the breakfast list - every morning we explained that there was 4 people in each room.... every day we had the same problem. some of us asked for a boiled, fried or an omlette - but after having to wait 45 minutes then asking again and getting told off for it - stopped asking altogether - too difficult to get right. 1 female member of staff shouted at 1 of our party for ordering an omlette, waiting 1 hr and asking again - she said we shouldn't ask her as it was too confusing - evidently she ended up with nothing!!!!!! everything about the hotel is great apart from the retaurant staff's attitude at breakfast, sets the tone for the day! there is an irish bar accross from the hotel which serves fab food and is quite cheap on drinks for the start of evening out. Leidersklein sq is very good - bars and shops in the sun..... there is a small thai restaurant very near the sq which serves fantastic food very cheap. Stay away from rembrant sq if you don't want to see drunken (young) lads with pants down etc - can be off putting. taxi from airport to hotel is 35 euros - not bad for 4 people in each taxi. we had a great time and would definately go back - but on a room only basis - breakfast was not worth what we paid! enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - Executive Level worth it.”
Reviews.Author: Longwood Traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night after having been in Amsterdam, Brussels and Cologne for the last week. We had reserved a free room through a frequent traveler program and were asked on check-in if we wanted to pay 50 Euro for an upgrade to the Executive Level. The upgrade would include an happy hour appetizer reception in the evening, breakfast in the morning, internet access and an upgraded room. We went for it and were glad we did. I've stayed in this hotel several times before and knew that the location was very convenient but I had never stayed in a room as large as the one we got as a result of the upgrade. It was huge and looked out at the Leidensplein. The happy hour was quite nice and the appetizers were good. The place was busy but not overly crowded. The bed was extremely comfortable and we had no problems sleeping even though the area is very busy and can be very noisy at night. The breakfast was good, not spectacular. Even so we had our fill. The internet stations in the executive lounge were useful and a printer was available.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: UkGMan
Reviews.Content: Other reviews say it - good location. Just been refurbished so some rooms absolutely pristine. Breakfast was weak point. Small breakfast room and not as good a choice as some other hotels. Will return unless got a recomendation to try some where else. Very busy foyer - took awhile to book in and out

Reviews.Title: “City of Freedom and Fun”
Reviews.Author: ccadvice
Reviews.Content: We were on an independent European tour and spend the last 3 nights at the Amsterdam Marriott on points. We were given a very, very large room (509, I think), which kind of was on a corner. It was great! The hotel was crowded with tourists, many on bus trips, which crowds the front desk and concierge. No matter, we just up and went. Of course we walked everywhere. The location of the hotel is ideal, as already noted. The first morning we ate at the hotel. BIG mistake. 22 Euros per person for a buffett. Don't bother. Walk past the Vondelpark to the first street on your right. Walk down to one of the caffes and take your breakfast. Much more charming and much less $$! We are learning...never eat in the hotels! We had our last dinner in Amsterdam at the Italian Restaurant across from the hotel. It was lovely and we met a charming young couple...she was 7 months preggers wearing high heels..nevertheless, they hopped on their bikes and rode home! Bikes everywhere!!!!!! Anne Franke house is excellent and disturbing;most important. Take time to stroll the canals and feel the flovor of this lovely and most interesting city of freedom and fun!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Bank-r
Reviews.Content: Our group (4 couples mid-thirties) stayed in the Marriott for 2 nights (May 11-13). We booked directly with Marriott and had no problems whatsoever. Price was a little bit high at 160 eur per night with no breakfast, but we enjoyed the experience. All 4 rooms were spotless, bathroom was small but very nice and everything looked really new. I normally try to travel to Four Seasons, and the Marriott, though not luxurious, was perfectly fine. My only complain would be that the mattress was too soft and with a duvet cover that made it even softer. I felt it on my back the day after, as I'm used to a harder mattress. We weren't cold though with a duvet under and a duvet on top. I recommend buying the tickets to the museums at the concierge. We didn't do it for the Rijksmuseum and had to wait in line for about 25 min. We learned form it and bought them the day after before going to the Van Gogh museum. Both cost 10eur and both are worth a visit. We also took a 75min touristic cruise through the canals with the company recommended by the concierge (also 10eur). It was fine, though not spectacular. We used Schiphol Travel Taxi to get to the hotel from the airport. It was a lot cheaper as we were a group of 8 people. They made us wait for about half an hour in the airport, but got us to the hotel really fast. You can also take the train to centraal station for 3.5eur and then take trams 1, 2 or 5 to Leidsplein 1.60 eur per way. Leidsplein has many bars and restaurants. It's right next to the hotel, but it's far enough so you don't hear the noise. When we go back to Amsterdam we will defenetely try the Marriott again. Perfect location next to the Museums, next to Leidsplein and only 15-20 min walking to Dam square or centraal station.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Savvy_Shoppr
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Amsterdam Marriott for three nights in April at a rate of $104 US Dollars a night through a successful Priceline bid. Aside from feeling very slightly "pricelined" at check in, we were ultimately very happy with our room. Through Priceline you can only expect a room for two guests and usually it is a non-smoking room. Lots of times you can, at check-in, request either one or two beds and state your smoking preference. We were never given the chance and were handed keys to what turned out to be a smoking floor room, after a disdainful statement of the room having been prepaid by Priceline. I usually have a major problem with smoking rooms, but really, this room was virtually odorless, and the entire floor was only slightly smoky. So, we stuck with the room. The rooms were very nicely appointed, clean, fairly spacious and the bed was super comfortable. We loved the location! You felt like you were in the heart of the action and within steps to all the great stuff - Rijksmuseum, Van Gogh, Vondelpark, Heineken Experience, Canal Boat Cruise, the restaurant row in the Liedseplein, trams, busses, etc. The Anne Frank house is about a 10 to 15 minute walk from the hotel. The hotel has a great little gift shop that, aside from various souveniers for sale, also has chilled sodas and other snacks for sale - for slightly cheaper than the mini-bar in your room (though at times, we did just ransack the well stocked mini-bar too!!). We did not eat in the hotel restaurants, but we did enjoy the complimentary coffee and tea making ability in the lobby each morning. The staff were efficient and helpful, if not overly friendly, and we received a wonderful recommendation for experiencing a delicious rijstafel dinner. Overall, a great stay and would highly recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Michael from Vienna
Reviews.Content: We stayed for the second time at the amsterdam Marriott for the weekend April 29/May 1. The rooms renovation program was finished by now and the rooms really met all of our expectations. Beds are very comfortable, air condition working properly and bathrooms are small but very elegant. We asked for a non-smoking room and two beds on a high floor ans all wished became fulfilled. Rooms to the front of the hotel have huge windows but traffic noise can be heard, even when windows are closed. Since we love the view, this does not affect us, but if you want to have a silent room, ask for courtyard or side street view. We did not have breakfast in the hotel, since its quite expensive and there are plenty of charming Cafes around. we also did not use internet this time since we thought it was overpaid. There is a Grill restaurant and a Pizza Hut in the Hotel, but we only had coffee there. The staff is helpful and friendly, there is even a small souvenir shop in the Lobby for those not wanting to look around for souvenirs. Our personal Hotel recommendations: Ask for two beds since those rooms are bigger the ones with one double bed, if you like a nice view, ask for front side but high floor (but be aware, that street can be heard). Avoid breakfast if its not included in the rate and avoid internet, look for internet cafes around, there are plenty !! Recommendations for Amsterdam: You have to make a Canal tour, there is a company right across the square, if you leave the hotel to your right, opposite the Casino. Go to see the red light district, but take care, no photos of the girls in the windows. There are guys around to avoid this. Just take good shoes and walk along the little canals early morning, such charming views. The hotel is renting bikes for 10 Euro per day, reserve the day before because they only have a limited number. Drive around early moning and go to Vodel Park next to the hotel, very peaceful dont worry the traffic, they take care on bikers, since biking is very common in Holland. We will for sure stay again at the Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Greenvilletravelers
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded our expectations. The staff was so friendly, professional, and efficient. The location of the hotel was ideal for walking for seeing all the sites and museums, and there were many nice restaurants and cafes close by. There was a trolley line and a canal line directly across the street. The hotel is not very attractive from the outside, but the rooms were extremely quiet and comfortable. The renovations were successful. The decor was very pleasant - the new bedding was superior! Our room was super quiet (even though the hotel was full for "Queen's Weekend") and the 100% cotton sheets and fluffy pillows and mattress cover made it a great place to sleep. The chocolates from the turn-down service were better than the usual Marriott chocolate! The hot water was super hot. The bathroom amenities were very nice. The concierge gave us great recomendations. We were very happy with the staff, decor, cleanliness, safety, location and price. We would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “nice people, new rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: HKing
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel and was very pleased to see that they have finished their renovations and it looks great. The beds are very comfortable! I had dinner in their Quoy restaurant and loved it. I was surprised at the quality of the kitchen - the meal was otustanding. The location is perfect for getting around town and very close to everything including the Rijksmuseum and the docks for taking canal tours. I will stay here again next time I am in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: GBSwansea
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the newly refurbished rooms, clean and with new furniture and two very confortable large beds. The Hotel has an excellent location and is a very good base for exploring Amsterdam. The Concierge is helpful and can sell you tickets for most museums (at no extra costs) which allow to jump the queues. Definitely recommended, especially if you find a good rate including breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great location,staff excellent”
Reviews.Author: Rick30
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights. great service from restaurant staff to concierge. All very friendly and helpful.Hotel completely remodeled, so clean and comfortable. We asked for quiet room and it was very quiet. Great location right off tram line, walking distance to everything. take tram from central station.Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Remodeled and Reliable”
Reviews.Author: College Bowl
Reviews.Content: Returned to this property after four years and we were pleased with the remodel. The room was small but well equipped and the bed was wonderful. Service was excellent and the concierge lounge was well stocked and provided decent food.

Reviews.Title: “No Heat in Our Room”
Reviews.Author: brandita
Reviews.Content: This marriott is currently undergoing construction and I would not reccomend staying there until the construction is complete. They started work at 8 in the morning every morning and woke us up. Our room, number 725, also lacked a heater which was yet to be installed and this made it very cold. The staff is very friendly and helpful and this helped compensate for the other problems we encountered. The concierge is also very knowledgeable and useful. The rooms and bathrooms are quite spacious and redone well and have good views of the nearby sqaure. It is conviently located next to the Leidsplein which has many restruants, coffee shops, bars, etc. It is also very close to the museum quarter.

Reviews.Title: “renovated rooms lovely but make sure yours has heat”
Reviews.Author: 4vrongo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriot on March 20-23 with our two young adults and our past exchange student from Spain. The location is great for families with teenagers or young adults as it is a very safe but active place for them to be. They went out at night without us and we felt very secure about it. The hotel renovations are still going on as reported and for us the first day started noise at 8:30 the next at 7 am. We had booked two executive rooms that were on two separate floors 3 and 7th because the executive floor is not finished however both were renovated rooms which are lovely. Only problem our second room with our kids did not have heat. Totally renovated with all the thermostats but no vent. At 1 am when our kids called down they at first said just turn on the thermostat then after complaints sent someone up who noticed no vent. They then sent a portable heater. At 330 euro's a night this was kind of overpriced for not having heat when it was only a high of 39 during the day. We were very happy though with the friendliness of the staff and really our only problem was the heat. In the excecutive lounge which is located temporarily next to the meeting rooms they do take down breakfast at 10am so if you are on vacation with young people you have to be prompt. I think once all the renovations are complete it will be an excellent hotel to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, very expensive”
Reviews.Author: SpottedCat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property on March 13, 2007 after deciding to stay another night in Amsterdam. We had previously stayed at the Hotel Vondel, and it was booked for that evening. The Mariott was a very nice property, however, fairly expensive. We were out and about the city most of the evening, so we spent little time in the room. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom updated and clean. We got a great night's sleep here (probably the best while in Europe). The concierge was helpful in calling us a cab to Schipol in the morning. We needed more Euros and used the hotels cash exchange service with a credit card. I do not recommend this, as we were charged a high fee and got a low exchange for our dollar. Overall, I would spend the money on this hotel only if you plan to spend a great deal of time in the room. The Hotel Vondel was a better quality and a much more reasonable rate.

Reviews.Title: “very average”
Reviews.Author: koala
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here one night only because my husband had some business appointments overhere. At first, we booked trough their website and there is comment because some construction is going on. The noise was terrible. It continued till late at night and at 7.15 am it started again! Check in was not really fluently. We brought our 7 weeks old daughter with us and we booked a crib. It was not in the room so I was checking at the front-desk where it was and the girl said that I didn't reserve it. And it was on my confirmation!!! She wanted to start a discussion with me about it but I walked away. After we talked to one of the (friendly) lady's at the executive lounge the crib arrived. We also had asked for a newly renovated room. The rooms on the club-floor were not renovated yet but it didn't matter to me. But the lady at front-desk she said all these renovated rooms where already occupied without even looking in their system! Also the club-lounge was in one of the meeting rooms at the first level. Very crowded with SQ-airline crew who saw the buffet as their dinner.... Also the rooms at club-level (not renovated, very old but even full-price!) where in a hallway which was partly smoking and partly non-smoking. SO the smoke of the smoking-rooms penetrated into the non-smoking rooms! All in all not really a good experience. Location is good so maybe we try the hotel again later this year when renovations are finished. Personnel not friendly! Most of them had very much an attitude. Only the lady's at the club-lounge where friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Cant fault it”
Reviews.Author: siobwills
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this Hotel with 2 girlfriends while staying in amsterdam for 2 party nights. The Hotel rooms have just had a face lift. They are clean, modern and comfortabel. The bathrooms are clean, small but adequate for us. If you are taking a family Im not sure wheather it would be big enough. If you're a stag or hen party The Marriott is probaly not the place for you as it is calm and quiet. Also it is quite a distance to Rembrat Square and The Red Light District, the 2 main night spots. I would recommend this Hotel to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Where else but the Marriott”
Reviews.Author: 102210i
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay: Warm & proficient staff at reception desk and the guys at the concierge are worth their weight in gold. They got me tickets to the Keukenhof & the theater in the time it took for me blink. For the best rooms, ask for the corner rooms or the rooms overlooking the Leidseplein for some action. Perfectly central location with tram stopping in front of the hotel, shopping opposite the hotel and smack in the middle of the cultural district with several musea in walking distance. Anything beyond that: Rent the bicycles from the concierge to explore the city, like a typical Dutchie, but be careful in traffic. Great American hospitality, an example of how Mr. Marriott's hotels should be run.

Reviews.Title: “New Year In Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: LizzieAn
Reviews.Content: Visited Amsterdam and stayed at the Marriott for 5 days over the New Year period The location of the hotel is great, close to museums (Rijksmuseum, Van Gogh Museum, ) and a short walk to the Leidseplein with many restaurants & bars. It is right beside the canal bus stop and a canal boat trip. It's also close to the shopping on PC Hoofstraat. Check-in was very easy and friendly, and the concierge was extremely knowledgeable. I would follow their recommendations for restaurants and you won't go wrong - Fiorentina ( Italian) , Gaucho ( Argentinian steak) and Punte Mas ( Indonesian) were all first class. In addition the meals in the Characters and Quoy in the hotel were good. And we would recommend the Aran Irish Pub for breakfast Our room was on the front of the hotel and was large and comfortable - the bathroom looked a bit "tired" but was perfectly adequate. Not all rooms have been upgraded as yet as the hotel is going thorugh a refurbishment programme. The room had a view of Leidesplein which was great for celebrating New Year ( as it was raining !) ! Overall a good hotel and will be great when the refurbishment is complete - but don't let that put you off right now. It is close to many attracttions and has good rooms, services and excellent staff. I would most definitely stay here again next time visiting Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “Marriott was fine as usual”
Reviews.Author: highfly
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights after Christmas. Hotel is in process of refurb, and we were in old style room and it was fine. Everything worked and it was well serviced but a refurb will give it that more modern and pristine feel.The bathroom looked a lot more faded than the room and although very clean it could do with an update. We stayed in Crowne Plaza for 2 nights aswell and the Marriott rooms were miles better. Our rate included breakfast, which was very nice, but at 25 euros each normally I certainly wouldn't pay extra for it. Also, we weren't asked if we wanted smoking or not at brekky, and having settled down to breakfast the man at the next table lit up and puffed all over us and our food. We moved, as did the people next to us. The non smoking area is a windowless room, while the smoking area is nice and bright at the front - and has all the food on display (with smokers all around it) don't see the logic there. I know that sounds picky, and probably 5 years ago we would have sat on and put up with it, but UK and Ireland seem to be the only bits of Europe where it is accepted that smoking really does kill you and those around you - in Ireland and Scotland it is illegal to smoke in a public bar or restarant and it will be in UK this year. I am surprised that Marriott have such a laid back approach, especially when their US hotels are about to go/have gone non smoking. Hotel is well placed for museums and for posh shopping (PC Hoofstraat I think) Also has bars and restaurants of Leidseplein at the doorstep. We had a lovely, quite up market Indian meal in a restaurant called Mayur nearby. As in previous posts, it is easy to get train from airport to Central station (3.40 euros) and then tram to Leidseplein (no 1, 2, 5) However if there are more than 2 of you or you have a lot of luggage a taxi is better.

Reviews.Title: “Not 4 Star!”
Reviews.Author: alpones
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not a four star. The rooms are ageing, the bathroom needed a face-lift, the rooms reek of smoke (even the non-smoking ones!) and there are no tea/coffee making facilities in the room. The carpet in the room looked like it had not been cleaned in years - so take your slippers! The bathroom whilst old, was clean and the bed was quite comfortable. The only thing 4 star about this place is the lobby and the price. I would avoid this hotel and stay somewhere else on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Call before you book”
Reviews.Author: Harrald
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Amsterdam Marriott for 4 days in early Dec. We had 2 rooms on the third floor that were down the hall from each other. Most nights both rooms were awakened by the sounds of construction during the night. One room had a flood in the bathroom from the room above that was fixed quickly. One morning the elevators didn't work for about 30ish minutes. To be fair to the hotel they are in the middle of renovation. I have stayed in Marriott properties for many years and in many countries. This was by far the worst one I've ever stayed in. As I stated though, they are renovating. If you plan on using this hotel I suggest you call ahead and see if they have finished the work. Also if you need to stay there soon, you should ask for a new room. If I return to Amsterdam I will choose another location and check on the status of the Marriott while in the city. The location is good and the tram stops outside the door. The hotel restaurant is overpriced (like all hotel resaurants) but there are a number of other choices within a few minutes walk. I took no pictures since it would be unfair to the hotel to show rooms that will soon be updated.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Stay!”
Reviews.Author: JohBe
Reviews.Content: Visited the Amsterdam Marriott hotel for the Amsterdam Marathon on 15 October but made a reservation from Friday 13/10 till Monday 16/10 to also do some sightseeing & shopping! Location of the hotel is great, close to museums (Rijksmuseum, Van Gogh Museum, Heineken Experience,...) and the Leidse Plein with many restaurants & bars. It's also the shortest tram station for the lines 1,2 and 5. The nice Vondelpark entrance is just a 1 minute walk from the hotel. I did some fine morning runs through the park during my stay. Check-in was easy and friendly, also very helpful staff! The room I got (#538) was ok, it was large with a good & very comfortable king-size bed. The room had a good sized tv, airconditioning, small mini-bar, large safe! I had a view on the Amsterdam roofs and the Vondelpark trees. Nice thing about the room is you could open the window! I had a quiet room because it was the last room on the fifth floor (see picture), so no noises from elevators or noisy guests in the hallway. Also no noises from the street below! The bathroom/toilet was another thing! It needed some updating, looked very warn! It had a bath/shower combination, the amenities where the usual things: shampoo, conditioner, lotion, bath gel, soap and mouth wash! Enough towels where provided. Breakfast-buffet in the "Quoy" restaurant was excellent, much better than the ones I had in the Brussels or Frankfurt Marriott's! Very large selection of continental and full English, everything very fresh (breads, juices,...), the cook made all your wishes reallity, don't miss the delicious pancakes he makes!!! The staff at the restaurant was very courteaus and helpfull to serve! I also had a pizza in the Pizza Hut restaurant in the hotel and it was really good. No fast-food style in this Pizza Hut, it was more like a decent pizza/grill restaurant! The fitness/sauna downstairs open 24 hours looked great, spacious and had very much and nice equipment. I didn't use the fitness or sauna but it's nicer to do some exercising in the Vondelpark! I looked regulary in the fitnessroom and it mostly looked empty. Overall a good hotel, on some points a bit dated! Close to many things, good rooms & services. I would stay here again next time visiting Amsterdam! Some tip: the hotel entrance & parkgarage is a bit dificult to get to (it's a one way street), you have to drive around the hotel coming from the Stadhouderskade, take a left or right (wich way your coming from) into the Tesselskadestraat, drive this way to the end of the street, then take a right (Vondelstraat), the hotel entrance/parkgarage is on your rightside! Ohh....also had a good run on sunday, but that review is for another site ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Four stars, hardly!”
Reviews.Author: gottogonow
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for 3 nights starting Sept. 29th. We requested a canal view, no smoking, guaranteed late arrival. We arrived at the hotel from the airport around 10:30 at night. When I asked about our room being a canal room I was told that there were none available. I informed the clerk that we had requested a canal room she informed us that because we had were arrived late and it was no longer available. I showed her my confirmation sheet and she suddenly found us a canal room. I was tired but very polite. I asked if I could get a bell person to with our luggage we were told, no one was available. We took our luggage in two trips . Our room turned out to be smoking and there were cigarette butts all over the little balcony and the room reeked of cigarettes. As it was the beginning of our trip, I just decided to not make a big deal out of it and let it go. The bed was wonderful and very well appreciated. The location was great and was the meeting place for the tour we were to go on so we decided to make do. The next morning we ate breakfast (included in the room rate) in the dining room, it was excellent. Much to my surprise when I happened to check our account on the TV set, they had charged us an additional 25 euros for breakfast. I went downstairs with my confirmation and they removed the charge. The second day they did it again and I went down and they removed it. By the third day I had let them know I was more than a little irritated. We spent almost $900 for a lousy stay. I would not recommend this hotel. There are much better choices. We have had much better rooms and most importantly service at every other Marriott, including Courtyard Marriotts we have stayed at. A disapointment

Reviews.Title: “Nice beds, but pricey”
Reviews.Author: DX-Traveler
Reviews.Content: Nice enough hotel, but the place is not quite up to Marriott's US standards. For Europe, the rooms are good size, and so is the bathroom. However, the towels were somewhat low quality and not as big as expected. The shower is European, which means it appears as an afterthought in a deep tub, and the bathroom is what gave me the feeling that this should not have been a Marriott but maybe a Fairfield Inn. The bed however was outstanding! Rooms and bathrooms are nice and clean. The lobby is quite nice, with a free coffee dispenser in the corner (mornings only) - no coffee in the room. Staff is nice and helpful. Internet is around 25 Euro per day.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: WStaso
Reviews.Content: My brother and I stayed at the Marriott on the last night of our 14 day trip through Europe. It has a great location for those who like to party at night, roam through a beautiful part nearby, or to gamble at the casino across the street. But the Marriott is an old hotel and the bathrooms have a lower class quality to them. The room in the tub was uncomfortable for shower space in fact, and I smelled mildew as I entered the bathroom. The rooms are small by US standards and about twice as expensive. On the plus side, the elevators were very efficient, the staff were very helpful (assisting us to change rooms --though the second room was identical to the first), the rooms are stocked with beverages and snacks (though expensive if you partake), the interior noise level was minimal, there was free fruit near the elevators and free copies of the USA Today made available, and there they had rooms with 2 double beds (a rarity). The restaurant on the premises was expensive (above 25 Euros a meal).

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: ATL-LSU
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms for 6 people, rooms were large for Europe standards, beds very comfortable, has AC but doesnt blow out very cold but ok with window open. Bathrooms large with lots of hot water. Staff is incredibly helpful and friendly. Fitness room is large and better than most in the states. Great location easy to find and get to most places. 2 blocks from Van Gogh about 4 blocks from Flower Market. Lots of clubs and restaraunts nearby. Will stay there again!!!

Reviews.Title: “bad experience”
Reviews.Author: pnatale
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel is in a great location in the museum area of Amsterdam, I had a bad experience, that really ruined the stay. I was there in august, and it was quite hot. When we checked in, I noticed that the room was quite warm, and called the desk. The maintenance man said he would have to open the wall to fix the air, and requested that i be sent to another room. That room, while not quite as warm, never cooled off either. After suffering through a long night, the next morning, I again complained, and the front dest this time told me the engineers had turned off the air the following day, and were turning it back on, and it should be 13 degrees cooler by the end of the day. When I returned to the room at n oon, it was warmer than ever (the sun was now out). I finally gave up and checked into the NH hotel across the street and had a lovely time. The reason I booked a Marriott, was because i am aware that many Hotels in Amsterdam do not have air conditioning, and I knew it would be hot , so i booked a MArriott with air conditioning. I feel I was lied to and got the run around.

Reviews.Title: “Marriot was fine for us!”
Reviews.Author: pamandgary
Reviews.Content: This hotel is central, clean and allows four in a room which is why my three children and I decided to book online. We had requested a non smoking room on the top floor, 2 double beds, baby cot and extra towels and to my surprise all had been arranged - something I hadn't expected! The staff were very helpful and friendly. No complaints!

Reviews.Title: “Not so great.”
Reviews.Author: EUEx-pat
Reviews.Content: Room: We had a corner room with king bed so it was big. We were on the third floor. Decor is outdated. Carpet was pulling away from the wall. Couch in the room had a wooden plank underneath it therefore uncomfortable and made a lot of noise when sitting down. Couch was stained. Bed was comfortable. Bathroom: Grout in the shower was extremely dirty. Tub had stains. Shower curtain had mold on it. Shower pressure was good but temperature was hard to manage. Toilet and sink were okay. Nice toiletries were provided. Service: Very good. Staff was nice and helpful. Let us store our luggage after check-in. Breakfast was okay...they had a good buffet with fruit, scrambled eggs, pastries, etc. You could order an omelet and waffles if you wanted. Amenities: Gift shop, hair cutter on site. Daily parking fee of 25 euros. Neighborhood: walking distance to Rijksmuseum and Van Gogh Museum. We expected more for the price of 235 euros not including parking.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: St._Louie
Reviews.Content: Nice facility in good location. Walk to museums with canal cruise across the street. Next to Vondelpark (watch out for fast-moving bikes!) Clean with quiet rooms. Ask for an "executive room" if you need convenient space for luggage in hallway by room door. Used Marriott points and would stay at this hotel again. Buffet breakfast was good, but too pricey if it's not included in your room rate. Recommend restaurant called Puri Mas within walking distance if you'd like to try the an Indonesian rijsttafel. Smallest fixed price selection is quite sufficient.

Reviews.Title: “Super location, Nice soft Beds”
Reviews.Author: AgentJim
Reviews.Content: We heard lots of horror stories about some of the Amsterdam hotels, not to worry the Marriott is first class. The room was very large and the way the hotel is designed with the Zig-Zag hallways its a quiet hotel compared to most. The bed was very comfortable with many nice soft pillows and a soft comforter. The staff was very friendly and had smiles on their faces, they were very helpful in giving us any info about the area. We were going to take a taxi back to the airport when the desk clerk told us the Bus was more dependable and cost only 20% of what a taxi would cost. I did hear a few tales about the taxi drivers that were not so good. You can take the #370 to the airport, takes about 30-35 minutes runs every 34 minutes or once per hour, the Marriott has bus schedules. Some tips: if arriving for the first time and at Centraal Station they will tell you to watch out for pick pockets, like many places. Make sure when you arrive you know how you are getting to Leidseplein where the Marriott is. This is a 15-20 minute walk and you do not want to do this with a lot of luggage. I would say figure out how you are getting to your hotel and back to the airport before you arrive and get a map to be more familiar with Amsterdam and the long names used by the Dutch. Overall the Dutch are some of the most friendly people I have ever met, but still you want to not be lost or look like an easy target when you arrive. There probably will be a large crowd in the Centraal Station area most of the time, not some wwhere you want to be walking around with big suitcases. The hotel is in a great area for anything you are looking for, 100's of places to eat, shop and have fun. I would stay here again, its on the higher priced end in A-Dam , but still a good value if you are willing to pay $300 or a little more a night. The Photo I included is the street area near the hotel, so when you see this Church you will know the Marriott is close, just a few blacks south. Highly Recommended !

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but a bit dated....”
Reviews.Author: MrTheKid
Reviews.Content: As a Marriott Platinum member, we used points for 3 days of our 5 day stay in Amsterdam and selected the Marriott Amsterdam. The location is incredible! We were fortunate that we had perfect weather and realized you can walk across the entire city in under 35 minutes from the hotel. If you aren't up for the exercise, there is a tram stop less than 100 yds from the Marriott. The 1,2 or 5 tram will take you to the majority of the tourist stops- Red Light district, Centraal Station, Dam Square... The location is directly across from the Leidseplein. This is an incredible square full of bars, restaurants, shops and yes coffeeshops! From the hotel you are within a 5-10 minute walk of the Riksmuseum (Rembrandt collection), Van Gogh museum, Heineken Experience, Holland Casino, Hard Rock, Burger King, Mc Donalds (for those that want American fare). Amsterdam in the summer was incredible- very laid back. We spent many hours having appetizer's and beers along the canals just people watching. I would recommend utilizing the conceirge in the hotel- they are very friendly and helpful. The only negative was the actual shape of the hotel. Unfortunately, the Marriott Amsterdam is a bit dated in the room category. We were given a corner Executive Suite and it was spacious and clean, but just a bit old. However, we quickly learned Amsterdam is very much like Las Vegas- you don't spend much time in your room! With that said, I would highly recommend this property and Amsterdam! I only wish I could be transferred to this city!

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms”
Reviews.Author: AsiaTraveler83
Reviews.Content: Overall, I would have given this hotel an "excellent" rating had the dining options been better. The room we stayed in was very nice, very spacious, and a had a wonderful view out onto the street. We had two queen beds and both worked well with the room. This room was definitely not one of your typical small European rooms. My only large complaint about the property was the dining. The first night, because of jet lag, I ate in the hotel bar. The food wasn't bad, but the service was slow. The other dining options, their "fine dining," didn't look to be too fine, so we opted out of eating there and instead ate across the street at "Bice" which was very good. There is also a Pizza Hut which occupies the hotel building which devalues one's perception of the dining that the hotel offers. I'm in the hotel business and putting a pizza hut in a four star hotel would be something I would avoid at all costs. The service was good as the concierge was very helpful for dinner and for sight seeing. The only small complaint was how long it took to have certain things delivered to the room. I had a power converter delivered to the room and that took what seemed like 20 minutes. Overall, the hotel itself is very nice and the lobby is nicely done. My only complaint is the dining.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: Lievesleys
Reviews.Content: Absolutely fabulous Hotel!!.Service was excellent, rooms large and well equipped, mini bar(re-stocked daily), bath robes, slippers, tv, telephone, internet access and 24 hour room service..Beds were turned down each night and chocolates/sweets left- nice touch.Nothing is to much trouble, the concierge will arrange taxi's, book canal trip/musuem/ trip tickets etc. Booked directly threw marriot for my husbands 40th Birthday.Breakfast and cocktails were included daily in the executive lounge (where internet access was also available).The hotel also has a fully equipped gymnasium. Location perfect right in the Leidesplein area and very convenient for all transport links. Would highly recommend and defiinatley stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “really disappointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I can not believe this hotel has such rating stay away from it, I think it deserve one star the most. The service is really bad and not to mention things disappear from your room and their respond is we are investigating it, they charge you for compelementry coffee, and it takes them five hours to get you a taxi to the air port. Bottom line very expensive for the service for the same money you can get a real 5 star hotel. Trust me stay away. Anti american.

Reviews.Title: “Convient & Friendly”
Reviews.Author: LauraKK
Reviews.Content: We were unexpectedly pleased with the Amsterdam Marriot during our recent 5 day stay there. It was ''tulip season'', and all the cute little canal B&B's were booked, so we grabbed what we could get and took the Marriot. We were afraid it would be an American ''tour bus'' experience, but were so surprised with how nice it was. First of all, the location is terrific. You are 3 minutes away from the major restaurant areas., bus to the airport ($2.50 USD, what a bargain), and several of the canal cruises and the Rembrandt and Van Gough museums. Location could NOT have been any better. The rooms were very large by European standards, and the showers powerful and linens very nice and comfy. The staff was friendly, helpful and knowledgeable about sights in Amsterdam. Despite the large numbers of American tourists, there was always someone at the Concierge waiting for us, and willing to go out of their way to help us with postage for postcards, booking restaurants, getting theatre or museum tickets, etc. The location was perfect, as mentioned. You are within easy walking distance of all the major sites and restaurants, museums. We had a lovely balcony view of the canal, and couldn't have been happier. We'll definitely stay here next time. BTW, breakfast in nice, but way too expensive for Amsterdam. Book without breakfast and explore the area within 3 blocks of hotel for fabulous breadfast fare for 1/5 the cost!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: view2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Amsterdam Marriott during Queensday weekend. Arriving noon Friday there was a long check in / out que. We later learnt this was due to problems with the newly installed computer system, hence express (in-room via TV) check-out was not working and everyone had to queue up in the lobby. First impressions good (despite the queue), staff were welcoming us and smiling. On our previous Amsterdam trips we have had some terrible hotel experiences (i.e. Old Quarter), so we have learned the hard way that AMS hotel rooms are small. The rooms in Marriott were decent sized, though small compared to any US Marriott. Still, nicely appointed and clean. 28" TV, mini bar, wines offered for 7 Euro, which is not bad. Decent amenities in bathroom. Large safe. Ice-machine down the corridor, which suited our party weekend (Queensday) nicely. Nightly turn-down service, which basically is making the bed ready for night and leaving a little chocolate for each guest. Used the business center on Saturday morning, my girlfirend and I each got a 45 min Internet access to the computers in the business center. This set ut back 15 Euros each. Unbelievably pricey. In fact most "extras" were highly priced. We booked through Priceline, thus had no breakfast included. Because it cost 26 Euros each we never ate breakfast at the hotel. Just not worth it for breakfast. Our rate was 108 Euros a night, which I think is a good rate for this hotel standard in Amsterdam. They mentioned Priceline at check-in and that it was pre-paid. No problem. Location is excellent, right in Leidseplein and close to museums. Much nicer area to stay in that Dam Square / Damrak or the Red Light District which we have stayed in previously. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Xamcory
Reviews.Content: Flew to Amsterdam Thursday night and landed about 9:00 am Check in at 11:00 am and was in the room at 11:15 am.. great service and great location, the trams come right in front of the hotel and the square is right there, the coffe shops are very cool recommed rookies, there for two nights, priceless, the offer free beer in the club lounge but charge for the acholol, over all this Hotel was very good, and the Locoation is prime

Reviews.Title: “Accommodation good, service disappointing”
Reviews.Author: kjh888
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Amsterdam for Easter weekend 2006. Overall, it provided a high standard of accomodation, however service was disappointing and I at â‚¬215 a night I wouldn't say it was great value for money. The location of the hotel is great - at the southern end of the Liedelsplein and very close to the Vondelpark. Trams 1,2 and 5 run regularly from the central station and you can pick up a canal tour from very close by. Perhaps it was because we arrived on Good Friday, but the check-in queue was long and slow moving. Our room request of a high floor room and a cot were met however. The room was quite small but spotlessly clean and had most of the expected facilities. We were disappointed at no tea and coffee facilities in the room. The bathroom was dated, but clean - I would expect more from a 5 star hotel however. Our room was supposedly "executive" - I'm not sure what made it qualify for this rating! Breakfast was included in our room rate but costs between 22 and 27 Euros if you purchase separately. We had free and unlimited choice from the buffet which was vast and good quality - masses of choice and even Stollen and easter eggs on Easter Sunday. There were plenty of tables, although we always had to queue to be seated. Staff were helpful and friendly. On our final day they provided breakfast to take away as we had an early flight - this was very convenient. We travelled with a toddler and the hotel catered for this well- a cot was provided in the room and a highchair for breakfast. Staff were considerate towards the need of a small child too. Service on the whole was disappointing for a 5 star hotel - our room only came with one bathrobe, and we asked for another one at reception three times (we stayed three nights, and asked every night). They never delivered and we ended up stopping a passing maid for assistance. It was such a simple request and yet they failed to meet it 3 times! It wasn't important to our stay, but it was the principle. I wouldn't discourage people from staying at this hotel, but feel it is more 4 star than 5 star, and might not be the best example of the Marriott brand.

Reviews.Title: “Large Rooms, Good Heater, Clean Bathrooms, COMFY Beds”
Reviews.Author: ikoihil
Reviews.Content: Large rooms, near Van Gogh Museum and the Leidseplein, friendly service, comfortable beds and duvees, puffy pillows and decent food. Biiiig downside: the street in front of the hotel is VERY loud at night... get a room on the back of the hotel on the highest floor available, unless you plan on being up all night too.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: jengator
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in Holland for a wedding this past January and went to Amsterdam for 3days. I ended up using my Marriott points for a free stay, and though most reviews were good, I still didn't know what to expect. We were impressed... the room was very clean and the service was outstanding (better in fact than we've gotten in the states). Not sure about the food as we always went out to eat... The location is fantastic. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: Steveracer
Reviews.Content: Having had to change from the supposedly 4 Star Hotel we booked into just down the road because of its poor state. This was very nice indeed. The hotel has a good location minutes from connecting trams to and from the main station, with plenty going on, shops,bars and resturants. Our room just over the R on the Marriot sign out the front of the hotel was nice and spacious, clean and tidy. The view to the front of the Hotel was lovely. No problems with any noise. The staff were very helpful and friendly and above all courteous. Nothing was to much trouble. Finding rooms available in this hotel made a pleasent stay in Amsterdam after a dreadful start. Despite the weather we would stay here again and would recommend to others. Please note though we did not eat at the hotel preferring to use resturant facilities outside.

Reviews.Title: “Americanized Hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: wanderlust55
Reviews.Content: Banking on the reputation of Marriot hotels, I booked a weekend at this hotel when I became engaged. The hotel has none of the "european charm" that other luxury hotels in Amsterdam seem to have in abundance. The multilingual hotel staff was knowledgable and able to make reservations at nearby resturants (a must in amsterdam) and arrange for anything our hearts desired. This is a good hotel for families or large groups who need "looking after" but I recommend looking elsewhere if you are interested in local flavor.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: lachen
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights here and found it to be pretty nice. Not a lot of "European Chram" however after 2 weeks at the in laws, I was looking for American comforts. My husband is a platinum member so I have seen my share of Marriotts. While this was not the most luxurious, it was comfortable, clean and the staff was unbelievably friendly. We had an "executive room" and because of the tiny entry way, we were able to put our 2 yo to bed and still read or watch TV. We had a low level room facing the square and had no problem with noise. I also found the breakfast buffet to be very impressive, albeit a little excessive. Regardless, it was a good location and I would absolutely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location... what a deal!!!”
Reviews.Author: markrandom
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel on priceline for the paltry sum of just Â£42. We were totally surprised because it's a fantastic hotel (and we stay in a lot of hotels), smack bang in the middle of the action, near to Vondelpark and the Museumplein (Van Gogh, Rijksmusuem etc...). Leidseplein is just across street! You can catch a No 1, 2 ,5 tram from central station to Liedseplein. Itâ€™s a three minute walk from there. The beds are very comfortable. The mini bar is well stocked and the prices are more than reasonable... just 7 EUROS for a bottle of wineâ€¦ nice Merlot too! Great room service, nice lobby, great concierge, bellman etc... I don't know if I would pay rack rate for this hotel because I never pay rack rate at any hotel anymoreâ€¦ since I discovered priceline. This is undoubtedly the best deal in Amsterdam at this price. If only it had a swimming pool... never mind... I challenge anybody to complain if they get this hotel. Tip: Ask for a Leidseplein view!

Reviews.Title: “An Average Stay - typical multi-national chain”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After a 55 minute flight from Bournemouth plus a manic transfer from the airport is was welcoming to arrive at the Marriott Amsterdam. First impressions from the exterior aren't promising - a drab 80s concrete structure. Once inside however, it improves with a small lobby, bar, gift shop, fitness centre and a choice of restaurants. The staff were very polite and friendly and the rooms booked were located on the 5th floor towards the rear of the hotel (very quiet).
