The rooms themselves were quite large in size, with two double beds - the TV could receive BBC channels (BBC1 & BBC2) which was a bonus. The bathroom however was somewhat dated and had seen better days, with numerous stains around the bath - rather surprising considering this is meant to be an upscale four star hotel. Our rate included breakfast (it is ridiculously expensive if on a room only basis- there are numerous cafes and bars within the immediate vicinity), the full american breakfast was fantastic with a full choice of fresh fruit, cereals, pastries, cooked and waffles - the restraunt staff were wonderful, very friendly and nothing was too much trouble. In summary, the hotel is quite well located for the Van Gogh Museum & Rijiksmuseum - however it is a good 25 minute walk to Dam Square, The Red Light District, Anne Frank Huis & Centraal Station; a tram stop is located within two minutes of the hotel so access to these places is easy. Overall the hotel was pleasant but in need of modernisation in places - next time I would probably stay closer to Dam Square.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful service -- Absolutely dreadful”
Reviews.Author: jimtexas
Reviews.Content: I could go on and on about the dreadful service at this hotel, but i'll just summarize it all with the following statement. The front line staff are not interested in the least with listening to or addressing a customer's needs or concerns. They are only interested in getting you in the door and up to a room--not about any preferences or reservation confirmations. They are all too quick to make excuses--and the same excuses over and over and over again. I'm a Marriott Platinum member and have been for years and have NEVER been treated with such indifference at a Marriott property. The front line people at this hotel do not care about customer service--even their most loyal customers. Now about the actual hotel--it is located in a great area with abundant transportation options. The hotel itself is rather tired. The first room they thought they would put me in was about the size of a postage stamp. After my incessant complaints and talking with just about everyone in the hotel, I was moved to a room that was of normal size. The effort to get moved to this second room was FAR BEYOND any I would have expected.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: penguinsix
Reviews.Content: I see such glowing reviews and I simply can't agree. My stay was nothing special. Mundane is a good word. I didn't find the bathrooms to be overly clean, and the carpet was definitely worn out a bit. This is an older Marriott and in need an upgrade. If the best Marriott in the world is a 4, and the worse a 1, this is a 2..heading downward. The location was quite nice. Make that "can't be beat", but cabbies running from the train station to this hotel will try to rip you off if you don't have the right accent. Staff was quite friendly and helpful. Run stumbler on your PC in the window and you might be able to get a lower cost wifi signal from some nearby buildings rather than the expensive in-room rates they charge at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel provided you stay away from Characters.”
Reviews.Author: Braveheart1296
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally situated for shopping, museums and canal trips. The hotel staff are extremely helpful and friendly. The rooms, even the standard ones have everything you need and are maintained to a very high standard. Breakfast in this Marriott is a must. I think the breakfast experience in this hotel is probably the best we have come across in any major European city we have visited. It is a must for anyone visiting the hotel. The breakfast staff are great. Unfortunately the same cannot be said for the Characterâ€™s Bar and Restaurant within the hotel. During our stay the hotelâ€™s main restaurant was closed on a Sunday and Monday. On the Sunday after a hard dayâ€™s sightseeing we returned to the hotel and decided to have a meal in Characterâ€™s. As the menu was not extensive we decided on Burgers with the instruction that these should be very well done. Half way through the meal we both discovered that the core of the burger was raw. As we had eaten a good bit of the meal we made no complaint. Nevertheless we pointed out the raw meat to the waiter. He apologised and said â€˜I donâ€™t know what was wrong with the kitchen staff tonightâ€™. Yes I would stay at this hotel again but I would not give the Charter's Bar and Restaurant my custom.

Reviews.Title: “Okay - wouldn't stay again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 4 nights last week - using Marriott points so it was free. Hard to argue with that price, but wouldn't stay again. Our first room faced the Leidesplein; sirens three times during the night woke our baby up screaming. Moved to another room the next day (no problem from the front desk), but in that room the A/C wasn't working the first night, fixed afterward. Typical Marriott decor, room size and layout. Bathrooms in need of serious cleaning/regrouting. Not bad, just no character at all. The hotel supplied a "crib", an ancient pack-and-play type with no mattress to speak of. I expected better from a Marriott, which I think describes my feelings about our entire stay - I expected better. On the plus side - a convenient location next to the Vondelpark and close to the museums.

Reviews.Title: “One of the few good ones”
Reviews.Author: mark60657
Reviews.Content: Great service, unbeatable location...where in Europe you have to struggle to fit into the 2x4 bathroom space, this hotel has a great bath, close to Leidesplein (1min walk), Tram 2/5 stop right outside, also close to all museums...bars/clubs...Best to book on priceline, select 4 star and put a price of $80-90/night, more than likely you will get this, its one of the very few 4 star hotels in AMS taht is on priceline. They even have a turndown service!! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Mishark
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights - although possibly not the best exterior, beautiful interior, foyer, rooms, bar etc. Friendly staff, couldn't have asked for more. One problem, heard noisy guests in next room, informed management, problem immediately rectified. Highly Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great trip”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We went to Amsterdam From April 28th thru May 4th. The hotel is right at the city center. Close to everything. The accomodations were nice, the people that worked there were more than helpful. We purchased our trip through Priceline.com and got a great deal. We highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Marriott located in the Leidesplein area. When I first saw the building for the Marriott I got a little worried, b/c it doesn't look that great from the outstide, but as soon as we stepped inside I knew it would be great! Our room was on the 6th floor, with a balcony and very clean. The staff was extremely helpful and courteous, we checked in with zero problems and everyone was more than willing to help us with directions or suggestions for places to go to. The hotel was very easy to get to, it could not have been any easier, and you can basically walk everywhere from the hotel. We did use the Tram, but mainly walked all over the city without a problem. We purchased most of our tickets to the museums from the concierge which turned out to be great, b/c we did not have to wait in any lines!! we paid $122/night on priceline. Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, $110 on Priceline”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel is one block from the tram station (convenient for luggage) and a 20 minute stroll through interesting neighborhoods from Centraal Train Station. When we arrive around 9:30 am we were told that they were cleaning a "very nice" room for us. It couldn't have been better-on the fourth floor-directly facing the intersection. We had fun watching the trams, pedestrians and bikers and the more distant view of Liedersplein with its cafes and nighttime performers. The room was totally soundproofed so there was no noice despite the hubub outside. When I have bid on priceline before and contacted the hotel to ask for a room with a non smoking room with two beds, I have invariably been told that my request would be noted but that there was no guarantee with priceline. In this instance, the hotel promptly emailed me that they would be happy to meet my request. Front desk and concierge staff were very friendly and helpful. Two canalboats departed from across the street, there is a pancake house also in the square across the street, a tourist information office, shopping, cafes, bakeries etc. one block away.

Reviews.Title: “For $100/night on Priceline, man what a deal...”
Reviews.Author: charlesturner
Reviews.Content: Our low nightly rate probably colored our view of this place, but at $100 a night I think its a great value. First, the location: the Marriot is between the Leidesplein and Vondelpark, which is really a great area. The Liedesplein is the party center of Amsterdam, and is chock full of restaurants, bars, coffeeshops and other people partying. Vondelpark/Museumplein, as the name implies, contains a nice park and some world class museums. Second, the property is really deluxe. It has uniformed doormen, bellman and concierge. There are two eateries, a bar, a gift shop and a gratis morning coffee concession in the lobby. There is a free laundry on the second floor. Okay, so from the outside it does resemble the Politburo Marriot - but I didn't care how it looked on the outside. Third, the rooms are "nice for Europe." That is, our room had a safe, ironing board, iron, unbelievably comfortable king sized bed and a small television. As is mentioned in other reviews, the heating and cooling leaves something to be desired, but by opening and closing the window, we were able to stay comfortable. The bath is large and the shower is great. The concierge staff was extremely helpful. This old dude gave me directions to the Dampkring Coffee Shop without batting an eye. Hell he plotted it out on a map. Another of the concierge staff gave us the heads up on beating the line at the Van Gogh Museum by selling us our tickets (at the same price as the museum). We strolled past the other art fans and were checking out the Potato Eaters in no time at at all. Getting there was easy from Schiphol Airport. We hopped a $5 train from the airport to Centraal Station. We then hopped on a tram (lines 1, 2 or 5) and were at the Marriot ten minutes later. When you get on the tram, tell the conducter that you need to get off at the Marriot and he or she will tell you when to get off over the PA. Transportation around Amsterdam is easy from the Marriot. Three different tram lines run from Central Station by the hotel all day. We explored the whole city by jumping on and off trams. We found the Dutch to be the coolest people on earth. They speak English better than I do, they are very friendly and are perhaps the best looking people on the face of the earth. We cannot wait to go back. If I had to pay more than $100, I would be far less enthusiastic. But for the price we paid, it was the best deal in town.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: SWAMPRAT
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the location of the Amsterdam Marriott. There are bars, restaurants and coffee shops everywhere within walking distance. It's also within walking distance to the main museums (Van Gogh, Riks Museum, etc.). The best restaurant we ate at was Puri Mas (ristafjel - typical Indonesian rice table meal). The food was excellent, plentiful and the staff were friendly and accommodating. The only problem we had was with the A/C in our room. If you are concerned about being able to control the climate in your room, make sure you ask if the A/C or heating is individually controlled when you make the reservation. I found out that in these older hotels in Europe, even if there is a thermostat in your room, that doesn't mean that you can really control the temperature. It's pretty much on winter (heating) or summer (cooling) overall, and controlled from a central location. Fortunately, we were able to keep our room cool by opening the window. Other than that, the rooms were clean, beds were comfortable (double beds instead of twins is a plus) and the location is excellent. I'd definitely stay here again.

HotelInfo.Name: Marriott Amsterdam
HotelInfo.Address: Stadhouderskade 12, Amsterdam 1054 ES, The Netherlands
